loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 45-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six sons. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, thus impacting his ability to generate income.

Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairs. Therefore, Saima has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw.

loans.use: to pay for rickshaw repairs.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 50-year-old married woman with three children. She has done animal sales with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent living.

Musarat is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing. She has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for more poultry to raise and sell

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa is a 46-year-old married Lebanese woman with four children. She has operated a bakery for ten years. She is a very hard worker and does not tire of work because she aims to develop it and benefit from it. Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas so as to to buy new merchandise for her business such as oil and flour to increase productivity and improve her revenue. Wafaa would like to earn a greater income and she believes that the loan will help her achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise for her bakery.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Shown in this photo with her husband, Hamida is 46 years old. Some years ago she started sewing as a business to help in running her household. Admired by her community, she is a very talented lady who excels in her sewing. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Hamida has now requested a loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf to buy more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors to stitch up and quickly finish more dresses. She wishes to spend any boost in her earnings on providing a quality life for her family members.

loans.use: to buy more sewing supplies so she can stitch up and quickly finish more dresses.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 50-year-old married woman. She is a mother of 7 children. She and her husband are involved in business selling animals. Parveen looks after the animals for a year or two and her husband sells them out in the local market.  Currently, Parveen has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle to sell in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to sell in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for medical expenses (special tests)

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en: Zahraa is a 22-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children, both of whom are still attending school. Zahraa provides her family with extra financial support through her work in the agriculture sector.  She has been working in the business since 2008. Zahraa is requesting a youth loan from Kiva's partner Vitas so as to purchase seeds and manure for her agricultural project. This loan will help her improve her productivity. In the future, these changes will increase her returns and result in higher profits.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and manure for her agricultural project.

loans.name: Ferial

texts.en:
Ferial is a 56-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. She has been working since 25 years ago at her house in tailoring to help her family to meet the needs of life. She is well-known in her region by her good reputation and good work. 

To better develop her work, Ferial is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She will be using the loan to buy new textiles for her business. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and, thus, will improve her income percentage.

loans.use: to buy new textiles for her business

loans.name: Mwakauli

texts.en:
Mwakauli is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwakauli operates a vegetable stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for horticultural farm inputs

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 42 years old. She is a married woman and a mother of seven children. She is working hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. She and her husband have been doing work in agriculture for some years. They crop different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.  

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides, currently Shazia has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops, which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima  is 40 years old and a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products. 

Currently, she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR  to purchase more grocery items, including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea, to cater to the maximum number of customers for generating a healthier source of income. She is positive about their future earnings and will spend part of their income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items, including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea, to cater to the maximum number of customers for generating a healthier source of income.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en: Saira is a 30-year-old married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family's income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household's expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Makich

texts.en:
Makich lives with his big family in Sevan, in the Gegharkunik region. Makich graduated State University with a degree specialising in economics and now he runs his own business at the city wholesale market in a rented stall. He sells clothes for women, men and children. He has been in the clothes trading business since 2008 and during this time he has gained a lot of loyal customers. 

Makich is the only bread-winner in his family since his wife is busy with the care of their children (two boys and a girl) and his father who lives with them is retired. Makich’s second son and daughter are still school-aged. His elder son is a student and he studies at the State University in the faculty of social government. He is in his first year of studying here, in the paid division.  

Makich asks for this loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to pay his son’s tuition fee for second semester. He is thankful and grateful beforehand for the loan as it will be a great help to his family.

loans.use: to pay his son’s tuition fee for second semester of university.

loans.name: Samaxi

texts.en:
Samaxi is 57 years old; she lives in her own home with her husband, who is a shopkeeper. She has been selling natural honey for 20 years in the neighbourhood and nearby towns. With the earnings from her sales and the help of her husband, they are able to get ahead.

Samaxi has had problems with her health and she needs extra income to pay her medical expenses. For this reason she is requesting a loan of 1,200 AZN to buy medicine. Please support her.

loans.use: to pay her medical expenses.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is 60 years old. She is a married woman with three children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Now, Zahida has requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Zahida expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on taking care of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 24-year-old married woman who has been involved for many years in the business of buying and selling animals with the help of her husband. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her family with good quality food, health and clothing. 

Kalsoom has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Satenik

texts.en:
Satenik lives with her beloved husband and three school-aged children in the village Tsovagyugh in the Gegharkunik region. Satenik grew up in a peasant family, and farming and agriculture are familiar to her. These are the main activities that she is engaged in now. Satenik’s husband is employed and he works all day long so all of the care of the farm is up to Satenik. 

On her farm, which is very cute, she has cows, a bull and chickens. Satenik sells milk and macun (a national dairy product similar to yoghurt), as well as eggs to her neighbors and buyers from the city. Satenik also cultivates potatoes and greens which she sells at the city wholesale market during the week to re-sellers or to her regular customers. 

She is asking for this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams as she needs to buy potato seedlings, diesel fuel for sowing activities and also some animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, diesel fuel for sowing activities and also some animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 30-year-old married Lebanese man with two children who are attending school. He has been working for four years in the agriculture field in collaboration with his wife to meet their needs. To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting a loan today from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy new seeds and manure which he needs to continue production. 

He expects an increase in his income as he is expanding his work and hopes that his business will grow more in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy new seeds and manure.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
In 2010 Rose started a business that changed her life: dairy farming. 

Dairy farming is something that is more of a passion for Rose than a business. She started pursuing her passion in the year 2010. She is a hardworking and honest farmer who is based in Lolminingai, a remote village in the Nandihills area of Kenya. For the past five years, she has been making a small living through practicing mixed farming. 

Her primary source of income has been selling milk, maize and eggs to the nearby market. She also engages in a personal business, or “side hustle” as she likes to call it, to earn additional income. Rose passionately loves dairy farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is accessing funds to increase her business. Through Juhudi Kilimo, an organization that supports enterprising farmers, she acquired her first loan, which she used to buy an additional cow. She paid the loan back fully. She also benefited from training and the impact of the first loan cannot be underestimated. 

Rose is seeking another loan from Juhudi Kilimo, via Kiva lenders, to buy a quality breed of dairy cow. The cow she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 10-12 litres of milk a day. A litre of milk costs 50 KES. With this loan, Rose's life will change and she will be able to secure the future of her school-going children. She will also assure her ageing parents of a secure future. Rose waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of cow.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Mark. Mark is a seasoned farmer from Mweru location in Central Kenya. Mark does the hard work of fetching water from the river and pouring it on a tank for storage. This water is used both for domestic use and for irrigating his plants. 
In a bid to simplify his work and improve efficiency, Mark is planning to buy a water pump. Unfortunately, all his income is committed to family needs so he is unable to buy a water pump without leveraging his assets to secure external financing. Lucky for him, he is a member of Juhudi Kilimo, Kiva's field partner. Help Mark find a simple and effective solution to bring water to his home and farm by lending a $25 loan. Your investment will save him the time and energy spent on fetching water which he could then apply to his other income-generating activities, for example, his motorcycle transportation business.

loans.use: to buy a water pump.

loans.name: Shahida Parveen

texts.en:
Shahida Parveen is the responsible mother of seven children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for fifteen years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Shahida Parveen's husband need to do some maintenance on his taxi because it is not is a good condition and requires repairs on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to do this maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Shahida Parveen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Shahida Parveen's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profit. 

Shahida Parveen also plans to make savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future. Shahida Parveen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Varsenik

texts.en:
This lady's name is Versenik and she is 19 years old. She has a husband and a pretty daughter who is a year old. They live in the village Tsovagyugh in the Gegharkunik region. 

Since she got married so young, Versenik did not manage to have any other education after her school graduation. Now with her lovely husband, Varsenik takes care of the farm, which is a rather rich one: cows, calves, a heifer, a pig, sheep, lambs and chickens. Varsenik mentions that she works with great enthusiasm and very hard as she wants to have a bigger and richer farm, which will provide better living conditions for her young family. Their land is also rich with harvest which they use both for their family and for sale as well: they sell potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes and greens. Varsenik says that she has already been taught the skills of cheese making and, together with the sale of milk, meat and eggs, very soon she will also start the sale of cheese. 

Varsenik greatly hopes that Kiva lenders will help her family in their first steps establishing their farm. She plans to spend the loan on the purchase of a calf, a sheep and a lot of animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a calf, a sheep and a lot of animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 38 years old and lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children that are now at their school age. 
Marilyn formerly worked as an OFW but she chooses not to be away with her family. At present, she earns a living from the rice retailing business. She’s been engaged in this business for 5 years already. Marilyn earns approximately 20,000 PHP each month. She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing 15 additional sacks of rice for her rice retailing business. Marilyn has been a member of PMPC for almost 3 years. In the future, she hopes to have her own rice retailing stall at the public market and in her house.

loans.use: to purchase 15 additional sacks of rice.

loans.name: Meridian

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Meridian works hard to support her family.

She has an internet café business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending and variety store businesses. Meridian is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy computer supplies for her internet café business.

Meridian has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies for her internet café.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Mary, 61 years of age, a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Kabolebo, a remote village in Nandi Hills, Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with 6 adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 27 years and has gained a great deal of experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. 

To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. The Nandi hills area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the high demand. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Being a woman and accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry. As a result of the loan, she will sell more eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry market to other markets; this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, change her living conditions, and secure the future of her grandchildren.

loans.use: to pay for poultry.

loans.name: Jamile

texts.en:
Jamile is a 45-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three school aged children. Jamile works hard to show her determination of being able to improve her family’s way of living. 

She started her own job by opening her bakery 15 years ago. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l to increase her bakery inventory by purchasing flour and oil.  She states that the loan will surely help her extend her job and increase her income by a large percentage. In the future, she plans to borrow more Kiva loans to further develop her work.

loans.use: to increase her bakery inventory.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 22-year-old Lebanese married woman with five children. Her husband is the main income earner of the family through his work in the paint business. In 2011, she decided to help her spouse and so she opened a bakery. Mariam works tirelessly to be able to satisfy their needs. She is a very hard worker and she endeavors to develop her business and profits from it. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy materials for her bakery production in order to increase productivity and enhance her income. Mariam is a positive person, always looking at the best in things and plans to receive more Kiva loans to keep on improving her family’s way of living.

loans.use: to buy materials for her bakery

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 47-year-old hardworking woman who has 3 children. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes for people within her community. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Anwar ’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. 

Over the years, Anwar has established a good clientele. She has requested a loan amount of 45,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces that will help her meet the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for her family's prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Abraham. Abraham is a 30-year-old farmer from Meguin in the North Rift area of Kenya. Abraham is chiefly a dairy farmer but he is also involved in other income generating opportunities around him. 

As a dairy farmer, one of Abraham's challenges is getting his product from the farm to the distant Eldoret town market. To solve this problem, Abraham is seeking a loan of KES 60,000 to top up on his savings to buy a motorcycle. With your loan investment, Abraham will buy a courier-modified motorcycle made in India which is popular among Kenya's rural farmers and is suitable for remote environments with poor road networks. The immediate impact to be expected from the loan is convenient and speedy transportation of Abraham's produce to the market.

loans.use: to buy a farm goods transportation motorcycle

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 39-year-old, married woman. She lives with her husband and two children. Her husband is the main income provider for the family. 

For the past two years, Fatmeh has been working in the agriculture field in order to earn extra salary and be able to support her family financially. Today, she is asking for a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase seeds and seedlings for plantings for her business. 

She is well-known in her region by her good reputation. She is certain that with the new merchandise, she will be able to increase her income

loans.use: to purchase seeds and seedlings for her business.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
This man is 26 years old and he has a young, nice family. He and his wife and one-year-old daughter live in the house of Davit’s parents, with his father and mom. Davit lives and runs a farm in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Here Davit, with the great help of his father, established a farm as a source of income for his young and lovely family. Davit’s wife is a housewife and with the help of Davit’s mother she takes care of their small daughter. 

Davit’s farm is not small one; here he takes care of cows, calves, pigs, sheep and lambs. He perfectly organizes the sale of milk and meat such as pork, mutton and beef from his farm (the buyers are mainly butchers from the city markets). Having no other occupation other than farming, Davit is completely devoted to his farm and hopes that very soon the income from it will grow more thanks to the hard work he puts into it.

This loan of 700,000 Armenian drams. Davit plans to use it for the purchase of two calves and also a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two calves and animal fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Marlene es una mujer de 38 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos de 1, 10 y 16 años, y su negocio es la venta de pan.
Ella es buena madre, constante, amable, comprometida con su trabajo, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el barrio ‘Nueva Esperanza’ un lugar en el centro de la ciudad abarrotado de tiendas comerciales en todas las áreas, de clima tropical con una temperatura promedio de 27-32 grados centígrados durante todo el año. 
Marlene es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español para el negocio que realiza (de pie, la 2 de la izquierda, viste solera negra y pantalón rosado). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijos; los 2 mayores estudian en la escuela el menor aún no está en edad escolar, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su necesidad por darles a sus hijos un futuro mejor la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; tienda de barrio, venta de sandalias, venta de comida, venta de bisutería, venta de refrescos y venta de ropa de bebé, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de pan, ella se encarga de hornear panes típicos y tradicionales como; Cuñapé (Pequeño bollo hecho de harina de yuca con queso), Empanada de arroz (Horneado de arroz y queso), Empanada de jigote (Masa delgada de harina de trigo rellena con mezcla de carne o pollo y verduras), Arepas (Panqueques de harina de maíz mezclados con queso), Salteña (Masa delgada de trigo rellena con carne, papas, huevo duro y verduras), Bizcochos de trigo (Bollitos duros de harina de trigo), y otros. Actividad que realiza durante todos los días de la semana. “inicie mi negocio vendiendo de forma ambulante, actualmente cuento con un cuarto dónde expongo y oferto mis variedades de panes…” comenta. Su sueño es ser la elegida por los clientes de la zona, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de mesas y sillas para que sus clientes tengan la comodidad de comer dentro y fuera de la panadería. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene realizando esta actividad de manera independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Marlene solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para que sus clientes puedan degustar sus deliciosas masas en su panadería.
texts.en:
Marlene is 38 years old, married and has three children, ages sixteen, ten and one years old. She has a business selling bread.

Marlene is a good mother. She is persevering, friendly, responsible, hard-working, and dedicated to her job. She runs her business in the Nueva Esperanza barrio, in the centre of the city. She is surrounded by shops offering products for every need. Here, there is a tropical climate, with the daily average temperature oscillating between 27 and 32º Celsius.

Marlene has dark skin, and long dark hair, which she ties up. She has dark eyes and is short, with a robust figure. Marlene’s native language is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family; she also speaks Spanish at her business. In the photo, Marlene is second from the left in the back row, wearing a black top and pink trousers.

Marlene shares her life with her husband, a trader, and their children. The two eldest children are in school while the youngest is not yet old enough to be in education. The family owns the house where they live. It is made of bricks, and has running water, electricity, and is connected to the sewage system.

Marlene’s need to provide her children with a better future brought her to lead a communal bank with various businesses at its core, including a grocery shop, a business selling watermelons, a restaurant, a jewellery business, and businesses selling soft drinks and baby clothes.

The group has come together in order to apply for a loan and to improve the members’ respective businesses.

Marlene herself has a business selling bread. She is responsible for producing traditional and typical breads, such as: “cuñapé” (a small roll made with yucca flour and cheese); “empanada de arroz” (a pastry made with rice and cheese); “empanada de jigote” (a pastry made with a thin, wheat-flour dough and filled with chicken or meat and vegetables); “arepas” (pancake-shaped snacks made with corn and cheese); “salteña” (a thin wheat dough filled with meat, potato, boiled egg and vegetables); “bizcochos de trigo” (hard rolls made with wheat flour); and other items.

Marlene works every day. She says, “I started my business selling as a street vendor. I now have a room where I display and sell a variety of breads.” 

Marlene’s dream is to be the favourite baker of local customers. She wants to expand her business by buying chairs and tables so that her customers will be comfortable eating inside and outside of her bakery. This is Marlene´s first loan with the organisation in a year of running her business alone.

For all of the above reasons, Marlene is applying for a loan in order to buy chairs and tables so that her customers' can enjoy the delicious treats at her bakery.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables so that her customers' can enjoy the delicious treats at her bakery.

loans.name: Lirios De Villa Adela Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LIRIOS DE VILLA ADELA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elsa es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, venta de verduras, venta de tarjetas telefónicas, venta de frutas, servicio de llamadas, venta de ropa interior.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elsa es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio por el incentivo de una amiga quien le hizo notar la carencia de este negocio en su calle, es por ello que decide implementarlo con un poco capital que tiene.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fideo, aceite y arroz por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Lirios de Villa Adela” communal bank is beginning its first loan cycle through Pro Mujer’s Vella Adela regional office. The group has eight members and is run by a board of directors that has Elsa as its treasurer. The members have different types of businesses, including: a grocery shop, selling clothes, selling vegetables, selling phone cards, selling fruits, telephone call services, and selling underwear.

This loan will benefit small businesses in Elsa’s group. Elsa herself says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, following an invitation during a large promotional campaign carried out by the organisation in her local area. Elsa currently runs a grocery store. She says that she was encouraged to start this business by a friend who pointed out that there was a need for a grocery shop in her street. As a result, Elsa started her business with the little capital that she had.

This loan will be used to increase assets by buying pasta, oil and rice in bulk from the wholesales in the city of La Paz. Elsa will later sell on these products. This work allows Elsa to earn a living to support her family. She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Elsa responds saying that she likes the training that is offered by the organisation.

loans.use: to buy pasta, oil and rice in bulk.

loans.name: Cesar David

texts.es:
El socio Cesar David, pertenece al banco comunal PACHAPACCARI,el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Cesar David continua con su negocio de imprenta, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, él socio continua realizando sus trabajos para sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de papeles, tintas entre otros.
texts.en:
Cesar David is a member of the “Pachapaccari” communal bank in the province and department of Cusco. 

Cesar continues to run his printing business. He is grateful for this loan and promises to make his repayments. Cesar continues to do jobs for customers as this allows him to help his family to get ahead.

Cesar is applying for a loan in order to buy paper, ink and other items.

loans.use: to buy paper, ink and other items.

loans.name: Cinthya Masina

texts.es:
La socia Cinthya, pertenece al banco comunal PACHAPACCARI, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia continua con su negocio de imprenta, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua elaborando trabajos para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de papeles, tintes para impresión entre otros.
texts.en:
Cinthya is a member of the “Pachapaccari” communal bank in the province and department of Cusco. 

Cinthya continues to run her printing business. She is grateful for this loan and promises to make her repayments. Cinthya continues to do jobs for customers. She is responsible and determined as this work allows her to help her family to get ahead.

Cinthya is applying for a loan in order to buy paper, ink and other products.

loans.use: to buy paper and ink for printing, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to carry out building works in his house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy "pagnes wax" (colorful and decorative pieces of fabric)

loans.name: Đào

texts.en:
Mrs Dao works in agriculture and has been farming poultry and cattle for eight years. She is 35 years old and married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, Thanh Hoa province, in northern Vietnam.

This is Dao's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main hardship that she faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

Dao hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pagnes [bright, colorful fabric]

loans.name: Lemigio

texts.en:
Lemegio is a 49-year-old Ugandan man who is married to Dinavensi, with whom he has four school age children.
His main source of income is farming and he raises cattle, but he also grows crops like maize for additional income so he can maintain his family.
He has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from UGAFODE to buy more cattle for fattening, which he can later sell for a profit.
His dream for the future is to acquire more land for farming and agriculture. Lemigio appreciates Kiva lenders and UGAFODE for their work in fighting poverty.

loans.use: to buy more cattle

loans.name: Muis

texts.en:
This is Muis and Mimoza. His wife wants to pay for their granddaughter’s operation and they’re seeking your compassion on this matter. Their daughter gave birth to the little one about a year and a half ago and very soon afterwards they came to realize that she was born with a shorter leg compared to the other. Unfortunately, their daughter cannot get a loan from VFA because she lives in a part of the country where VFA does not serve.

Mimoza works in a shoe factory in their city and Muis works in construction. Their oldest son (25yrs) works in Italy and sends money to help them out as well.

loans.use: to pay for their granddaughter's surgery.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet lives with his big family in a frontier village of the Gosh of Tavush region. He is married and he has three school-aged children, two daughters and a son. With Hamlet also lives his grandmother, who is a pensioner.

Hamlet used to work at a private company, but he is now only interested in farming and agriculture. He travels seasonally to the Russian Federation to work, with the chance to increase his family's income. The period when he is abroad his wife tries to take care of things. But Hamlet likes to that say nobody can properly care of his farm as he can. On his farm Hamlet is skilled in swine breeding and poultry. He also sells pork, poultry, and eggs. His plot of land is also rich and it gives harvests of beans, potatoes and fruits, such as plum, fig, nuts and mulberry. He sells these goods locally to his regular customers.

This loan Hamlet really hopes to receive will be used to buy several pigs (for swine breeding) and fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy several pigs and fodder.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen lives in Achajur, which is a frontier village of the Tavush region. His family consists of his beloved wife and three children, two daughters and a son. For many years Armen works at a private cargo transfer company and on his own track. Several times during the day he makes cargo transfers around the region.

In addition, Armen and his family do farming and agriculture. He has a cow, a calf, a bull, chickens and bee families. The sale of his farm products, such as milk, meat, eggs and honey, occupy his wife. The land cultivation manages Armen, on which he raises potato, greens, peppers and tomatos. He mentions that despite being employed and lacking proper care for his farm, Armen has more new plans connected with his farm.

With this loan, Armen wants to develop swine breeding. He will purchase pigs and animal fodder. This will be great for his farm cattle until the fields are full with fresh green grass.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal fodder.

loans.name: Muzazi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Elie fait partie du groupe  Muzazi II et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 31 ans et est marié à Dyna, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 1mois à 9 ans, dont  1 étudie.
Il a sous sa charge 1 enfant membre de sa famille élargie qui étudie. 

Il  fait le commerce du lait de beauté, des sachets, des biscuits,…dans sa boutique  depuis  12 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de lait de beauté, de sachets  et de biscuits, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait augmenter son capital  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Elie is a member of the Muzazi II group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 31 years old and is married to Dyna, a famer. Together they have three children, aged from one month to nine years old. One of the children goes to school. He also takes care of one child from his extended family, who also goes to school.

Elie has been selling, among other things, body lotion, bags, and cookies in his shop for 12 years. He is on his second loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of body lotion, bags, and cookies, which he will resell and earn more. 

In the coming years, Elie would like to increase his capital and see his children go to school.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of body lotion, bags, and cookies

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Una de las razones por las que una sonrisa sincera se marca en la cara de Juan, es porque se siente muy agradecido con MiCrédito, Kiva y todas las personas que le apoyaron en su última inversión, con la cual pudo comprar unos terneros para desarrollo y arar el terreno para cultivar su maíz. Este productor agropecuario tiene más de 32 años siendo agricultor y ganadero, donde siente que está en una buena racha laboral. 
Ahora con unas cuantas vacas unos preciosos terneros que muestran el cariño hacia su dueño, confirma cómo va fortaleciendo cada día más su negocio. Por esta razón solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar dos terneros para criarlos y seguir con su trabajo de compra y venta de estos pequeños. Esta inversión le ayudará a tener nuevas ganancias con este trabajo que tanto le apasiona.
texts.en:
One of the reasons why you can see a genuine smile on Juan's face is that he feels very grateful to MiCredito, Kiva and everyone who helped bring him his last loan. With this loan he was able to buy a few calves to develop and plough the land where he grows corn. 

He is an agricultural producer with more than 32 years of experience as a farmer and breeder. He feels he is currently experiencing a good run of work. 

Now he has a few cows and some beautiful calves who are show him a lot of affection. This confirms that he his building his business every day. 

He is requesting a new loan so he can buy two calves to breed and continue with his work of buying and selling calves. 

This investment will help him to make additional earnings in this area of work that he is so passionate about.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Onua Do Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the Onua Do Group, who are from Teshie-Accra, a city in Ghana. They are all local entrepreneurs who sell charcoal, groceries, fish, gari (cassava flour), waakye (cooked rice and beans), cassava, corn dough, vegetables, salt fish, food joint, ladies dresses, slippers, materials and slippons.

This is their fifth loan from ID-Ghana, a partner of Kiva, and they are applying for a loan of GHS 12,000 in total. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and improve their living conditions.

Beatrice is the featured borrower of this group. The 59-year-old is married with four children. She has been a businesswoman for ten years, selling charcoal and groceries (Milo, Milk, sugar, toffee, biscuit, sardine, noodles). With her share of this loan, she will buy charcoal and wholesale groceries from the main market and sell them to her customers. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 26-year-old married mother of one child. She has been working since three years at her house, selling homemade foods to help her family meet their daily needs and improve their lifestyle. Today, she is requesting a loan from Vitas s.a.l. to improve her merchandise in order to give the best products to her clients. Her clients love her products and they are so grateful for her. She has a good reputation in her hometown.

In the future, Sabah plans to apply for an additional Kiva loan to develop her business.

loans.use: to improve her homemade food business merchandise.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann's first business was running a school canteen. She managed it for 11 years but eventually her circumstances meant she was not able to continue. Mary Ann then decided to establish her own variety store, which has been operating for nine months. Aside from selling grocery items, she also offers a variety of vegetables and other food items. Mary Ann would like her store to run smoothly, which is why she is seeking additional capital of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). She will use this to buy more grocery items and vegetables to sell. She hopes her loan will be approved.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit lives with her nice family in the city of Sevan in the Gegharkunik region. Lilit has a higher education and, for 21 years, has worked at the local school as a mathematics teacher.  

Lilit is married and has a son, who works at a bank. Lilit’s husband is a very famous and respected architecture in their city. 

Recently, Lilit’s son got married, and his nice wife is still a student at the State University. She attends the Gavar city branch of the paid division of the faculty of Russian Language and Literature. She is in her third year of study, and it is time to pay her tuition. 

Lilit and her husband want to surprise her son and his wife. Lilit asks for this loan to pay the tuition fee for the second semester. She wants to see the young couple happy and smiling, and this financial support will be a good surprise for her daughter-in-law.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for the second semester for her daughter-in-law

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 21-year-old single man from Gaza city.  His father has a small store for selling old outlet clothes. Ahmad helps his father in his work. He would like to improve the store and expand it in the future. 

Ahmad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of clothes for his store. By taking this loan, Ahmad's sales will increase and also his income. 

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes for his store.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina, 30, is the mother of one child. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her son is a vegetable seller by profession. He sells tomatoes, potatoes and onions, etc. Her son is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Robina's son needs to purchase different types of vegetables to resell so that he can build his business, improve his sales and earn maximum profit. Due to his unfavorable financial position, however, he is not in a position to purchase vegetables for his business.

Therefore, Robina has applied for a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan to help her son purchase more vegetables for business purposes.
 
Robina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her son build his vegetable business

loans.name: Sabra

texts.en:
Sabra is a 53-year-old woman and mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by trade; he sells fruit, e.g., apples, bananas, grapes, etc. Her husband is the only person responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household finances.

Sabra's husband needs to purchase different types of fruit for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position her husband is not in a position to purchase fruit for his business purposes.

Therefore Sabra has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to expand her husband's fruit business

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 42-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of a daughter. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by trade. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.

Therefore Nargis has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Nargis is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC  Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Hammad

texts.en:
Hammad is a 26-year-old married man from Khan Younis city. He is a father of one small son. Hammad works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He also has a stall selling clothes. It is a good business and supports the family with a good income.

Hammad took a USD  loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of clothes to resell in his stall. By taking this loan, Hammad's sales will increase and also his income.

Hammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes to resell in his stall

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 31-year-old married man from Khanyounis city. He is a father for three sons and one daughter. Rami works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. He also has a stall for selling clothes. It is a good business and supports the family with a good income.

Rami took a USD  loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of clothes to resell in his stall. By taking this loan, Rami's sales will be increased and also his income.

Rami appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes to resell in his stall.

loans.name: Yosri

texts.en:
Yosri is a 32-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father for two kids. Yosri works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. He also has a store for selling used clothes. It is a good business and supports the family with a good income.

Yosri took a USD  loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a collection of used clothes to resell in his store. By taking this loan, Yosri's sales will be increased and also his income.

Yosri appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a collection of used clothes to resell in his store

loans.name: Mwakutanga

texts.en:
Mwakutanga is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cashew nut business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase six sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Mwadzambo

texts.en:
Mwadzambo is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan of 50,000 KES she is requesting, Mwadzambo wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his horticultural farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery items such as cooking ingredients, juice drinks, snack foods and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Pedro Joaquin

texts.es:
Don Pedro de semblante fuerte a primera vista, ha trabajado por cuatro años en su pulpería, negocio que inició con el deseo de ser su propio jefe, se llevó a cabo con su propio dinero. Este hombre que al atenderte te regala una sonrisa y hace olvidar la primera impresión, tiene 59 años de edad y vive con su esposa que lo apoya incondicionalmente.
Pedro tiene expectativas muy altas, sueña ver su negocio como una de las mejores distribuidoras de su vecindario, por lo que no duda en seguir invirtiendo en él. Por esta razón solicita un crédito para comprar caramelos, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, jabón, entre otros productos de mayor venta. Esto le permitirá aumentar sus ganancias y seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pedro, who shows a tough face at first sight, has been working in his grocery store for forty years. He began this business wanting to be his own boss, and implemented it with his own money. 

This man tends the store with a smile that makes his customers forget first impressions. He's 59 years old, and lives with his wife who stands by him unconditionally.

Pedro holds high expectations, he dreams to see his store become one of the best distributors in the neighborhood, and  to this end he continues to invest in the business without a doubt.

He's requesting a loan to buy candy, sugar, rice, beans, soap, and other best-selling products. This will allow him to increase his profits and continue to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy candy, sugar, rice, beans, and soap, among other products.

loans.name: Otinkorang Group

texts.en:
This is Dromo group, and it is comprised of two ladies who live in Teshie-Accra, Ghana. They applied for a loan, in the total amount of GHS 4,000, to invest into the sale of smoked fish, gari (cassava flour), sugar, second-hand bags, ladies' clothes, and earrings.

Richlove is a hardworking woman. She is a 32-year-old, single woman, with no children. She lives alone, in Teshie. She is the featured borrower of this group. Richlove studied till Elementary school, but she couldn't complete her studies. Richlove started her business, selling second-hand bags and earrings at her residence, more than 15 years ago. She started her business with a small amount of working capital, thanks to the assistance of her friend, who supported her financially.

Year by year her business has improved, but most of what she earns in profits goes to cover her expenses and to savings. She has good experience in this business. Unfortunately, the income of this business is not enough to enlarge her business, and she wants to improve it. For this reason, she applied for a loan of GHS 3,000 from ID-Ghana. She will use the loan to purchase more second-hand bags and earrings, and sell them to her customers. Richlove looks forward to expanding her business more, in order to provide her life with a lot of money.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand bags and earrings to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 29-year-old married man from Khanyounis city. He lives with his wife in a small house in the city. Ahmad works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income is barely covering all the family needs. Ahmad wants to improve his family's living conditions, so he decided to start his own business, which is a store for selling clothes.

Ahmad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of clothes to resell in his new store. By taking this loan, Ahmad will increase his income, and also his family's living conditions.

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes to resell in his new store

loans.name: Valerik

texts.en:
Valeric lives in the city of Kapan in the Syunik region of Armenia. At 64, he is full of energy and new plans and ideas for establishing a new farm and developing his rabbit breeding. 

Valeric lives with his wife and their elder son. The couple's younger son and daughter are married and live abroad. Valeric's wife, a musician, has worked at the city's musical college for 30 years.

With his higher education and specialty in architecture, Valeric worked in that field for many years. But, since 1995, farming has become his main occupation. He manages his farming business perfectly and has a lot of new plans for it. 

Valeric breeds rabbits. He has 20 rabbits on his farm. There has been a great demand for rabbit meat recently. Breeding rabbits and developing this business is a profitable idea. 

A very interesting and clever person, Valeric is now thinking of breeding pheasants on his farm. He has studied these birds: their living conditions, the food that they eat and the environment in which they live. The idea of breeding pheasants in his climate and landscape is unique, but Valerik is sure that pheasant eggs will be in great demand and will sell well, since their healing and other useful properties are known worldwide.

With this loan of 300,000 Armenian drams, Valerik wants to buy several rabbits and import pheasant eggs from abroad to start breeding pheasants in his region.

loans.use: to buy several rabbits and import pheasant eggs from abroad to start breeding pheasants in his region

loans.name: Rimah Group

texts.en:
Diana is the featured borrower of Rimah Group. She got with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends, and they work hard to develop their families' lives and businesses at the same time.

Diana is the first lady at the far left side of the picture. She is a 25-year-old, married mother of two children who works in preparing special hand-made souvenirs and embroidery to support her husband in covering their increasing living needs. Their combined incomes are sometimes not enough to cover sudden unexpected living expenses. Thus, for this reason, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her children's school tuition fees to make sure they can get the best education for a brighter future.

As for the other group members, Lama is the lady at center. She is a single lady who wants to pay for her university fees, while Zaini is the lady at the right side. She is a married mother of three children, and her acquired loan will be invested in her embroidery business development.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees to make sure they can get the best education for a brighter future

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is an 18-year-old, single man who started working in the current sweets shop when he was only 12 years old, when he had to quit school and support his family and their living expenses.

At the age of 15, he decided to develop his career and became a partner in the shop where he used to work. He is currently running the shop as a partner and is working hard to develop it as much as he can, since he was born into this business and wants to make the best of it.

Thus, Hassan is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop his business through increasing his requested raw materials capital to increase his production, and at the same time, increase his income.

He hopes that, in the future, he can stay capable of expanding and developing his current business widely.

loans.use: to increase his capital for raw materials to increase his production

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a very simple woman. She enjoys life and is grateful to have a roof to sleep under, food to enjoy, and two marvelous children. She is a woman from a community not known for farming but she is earning a living through agriculture (in Nandi community). She is happily married and together with her husband is blessed with a beautiful family.

For the past 13 years, she has been practicing mixed farming. Because of the experience she has, she commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers and is regarded as a mentor. Sales from milk and eggs have allowed her to earn a decent income. To make extra money, Elizabeth engages in a small personal business. 

Elizabeth passionately loves dairy farming and the animals on her farm have been given names. Milking and feeding her cows makes her very proud. Through milk selling, she has had quite good returns and the demand for milk has been expanding. Demand has been overwhelming and she needs another cow to fully satisfy the demand. She is requesting a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. 

Elizabeth does not intend to buy just an ordinary cow; she wants to buy a distinct breed that is easy to manage and has a natural ability to produce rich creamy milk. The dairy cow will be producing between 10-12 litres of milk a day. The increased milk production will translate to more income and Elizabeth will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis de 25 años de edad, desde sus 17 años ya sabia lo que era tener un negocio, porque lo aprendió de su esposa, quien en ese tiempo se dedicaba al comercio de pequeños articulos entre sus amistades y con quien tiene una pequeña hija. Cuando Luis  inicó, tomó esta experiencia y le puso todo su impulso, para ayudar al crecimiento de sus ingresos comunes dirigidos a su hogar. Hoy vende de contado y a crédito de barrio en barrio, entre sus vecinos y clientes que lo identifican y le hacen pedidos. Su meta es tener un local y paso a paso lograr adquirir una casa, para aumentar el bienestar de su familia. Calzado, ropa, deportiva, sueteres jeans, camisas pantalones y papelería, son los principales articulos de su oferta y cada dia esta pareja incursiona en su mercado, con mas productos buscando tener una amplia oferta y poder aumentar sus ganancias. Con este propósito está aplicando a  un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, calzado y bisutería, pues está seguro que con esta inversion va a vender mas, tendrá mas clientes y sus ingresos mejorarán sustancialmente.
texts.en:
Luis, age 25, has known what is is to have a business since he was 17 years old.  This is because he learned from his wife, who at that time worked selling small items to her friends.  He and his wife have a little girl.

When Luis started, he took this experience and put all of his drive into increasing their joint earnings for their household.   He now sells for cash and for credit.  He sells from neighborhood to neighborhood, to his neighbors, and to established customers who place orders.

His goal is to have a place and to, step by step, manage to get a house in order to increase his family’s well-being.

Shoes, sportswear, sweaters, jeans, shirts, pants, and stationery items are the main goods that he sells.  Every day this couple enters into their market.  With more products they are looking to have a wide offering and to be able to increase their earnings.

It is with this intention that he is applying for a Kiva loan.  It is his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use the loan to buy clothes, shoes, and costume jewelry.  He is sure that with this investment he will sell more, have more customers, and his income will substantially improve.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for poultry

loans.name: Shughuli

texts.en:
Shughuli is a married woman and has two kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Shughuli has operated a tailoring business for the past six years. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Haya Group

texts.en:
Elsie is the featured borrower of Haya group, which consists of three Filipino ladies who left their homeland to come and work as housekeepers in order to improve their families' living standards although they have to stay far away from their families and have to struggle for their living.

Elsie and the other group members decided to hold hands and acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. They have been best friends since they met in Lebanon and shared their dreams and problems with each other.

Elsie is a 45-year-old married mother of five children, whose acquired loan will be sent to her beloved children for their increasing need for living expenses to make sure they can live a pleasant life since she is working hard abroad for their sake. She is the lady at the center of the picture with the red dress.

As for the other group members, Rhodora is a married mother of two children at the far right side and Juanita is married mother of one child at the far left side. They borrowed funds for the same purpose.

They are all looking forward to the day that they unite back with their beloved families.

loans.use: to send money to her beloved children.

loans.name: Diab

texts.en:
Diab is a 22-year-old single man who runs his motorcycle repair shop in order to earn his living. He is a man with a very good reputation in his region with his special talents in his domain and services he provides.

Diab is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to  increase his business merchandise with special spare parts to develop his business. This will be his second loan cycle with Al Majmoua. Through his previous loan he developed his business properly, and with the increased income he bought his personal car, and he is very proud of his achievement for the time being.

He hopes that in the future, he can stay capable of expanding and developing his business properly, in addition to attracting more customers, and making his own small family.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with special spare parts to develop his business

loans.name: Faqani

texts.en:
Faqani is a 25-year-old, single man from Imisli region. He lives with his family in a small house. His father works as a bus driver, and he gets a low income. 

The family has agricultural land which they do not use because his mother is ill; she has a problem with her health, and they do have not enough funds to buy agriculture goods and pay her medical expenses. For this reason Faqani needs your help. He decided that he will plant some seasonal crops and pay his mother's medical expenses. For this reason, he needs a loan of 1,200 AZN. Please support Faqani.

loans.use: to pay his mother's medical expenses and plant seasonal crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land to expand her farm.

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg, 43 and married, lives in the city of Kapan in the Syunik region of Armenia. He lives with his wife, his son and daughter and his retired mother. 

For many years, Oleg worked as a cook but he now works at the Kapan combine as a digger. He likes his specialty in cooking very much, but it is impossible to earn a living in his specialty nowadays. 

Oleg now has a problem in his family: his son has some health problems, and Oleg is relying on Kiva lenders’ help and financial support. He is requesting a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams to pay for a treatment course for his son.

loans.use: to pay for a treatment course for his son

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy some buckets for resale

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq  is a 35-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father of one son and two daughters. Tareq opened his own business three years ago, a store for selling women's clothes. It is a good business and supports the family with a good income.

Tareq took a USD  loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's clothes for his store. By taking this loan, Tareq's sales will increase and also his income.

Tareq appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's clothes to resell in his store

loans.name: Milena

texts.en:
Milena is a 45-year-old, married woman. She has three children. Ten years ago, she began to operate a mini market in her town. Her husband is a driver, and they work in collaboration with each other to meet the needs of life. 

With her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., she will purchase merchandise for her job. In the future, Milena looks forward to borrowing more Kiva loans to improve her business and gain a higher income. She insists that she will be a permanent customer to be able to always develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her mini market

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is a 28-year-old farmer from Chemase village in North Rift area of Kenya. He is single with no children. He started farming 6 years ago with his 0.2 acre land as capital. Today, he owns 5 dairy cows and 20 heads of poultry. He also runs an agriculture related side-businesses, trading cereals.
 
Over the years, some of the major challenges Silas faced were related to the small size of land he operates on. For example, he could only buy so many cows that would be sustained on that piece of land. This limitation led him to start a cereal trade business which has grown tremendously and is still showing more potential.

Silas is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase cereals which are essentially stock for his business. Silas will make profits once he sells the cereal stock at a higher price than he acquired it for. He will use income from dairy to make initial installments as he waits to sell cereals. Additional income from this investment will help him take care of his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase cereals.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has four children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers purchase food. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients, hence perishable goods lead to losses.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Simon. Simon, 23, is a single man making a living off livestock farming. He is based in Antubochiu location in Nkubu region of Kenya. His one acre farm is home to 2 goats, 3 cows, and 10 heads of poultry. He also has bananas, miraa (Khat) and 35 trees planted on the land. Simon sells most of his farm produce at the local Maua market.

Simon is seeking a KES 65,000 loan from Kiva lenders to purchase a cow. The cow will be reared, and once fully grown, it will be sold for meat. Your loan investment towards this client will not only bring diversity to his business but also increase his net income.

loans.use: to pay for a beef cow.

loans.name: Muthami

texts.en:
Muthami is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

With the 15,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase two sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of cashew nuts

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is 32 year old, married woman. She is shown in the photo with her husband. They have two children. 

Saima is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hand. Her skill is known throughout the town. Her husband also assists her in completing the orders of the customers. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads and frames to meet the orders of their customers on time to earn a good amount of profits. This monetary help can take Saima closer to her dream of providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads and frames

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen is 45 years old. She is a married woman and has been doing a business of animal purchase and sale with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 4 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Qarban  Ali

texts.en: Qarban Ali is a 21-year-old young man who started a school in his community two years ago. Starting a school required a lot of hard work and he had his share of obstacles to overcome, but he did not get disheartened by this. With the support of his family and the encouragement of the community, he continued his efforts. Today, there are over 100 students in his school from Nursery to Grade 10. He has also employed 10 local teachers, of whom 8 are women. He wants to grow his school business and invest in the quality of his school. He requires a loan of PKR 100,000 to buy chairs and desks for his students.

loans.use: to buy chairs and desks for his students.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz  is a 37-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs for many years. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She is famous in her town for providing good quality footballs. She earns enough to bear the expenses of her family members. Shehnaz  is a motivated mother of 5 children.  For the improvement of her business, she has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR. The amount will be used to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers, threads and needles in a large quantity to cater to more customers without delay which will ultimately help in generating more cash. She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers, threads and needles in a large quantity to cater to more customers without delay, which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.name: Haseena

texts.en: Haseena  is 25 years old. She is a married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 30,000  to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Dromo Group

texts.en:
The members of this group are part of the Dromo Group from Teshie, Accra, Ghana. The group is composed of three members who earn their living by selling smoked fish, fried fish and jewelry. They need additional capital to maintain, enhance or expand their businesses and decided to apply for a loan from ID Ghana. They are excited and full of hope to begin this new loan with solid goals and dreams. 

Susana is a 53-year-old, single woman and has one dependent child. In the picture, she is standing first from the right. She completed six years of formal education, but due to the poor economic condition of her family, had to leave her education behind. 

Susana is engaged in the selling of jewelry. She is applying for her sixth loan with ID Ghana. The requested funds will be used to purchase jewelry to sell to her customers. 

On behalf of her colleagues, Susana expresses gratitude and appreciation for the support from Kiva investors throughout the world who lend such necessary and vital support.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies, shoes and school uniforms.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments for resale

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 48-year-old, Lebanese, married woman living with her husband and five children. In 2003, she began to work from her home in producing homemade food. She works with excitement and enthusiasm, as she likes her job. Mona is well known in her region by the delightful food that she prepares. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase raw materials to proceed with what she intends, which is increasing her productivity, and therefore, her profits. In the future, she is planning to expand her work and to open her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her homemade food business

loans.name: Rajaa

texts.en:
Rajaa is a 34-year-old, Lebanese, married woman living with her husband and three children. She cooperates with her husband to fulfill her family's needs. 

In 2008, she decided to open her own bakery in order to take some of the responsibilities with her husband. Today, she’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase new equipment for her bakery. In that way, she will be able to serve her customers with good quality products. 

Rajaa is anxious to get those funds that she is hoping will help her improve her work, as well as her way of living.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment for her bakery

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has one child who is 23 years old. She describes herself as loyal. 

She operates a rental houses business where she rents houses. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a highly populated place and her primary customers are of all types.
