She will use the KES 50,000 loan to renovate the houses. Her business goal is to be a real estate agent within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve the living standards of her family. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Perisi

texts.en:
Perisi is a rural farmer in Kapsowar, Kenya, which is an area known for producing long-distance runners who have broken major world records. Perisi works with a great deal of determination, for many hours, in her farm, all to bring decent food to her home and be her family’s support. 

Perisi is blessed with a lovely family, and has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years. On her farm, she grows maize and keeps a dairy cow and poultry. She sells milk, eggs and maize. To meet her expenses and provide the best for her family, she also often engages in small personal business to make extra money. 

Farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction despite the low earnings. Peirsi said, "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!" 

Her biggest challenge, however, is drought. The long dry season can lead to crop failures and poor yields. To a farmer, this means business losses and lack of food for the family. 

Because of this challenge, Perisi formed a group and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization that supports small rural farmers. Perisi is seeking a new loan to buy another dairy cow and is planning to become a fully-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. 

With this loan, Perisi is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer. All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, with good health and a good livelihood.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a lively and resilient woman. She is from the Kapsowar area, an area that is very affected by poverty, inequality and social conflict. With work and effort and without complaint, she wants to bring her family ahead. 

Eunice has spent the past 10 years of her life farming. She sells milk, poultry, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. 

Eunice is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, dairy farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and milk her cows and feed them with fodder that has high nutrient value. She is so keen and close with her cows, she has named them, which makes Eunice very proud, and she feels fulfilled. 

Dairy farming being a very profitable business venture, Eunice wants to take full advantage. She would like to expand her dairy business, but the biggest challenge she faces is a lack of capital to grow with. She is requesting a loan which she will use to buy a quality breed of dairy cow. 

Eunice has grass, so feeding the cows will never be a challenge. She also owns an expansive piece of land, and the excess space will be productively used once she acquires the additional dairy cow. The "exotic" cow she will buy will produce between 8 and 10 liters of milk per day, and this will translate to more income and profits. The profits from milk selling will allow Eunice to grow her business further, by starting to package milk and by processing it into other dairy products. In addition, she will benefit from the organic manure from the cow. 

She projects that she will be able to start a bio-gas plant at her farm, which will save her money in fuel costs. With your loan, all that Eunice dreams of is a secure future for her family. Eunice awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Hello, lenders, meet Michael from Mitunguu village in Central Kenya. Michael is a committed family man who has been in marriage for 32 years. He and his wife are blessed with five children, with the youngest being 17 and the oldest 33. His 2-acre farm is also home to dairy cows, goats and poultry. Plants on the farm include banana, napier grass and over 30 trees. 

As much as milk is his main income source, Michael acknowledges the interdependent relationship that exists between dairy farming and crop farming: For him to succeed at one, he has to succeed in the other. It is for this reason that he is seeking a loan to buy irrigation equipment.

Crop failure due to lack of rainfall in parts of Central Kenya is very common. This leads to losses for farmers and a high default rate among those who have loans. Your loan investment will be used by this borrower to shield himself and his dependents from this common disaster in the future.

loans.use: to buy an irrigation kit

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva Lenders, meet Milka, a dedicated, determined and honest farmer. She is based in Kapsowar, Kenya. The rich soil of this area makes it one of the nation’s biggest mango growing regions, lending it the nickname of “mango region.”

For the past 5 years, she has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been selling milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops. She also owns a donkey. These ventures have allowed her to earn a decent income.

Milka passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of funds. However, this challenge has not made her give up: “I have to do something for my family,” she has said. She mobilized other enterprising women like her in her village and they have joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance organization that assists small-scale farmers through giving out loans and training.

She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy additional poultry. Having gone through training on loan management, she is educated on how to utilize the loan and save more money. Through this loan, Milka will generate enough income to take care of the farming costs and expand her poultry business.

loans.use: to pay for poultry

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in her native city of Kapan in the Syunik region of Armenia. She has two children. Her son is in the army, and her daughter is a student.

Anahit has a specialty as an engineer. For 10 years, her specialty and good knowledge enabled her to work as a teacher of mathematics and physics at a local school. Now, with her beloved husband in the nearby village Tandzivar,  Anahit is engaged in farming and agriculture. Her husband works at the Kajaran city combine as a driver. 

On her farm, Anahit takes care of a cow, a calf and a heifer as well as chickens and beehives. She also cultivates potatoes, greens and cucumbers. Her land provides harvests for both her family and for sale. She sells milk, meat, eggs and honey, and she has loyal customers who buy these products right from her house. The sale of her farm products is the main source of her family's income.

With this loan, Anahit wants to buy diesel fuel and potato seedlings for spring sowing and several beehives and frames for her beekeeping activities.

loans.use: to buy diesel fuel and potato seedlings for spring sowing and several beehives and frames for her beekeeping activities

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Binti operates a grocery and vegetable selling stall, and she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Irene Mercedes

texts.es:
Doña Irene es una mujer que a sus 61 años se caracteriza por su dulzura, además de ser entusiasta y trabajadora. Ella desde hace 8 años es dueña de una pequeña pulpería;  en un principio inicio vendiendo bebidas gaseosas,  pero ahora ofrece mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes. 

Ella solicita el crédito ya que desea invertir más en su negocio y comprar granos básicos, gaseosas y productos cosméticos. Sus metas son seguir trabajando para ampliar y surtir su negocio. Así mismo sus planes son seguir creciendo para tener una mejor calidad de vida y economía.
texts.en:
Irene is a 61 year old women who is characterized by her gentleness, as well as being enthusiastic and hard working. She has been the owner of a small grocery store for 8 years. She started by selling fizzy drinks, but now offers a greater variety of products to her customers.

She is asking for a loan as she wishes to invest more in her business, and buy basic grains, sodas and cosmetic products. Her aims are to continue working to expand and supply her business. In the same vein her plans are to continue growing, to have a better quality of life and economic situation.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sodas and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Paceñitas De 16 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PACEÑITAS 16 DE JULIO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Emma es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de ropa, atención dental, tienda de  barrio, venta de juguetes, servicio de construcción. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Emma es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años al aprender la forma de preparación de este producto, posteriormente decide emprender este negocio en espacios comerciales de su zona. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “PACEÑITAS 16 DE JULIO” communal bank is starting their first loan with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana regional branch. It is made up of 8 members led by a board of directors with Emma as the President. The businesses of the members are varied. Amongst them are the sales of food, clothing sales, dental attention, a neighborhood store, selling toys and a construction service.

The loan that will be awarded will benefit all these micro-entrepreneurs, Emma being one of them. She says that this is her first time joining Pro Mujer and she joined on the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently she owns a business selling food. She says that she started this business several years ago after learning how to prepare this product. Later she decided to open her business in the commercial spaces in her area.

The loan that she is now taking out is to augment her capital (buying potatoes wholesale) that she will acquire from the vendors in the city of El Alto and later prepare them to sell in her commercial space. This method of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically as she is married and has 5 children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answered that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy potatoes wholesale.

loans.name: Al Manal Group

texts.en:
Malak is the featured borrower of Al Manal Group. She got together along with the other three members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends, and they work hard to develop their social and financial living.

Malak is a 37-year-old married mother of three children who has been working in selling accessories for twelve years to support her beloved husband in making their living and providing their children with the best education.  Malak is the lady at the far right side of the picture.  Her acquired loan will be invested in increasing her accessories merchandise with a special Mother's Day collection, which is on the 21st of March.

As for the other group members, Rihab is the second from the right and is the married mother of two who has worked as a hairdresser for three years, Hiba is the second from the left and is the married mother of one child, and Amal is the first from the left and is the married mother of two who has been working selling Tupperware for twelve years.

loans.use: to increase her accessories merchandise with a special Mother's Day collection

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a married mother of two children. She is a 35-year-old hard working woman who puts so much effort into improving her family's living.

In April, 2014, she opened her current convenience store, and since that time she has been improving it gradually through diversifying her products to attract more customers.

Today, Layla is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase herb merchandise with special offer products that will increase her income and develop her family's living. She will use part of the loan as a first payment for a car she and her husband will buy for their beloved family's needs.

She hopes that in the future she will buy her own shop and save the rent monthly expenses.

loans.use: To increase the herb merchandise with special offer products that will increase her income and develop her family's living.

loans.name: Ingrid Pamela

texts.es:
La socia Ingrid, pertenece al banco comunal PACHAPACCARI,el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia continua con su negocio de lavandería, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua brindando servicios de lavandería a sus clientes que le solici9tan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de detergentes  entre otros.
texts.en:
Ingrid belongs to the PACHAPACCARI, communal bank which is located in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

She continues working in her laundry business. She is grateful for the awarded loan and promises to comply with the established installments. She continues to provide laundry services to her clients that request them. She is a responsible and diligent person, this being the way she gets her family ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy detergent amongst others.

loans.use: to buy detergents amongst others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy general merchandise

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 30-year-old divorced woman from Jericho. She works as an employee in a local firm where she gets a low income. She also has a small store for selling women's clothing and scarves. This store provides her with a good income.

Asma took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new collection of clothes for her store. By taking this loan, Asma will be able to improve her business and open a bigger store in the future.

Asma appears in the photo in her store.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes for his store to resell.

loans.name: Maren

texts.en: Maren is a widowed woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells fish (omena type). She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are individuals. She will use the 15,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fish. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially independent. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman and she has 4 children. She describes herself to be determined.

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, rice, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. Irene describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour and other items. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be successful in business. This is Irene's first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to build a business premise

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 1 year to 5 years. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells soft drinks, flour, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are regular. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as price fluctuations. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, soft drinks and other items. Her business goal is to own a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand business. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, soft drinks and other items.

loans.name: Yunis

texts.en:
Yunis is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as determined. 

She operates an M-pesa business where she offers mobile phone-based money-transfer services. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add M-pesa float. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful in business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to enable her to increase her M-pesa services.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells milk, sweets, flour, sugar and other items. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of rice, milk, flour and other items. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially independent. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice, milk, flour and other items

loans.name: Maria Alexandra

texts.es: A sus 20 años de edad Maria es una joven trabajadora, son 2 años que se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y a trabajar al jornal, Maria con el dinero del crédito va a comprar pollos para criarlos en la casa de su madre que es donde ella vive, Maria aspira mejorar su negocio comprando más cantidad de pollos y para asi tener mejor vida en el futuro.
texts.en: At 20 years old, Maria is a hardworking young woman. She has been raising small animals and working as a laborer for 2 years. With the money from the loan, Maria is going to buy chickens to raise them in her mother's house where she lives. Maria aspires to improving her business by buying more chickens to have a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another cow.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a Kiva borrower. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 8 years to 19 years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail shop where she sells mattresses, water tanks and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of water tanks and mattresses. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful in business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank; her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy more stock of water tanks and mattresses to sell.

loans.name: Kango

texts.en: Kango is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be loyal. He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a populated place and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be machine breakdown. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. His business goal is to be a supplier of clothes within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve the living standards of his family. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Edwin Fabricio

texts.es: Fabricio es un joven soltero de 21 años de edad,  él vive con sus hermanos que esta estudiando y con sus padres que viven de la agricultura y la ganadería, Fabricio se dedica a la comercialización de ropa, a veces de chofer  a la crianza de animales menores, comenta que son sus padres quienes le enseñan a trabajar en todas estas actividades, el dinero de crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  ropa y mediante su negocio aspira mejorar sus ingresos para a futuro entrar  a una universidad para terminar sus estudios o para comprar un vehículo con el que pueda transportar la mercadería para mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en: Fabricio is a single young man of 21 years of age. He lives with his brothers who are studying and with his parents who earn a living from agriculture and raising livestock. Fabricio works selling clothing, also sometimes as a driver or raising small animals, and says that his parents taught him all these activities. He will invest the money from the loan in buying clothing, and via his business he aspires to improve his income so that in the future he can go to university to finish his studies or can buy a vehicle he can use to transport his merchandise and improve his sales.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 31-year-old male Ugandan, and he is married with three children ages 5, 9 and 11 who all attend school. He is the one responsible for their school fees.

Emmanuel is a business man who operates a retail shop in Musenyi Bwikara. He also does agriculture and he grows crops like coffee and maize.

He has applied for a loan ugx1,000,000 to restock his shop with fast moving daily products like salt, soap, sugar, rice, corn flour and other items that he will sell to bring him more profits so that he can pay back quickly. He will use a small portion to buy mulch. His main challenges are price fluctuations and competition from other retailers.

He describes himself as a hardworking and honest person whose dream is to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his general store.

loans.name: El Milagro Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “El milagro” conformado por 08 mujeres que buscan mejorar cada día. Este es el caso de Beatriz de 40 años casada con 04 hijos, dos de ellos independientes. Con los deseos de mejorar su situación económica decide emprender su negocio de venta de dulces, la cual hace más de 02 años que viene ejerciendo. Los créditos de Edaprospo la han ayudado a mejorar cada vez  su negocio. Con el fin de seguir progresando solicitó el crédito para la compra de bebidas gaseosas y golosinas. A futuro le gustaría tener su local propio. El grupo “El Milagro” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito.   Beatriz se encuentra en la parte posterior, es la segunda del lado izquierdo, ella viste polo color rosado.
texts.en: The “El milagro” communal bank is made up of 8 women who look to improve each day. This is the case with Beatriz. who is 40 years old, married with 4 children, two of them independent. With the desire of improving her economic situation she decide to open her business of selling sweets and it is now more than 2 years she has been doing this. The loans from Edaprospo have helped her improve her business each time. With the aim of continuing to progress she is requesting a loan to buy soft drinks and sweets. In the future she would like to own her own store. The "El Milagro”  group would like to thank the people who make this loan possible. Beatriz is at the back, second to the left, wearing a rose colored shirt.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and sweets.

loans.name: Los Perseverantes Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS PERSEVERANTES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Jessica, la socia continua con su negocio de  intenet, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua prestando servicios de internet a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para realizar mantenimiento.
Los demás socios se dedican al negocio de pasamanería, hospedaje, fotocopiadoras, cabinas de internet, cerrajero, restaurante, panadería.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “LOS PERSEVERANTES” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cuzco, in the province and department of Cuzco.                                                                                                                                                                                                

One member is Jessica. She continues to have her internet business. She is grateful to those who have been a part of this dream in this way and she is committed to making her payments on time. She continues to offer internet services to the customers who ask her for them. She is a responsible and hard working woman and this is the way that she gets her family ahead. 

She is asking for the loan to do maintenance. The other members work at decorations, lodging, photocopying, internet booths, lock-smithing, a restaurant and a bread bakery.

loans.use: to do maintenance.

loans.name: Ayni Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AYNI”.
La socia es la Sra. Noemi, la socia es casada  tiene 05 hijos y tiene 63 años de edad; La socia trabaja en su negocio de lavandería, la socia trabaja con diferentes tipos de hoteles  de la zona, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de detergentes entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de lavandería, negocio de internet, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y,turismo,negocio de restaurant.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “AYNI” communal bank. 

This member is Noemi. She is married and has 5 children. She is 63 years old. She works in her laundry business. She works in different types of hotels in the area. She is a responsible and hardworking woman. She wants to be able to keep working so she can keep supporting her family.

She is asking for the loan to to buy detergents and more.

The other members work at doing laundry, an internet business, a grocery store. tourism, and a restaurant.

This member is grateful to those who are a part of her dream in this way and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy detergents and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her daughter's college school fees.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
This is Munira.  Her previous loan was a big help to her business. She was able to buy more vegetables for her grocery store. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. She works hard to provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another loan. This time for 30,000 KES to purchase more stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions. The more items displayed in the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her business profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to increase her stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to be wholesaler of charcoal within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will manage her business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to increase her stock of charcoal

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman. She has 4 children ranging in age from 1 to 8 years. She describes herself as determined. 

She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase a sewing machine. Her business goal is to be a textile wholesaler within 5 years. 

She hopes, that in the future, she will have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Segundo Cesar

texts.es:
Segundo Cesar tiene 64 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad de clima cálido, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, se encuentra ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicios de construcción civil, es conocido en su distrito por la labor que realiza, cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en este negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de herramientas y para brindar mantenimiento a sus actuales herramientas, dicha inversión le servirá para poder atender mayores clientes en el ámbito de la construcción lo que le genrará mayores ingresos que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Cesar is 64 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Cayaltí. It is a community with a warm climate. Its residents work in agriculture, trade and with cattle. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

He provides civil construction services. He is known in his district for the work he does. He has 10 years experience in this business and has very good personal and work references in the area. He has asked for a loan to buy tools and to do maintenance on the tools he has now. This investment will help him be able to serve more customers in the are of construction, which will generate more income that will improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tools and do maintenance on the tools he has now.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase merchandise like sandals and clothing.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane lives in Chebiemit village, situated in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. The land in Chebiemit is extremely fertile for agriculture. Most families in Chebiemit practice agriculture. Jane and her husband own a small piece of land in this region. They live together. They have been doing dairy farming for the last six years to earn a living. Her primary income source is milk. Jane is seeking a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow. As her children grow older, the upkeep and educational expenses keep rising. In order to meet these needs, Jane needs to boost her milk production to earn more income. With your loan, she will be able to afford a high-yielding dairy cow. She will use the additional income from milk sales to pay the loan installments and, later on, school fees.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Union  Por El Progreso Group

texts.es: Este es la Alcancía Comunal “Unión por el progreso”  la cual lo conforma 06 socios responsables y solidarios. Jesusa de 57 años de edad es viuda y tiene 01 hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de emoliente. Hace más de 14 años que viene desempeñándose en dicho negocio el cual le va bien. Su mayor deseo es continuar con su negocio. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de linaza cebada y azúcar. El grupo  “Unión por el progreso” agradecen el crédito brindado. Jesusa es la segunda del lado izquierdo viste polo blanco y chaleco rosado.
texts.en:
This is the communal bank "Union Por El Progreso" (Union For Progress), which is composed of 6 responsible and supportive members.

Jesusa is 57 years old. She is a widow, and she has 1 dependent child. She makes a living selling emollient. She has had this business for over 14 years, and she does very well. Her greatest desire is to continue with her business. She requested a loan to buy linseed, barley, and sugar.

The group "Union Por El Progreso" gives thanks for loan that they have received. Jesusa is the second woman from the left who is wearing a white polo shirt and a pink vest.

loans.use: to buy linseed, barley, and sugar.

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 27-year-old married father of two children. He has been employed in a power engines factory since September 2013, with seven years of experience in this domain.

He is a hardworking man who puts in so much effort to develop himself in his company and at the same time improve his family's living, especially since he is the sole breadwinner. His wife doesn't work, and he has to put in so much effort to respond to the increasing living needs.

Haytham's fixed monthly income isn't enough to cover his family's unexpected increasing living needs. Thus, for this reason, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for his beloved children’s increasing school tuition fees.

He hopes that in the future, he can open his own business and improve his family's living.

loans.use: to pay for his beloved children's increasing school tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of Agrovet products.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a married man. He has four children. He operates a retail business where he makes and repairs shoes. His primary customers are locals.

He will use the KES 55,000 loan to buy materials for repairing and making shoes.

His business goal is to employ workers and buy modern machines within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will open a factory.

loans.use: to buy materials for repairing and making shoes.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal is a married woman with two children. She describes herself to be smart. She operates a retail business where she sells cosmetics, and has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of cosmetics. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, and her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married woman. She has 3 children ranging in age from 8 to 17 years. She describes herself as faithful. 

She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy place and her primary customers are regular. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of shoes and construct a business premise. Her business goal is to open a shop in town within 5 years. 

She hopes, that in the future, her children will graduate from college. 

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loans were successfully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of shoes and construct a business premise.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz tiene 41 años edad, es madre soltera, vive en casa propia con su menor hija de 15 años en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la venta de animales como aves de corral y cerdos contando con más de 10 años de experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias por parte de los vecinos de la zona, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Pucará. El crédito que solicita será invertido para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales para implementar su negocio, esto le permitirá tener mayores ingresos y a la vez mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luz is 41 years old. She is a single mother. She lives in her own home with her 15-year-old daughter. They live in the Pucará district in the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Perú. The residents in this district are primarily dedicated to agriculture, farming and business. 

She sells animals like poultry and pigs. She has more than 10 years of experience with this business. She has a lot of good references from her neighbors in the area. Her business is located in the Pucará district. The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of animals to add to her business. This will allow her to have greater profits and at the same time, it will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: purchase animals.

loans.name: Meali

texts.en:
Meali is a married mother that lives in Likoni. She sells food and is helped by her family. Her first loan was very beneficial for her since she was able to buy vegetables and grains for preparing food. Previously, she did not have enough capital to work with and the loan came when she needed it the most. She has paid the installments on time.

She always struggles to improve her food stall, trying to sell more and to save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Meali is requesting a loan to purchase beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, beef, and chicken. She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, beef, and chicken

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be experienced. 

She operates a dairy farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the 90,000 KES loan to buy feed for her animals. 

Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loans were successfully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her cows.

loans.name: Rukiya

texts.ru: Эту женщину зовут Рукия. Она из района Бохтар. Ей 51 лет. Она с мужем и детьми проживает в районе Бохтар. Рукия очень трудолюбивая и ответственная женщина. Она на районе занимается земледелием и животноводством. Ей в работе помогает муж и дети. Рукия хорошо справляется  с обоями деятельностями.  Она и ее семья жили в старом доме. Рукия и ее муж зарабатывали на жизни, и копили деньги для запаса. Она расстроилась, что у нее не хватает денег на ремонта. Из-за нехватки денег она обратилась за кредитом. С помощью кредита она купить краски, эмульсия, люстры и другие материалы.
texts.en:
This woman is called Rukiya. She is 51 and lives in the Bohtar region with her husband and children. Rukiya is a very hardworking and responsible woman who works in animal husbandry and agriculture with the help of her husband and children. She manages both occupations well. 

Rukiya and her family live in an old house. She and her husband earn enough to cover living expenses and to put some money aside. But she doesn't have enough money to do home renovations. Because of this, she is looking for a loan, with which she wants to buy paint, whitewash, light fixtures and other materials.

loans.use: to renovate her house and buy building materials

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de ropa, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive casa propia con sus dos hijos, su esposo, su suegra y su cuñado, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa para damas y caballeros por mayor, y asi poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The young woman whose face is blurred because she is 26 years old and lives in a high risk area has made a living by selling clothing for the last ten years. Her business is located in the municipal market and has a lot of customers. With what she obtains from her sales she is able to cover some household expenses. The young woman lives in a family house with her two children, her husband, her mother-in-law and her brother-in-law. She is asking for a loan to buy more women's and men's clothing wholesale so she can have better earnings for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more women's and men's clothing wholesale

loans.name: Victor Antonio

texts.es: Víctor es padre soltero tiene tres hijas de 11, 8 y 4 años de edad, el es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable se dedica a la crianza de pollos y trabaja en otras actividades agrícolas de las cuales obtiene ingresos extras, inicio su trabajo hace un año con la crianza de 100 pollo, y ya que le ha ido muy bien en su trabajo ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para la compra de comida, concentrado y vitamina para los pollos y asi aumentar la producción y obtener mejores ingresos con las ventas para tener mejores ganancias económicas.
texts.en: Víctor is a single father. He has three daughters, aged 11, 8 and 4. He is a very hardworking and responsible man who works raising chickens. He works in other agricultural activities from which he obtains extra income. He started his work a year ago with the raising of 100 chickens. Since it's gone very well for him in his work he's made the decision to apply for a loan from INTEGRAL for the purchase of food, feed and vitamins for the chickens. Therefore, he will increase production and obtain more revenue with the sales to have more economic income.

loans.use: to buy food, feed and vitamins for the chickens.

loans.name: Jaffer

texts.en:
Jaffer is a Kiva borrower. She has three children. She describes herself to be intelligent.

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in town, and her primary customers are women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation of prices.

She will use the KES 120,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes.

Her business goal is to have a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will live a comfortable life. This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Lenin

texts.es:
Lenin tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo en casa familiar en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en esta comunidad es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público, cuenta con una mototaxi propia con la cual brinda este servicio, tiene más de 04 años de experiencia en el rubro y cuenta con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Adicionalmente se dedica a realizar labores agrícolas como peón en los distintos cultivos del distrito. El préstamo lo va invertir en arreglos y mantenimiento de su unidad móvil ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, esto le permitirá brindar un mejor servicio lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lenin is 34, he lives with his spouse and his son in a family house in Pucará district, which is found located in Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern sierra of Peru. The life in this community is tranquil and the villagers work in agriculture, trade and animal raising.

He works providing the service of public transportation. He has his own mototaxi with which he provides this service. He has more than 4 years' experience in the work and has regular customers who provide him with very good personal and working references. Additionally, he works carrying out agricultural labor as a farmhand on the different crops of the district. He is going to invest the loan in repairs and maintenance of his mobile unit which is currently found in a bad state. This will allow him to provide a better service which will have a positive impact on his level of income; it's going to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his mobile unit since it's currently found in a bad state.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a retail business where she offers photography services. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic place, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy photography materials.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy photography materials.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 46-year-old married woman with seven children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. She operates a ladies’ salon. She has been in that business for six years and also does decoration services to improve her income.

Margret wanted to share family responsibilities with her husband. Financially, that forced her to begin a salon business. She dreams of expanding her business into a bridal center. She is faced with a challenge of defaults by ladies she offers services to, which results in a scarcity of money.

Margret wants the loan to buy cosmetics, a hair dryer, and weaves to use in her salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, a hair dryer, and weaves to use in her salon.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a 42-year-old dedicated and hardworking Ugandan woman. She is married to Peter, and they have five children aged between 17 and 8.

Harriet has been a produce dealer and a farmer for the last ten years. This has helped her earn income to look after her family and provide for their needs.

Harriet has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to buy dry corn and millet that are now selling cheaply. She will sell it at a profit to generate more income. This will help her to repay the loan and have extra income to meet the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy corn and millet.

loans.name: Kanykei

texts.ru: Каныкей 23 года. Она занимается полеводством и животноводством, есть корова, 5 овец. Дополнительным источником дохода является выращивание ячменя на 1,0 Га арендованной земли. По характеру Каныкей очень активный и трудолюбивый человек. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) для приобретения овец. В будущем Каныкей собирается увеличить поголовье скота и улучшить материальное положение семьи и сделать ремонт сарая.
texts.en:
Kanykei is 23 and works in animal husbandry and agriculture. She has a cow and five sheep and grows barley on 1 hectare of rented land as an additional source of income. She is a very active and hardworking person.

Kanykei has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 20,000 KGS to acquire sheep. In the future she wants to increase her head count of livestock, to improve her family's living conditions and to renovate her barn.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Los Rosales Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad productora de caña donde la mayoría de las personas ha dedicado al menos algunas horas a trabajar el campo sembrando, limpiando, cosechando el producto agrícola, se consolidó un grupo de préstamo llamado “Los Rosales” ya que anteriormente el patio de la representante estaba repleto de este tipo de flores. 

Además de compartir un lazo sanguíneo, los integrantes tienen en común el esfuerzo que realizan día con día para poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia; Margarita, Carlos y Luis se dedican a vender refrescos; Lidia, antojitos; Fortino, materiales agrícolas para mejorar la producción de caña y Lourdes a vender ropa.

Lidia es una mujer muy trabajadora, al igual que su esposo Eladio con quien ha procreado a tres pequeños. Su familia fue su motivación principal para iniciar a vender carne de pollo hace tres años. Día con día Lidia se levantaba muy temprano para tener todo listo y comenzar a vender a las 7 am. 

Actualmente, Lidia vende antojitos tres días a la semana, actividad que ha resultado más productiva que la anterior. Durante los días de venta, de 8am a 4pm el anafre, el comal, la sartén y todos los ingredientes y el agua de sabor que vende Lidia se encuentran debajo del manteado que coloca para protegerse del sol y la lluvia. Esta vez lidia empleará su préstamo para comprar aceite, azúcar, queso, carne, verduras y gas siendo los insumos que mas emplea en la elaboración de la comida.

Por las tardes, Lidia y su esposo se dedican a sembrar maíz y desgranarlo. Parte de la cosecha es para autoconsumo y lo demás lo venden a la gente de la comunidad, justo desde su casa para obtener un poco de dinero extra. 

“Gracias a todos los que han hecho posible nuestros préstamos que me han ayudado a tener mis actividades". Para llevar su negocio de comida hacia adelante, a Lidia le encantaría establecerse en un local en algunos meses. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de la casa de Lidia quien viste blusa color rojo. El carro que se observa detrás de ellos es uno de los tantos donde se acarrea la caña a los diferentes ingenios.
texts.en:
In a sugar cane producing community where the majority of people have dedicated at least some hours to working in the field planting, cleaning, and harvesting the agricultural product, a lending group was formed called "Las Rosales" since, in the past, the patio of the representative was full of this type of flower.

In addition to sharing a blood link, the members have the effort that they carry out day by day in common to be able to offer a better quality of life to their families. Margarita, Carlos and Luis work selling sodas; Lidia, snacks; Fortino, agricultural materials to improve the production of the sugar cane and Lourdes, selling clothing.

Lidia is a very hardworking woman, as well as her husband Eladio with whom she's procreated three small ones. Her family was her main motivation for starting to sell chicken three years ago. Day by day, Lidia got up very early to have everything ready and start selling at 7 AM.

Currently, Lidia sells snacks three days a week, an activity that has resulted in being more productive than the previous. During the sale days, from 8 AM to 4 PM the stove, comal [griddle], pan and all of the ingredients and the flavored water that Lidia sells are found under a blanket that she puts up to protect herself from the sun and rain. This time, Lidia will employ her loan to purchase oil, sugar, cheese, meat, vegetables and gas, being the supplies that she uses most in the preparation of the food.

In the afternoons, Lidia and her husband work planting corn and shucking it. Part of the harvest is for self-consumption and they sell the rest to the people of the community, exactly from their house to obtain a little extra money.

"Thanks to all who have made our loans possible that have helped me to have my activities." In order to carry her food business forward, Lidia would love to establish herself in a point of sale in a few months.

*The photograph was taken on the patio of Lidia's house, who is seen in a red blouse. The truck that is seen behind them is one of the many that carries the sugarcane to different mills.

loans.use: to buy: oil, sugar, cheese, meat, vegetables and gas.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be reliable.

He operates a retail business where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

He hopes that in the future, he will be a major supplier of vegetables. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a retail business where she sells cups, plates, and other items. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of plates, cups, and other items.

Her business goal is to open a wholesale shop within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of plates, cups, and other items.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself as experienced. He operates a barber shop. He has been involved in this business for 13 years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate funds. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy barber shop items. He hopes that, in the future, he will be successful. This is his second loan from SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy items for his barber shop.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 37-year-old married man with two children, both of whom go to school. He has been in the wholesale business for many years, located in a rural area. He also farms coffee and cotton. Julius has also set up a salon business using the proceeds from his other businesses, which has helped him maintain his daily activities. However, price fluctuations and limited capital are challenges that adversely affect his returns. Julius intends to use the loan to buy sodas, rice, sugar, beers and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas, rice, sugar, beers and cooking oil to sell..

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en: Gabriel is a married man. He has three children, who range in age from 8 to 11. He operates a transport business, where he transports customers using his motorcycle. His primary customers are locals. He describes his main family challenge to be lack of water storage facilities. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a water storage facility for family use. He hopes that, in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his third loan form SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water storage facility for family use.

loans.name: Akisah

texts.en:
Akisah is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a farm where she grows maize and beans. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

She will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy farm inputs and pay school fees.

She hopes that in the future, she will have a large-scale farm. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay school fees.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.ru: Шарифа,  58 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Шарифа имеет среднее образование. По характеру она трудолюбивая и пунктуальная.  В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1996 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Шарифы в хозяйстве имеется 4 коровы. На участке мерою 2,16 Га выращивает фасоль. Ее деятельность приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Шарифа планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем намерена отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Sharifa is 58 and married with three children. She has a high school education and is a hardworking and punctual person who has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture since 1996 as the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, she now has four cows on her farm as well as 2.16 hectares of land where she grows beans. Her business brings in about 10,000 KGS per month.

With the goal of further developing her business, Sharifa has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 70,000 KGS to purchase livestock. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing the size of her farm, and wants to renovate her house in the future.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to increase the size of her herd

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is a forty-year-old woman, married, with four children, who lives in Kasese, Uganda. Oliver sells fresh beans. She has been in this business for three years. She began the business in order to have a source of income for her family. She dreams of educating her children and expanding her business. However, she is faced with a challenge of market competition. Oliver is borrowing to buy more fresh beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fresh beans to sell.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan lives in Kasese, Uganda. She is widowed and has four children. Joan trades in mukene (small fish) and makes shopping baskets to earn a living. Her business challenge is stiff competition.

Joan has always dreamed of building a strong permanent house for her children and expanding her business in order to make more income. She is requesting a loan to buy cement and sand to build her residential house.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to build her house.

loans.name: Orozaim

texts.ru: Орозайм,49 лет, замужем, 3 детей. Много лет назад начала заниматься сельским хозяйством. На сегодняшний день Орозайм смогла развить свою деятельность, у нее есть 3 коровы, 2 лошадей, 30 овец. На участве мерою 0,29 Га собственной и 1,0 Га арендованной земли выращивает рис.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса Орозайм обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 коров. Доходы от кредита она планирует направить на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Orozaim is 49 and married with three children. She started working in farming many years ago and has been able to develop her business so that she now has three cows, two horses and 30 sheep as well as 0.29 hectares of her own and 1 hectare of rented land where she grows rice.

With the goal of further developing her business, Orozaim has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase four cows. She plans to put profits from the loan into renovating her home.

loans.use: to buy four cows to increase her head count of livestock

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de lato riesgo, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de muebles de madera, desde hace 2 años se dedica a esta actividad que le heredo un familiar para que pudiera trabajar, comercializa sus productos durante todo el año y ya tiene clientes establecidos, el joven vive con su madre en casa propia y está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas materia prima como madera, clavos, barniz, pegamento, entre otras cosas todo por mayor para suplir la demanda que tiene y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young person whose face is pixelated is 23 years old and lives in a high risk area. He earns a living making and selling wooden furniture. He has been doing this work for two years and inherited it from a relative to that he could work. He sells his products throughout the year and he already has established clients. The young man lives with his mother in their own house and is asking for a loan in order to by more raw materials such as wood, nails, varnish, glue, among other things and all in bulk in order to supply the demand and  therefore earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials such as wood, nails, varnish, glue, among other things, all in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more supplies of metal for his welding business, where he makes windows, chairs and other items.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Hello lenders; meet Mercy. The 29-year-old mother is a small-holder farmer based in Koibatek village, in the North Rift region of Kenya. For the past 5 years, the secondary-educated entrepreneur has run a mixed farm, where she keeps productive dairy cows that produce milk for both consumption and sale. Mercy farms on a half-acre piece of land that belongs to her husband, whose professional activities have little to do with agriculture. Mercy was farming for subsistence, but recently switched to commercial production. The income she made from this transition greatly improved her income status and enabled her to afford her children a better education at standard private schools. 

Mercy is seeking a loan to purchase animal feed. She places more premium on animal health and nutrition in her dairy business than on other factors. Animal feed has a lot to do with the proper composition of the animal products she sells to her customers. She is seeking this loan to ensure that her animals have the proper feed composition that they require. The returns from this investment will enable Mercy to pay for her children's education expenses. She wants nothing but the best foundation for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tomatoes and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Gordon

texts.en:
Gordon is a hardworking, single man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He operates a retail shop to earn income to support his family. He also earns extra income from farming and a depot. He hopes to develop his business into a wholesale one and increase the level of his income. His target is limited by high transport costs that lower the amount of profits realized from the business.

He is requesting a loan to buy sodas, bags of sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas, bags of sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 47-year-old, hardworking, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a farmer and mainly grows bananas; he also earns additional income from livestock rearing, where he gets milk to sell. He hopes to expand his business into a modern farm and out-compete all the farmers in his area because he keeps accurate cash flow from his business. His vision is limited by poor climatic conditions that affect the produce and volume of milk from his farm.

He is requesting a loan to hire labor to weed his banana plantation.

loans.use: to hire labor to weed his banana plantation.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a hardworking, married, Ugandan male living in Kamwenge. He deals in rearing livestock and also operates a retail shop to earn an extra income. He is self-employed, and therefore, able to earn a living. He is planning to expand his business, but faces a challenge of high transport costs that limit his profits.  

He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Tatu's greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, Tatu has operated a business selling clothes from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation. Tatu dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

Tatu has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Eriya

texts.en:
Thanks to his previous UGAFODE loan, Eriya is a proud owner of a solar system. He is married and has 5 children aged between 15 and 2 but he also stays with a house helper. Eriya’s main business is boda boda (motorcycle taxi) transport but he supplements it with farming to generate extra income. His main challenges are bad roads and competition.  

Eriya has applied for a loan of UGX 250,000 to pay school fees for for his children since it’s the beginning of a new term. He so much appreciates the efforts of UGAFODE alongside Kiva lenders. Eiya appears in the photo with the UGAFODE credit officer.

loans.use: to pay  tuition

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz, su esposo le ayuda en las siembras, cuenta con más de 15 años de experiencia, sus productos los mantiene almacenados en los graneros que muestra la fotografía, y los vende durante todo el años y gracias a esas ventas es como logra salir adelante con su familia, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, semillas, etc. y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Marleny is 45 years old and lives in her own house with her two children and her husband. She earns a living growing corn and her husband helps her with sewing the seeds. She has over 15 years of experience. She stores her produce in the granaries shown in this photo and she sells them throughout the year. Thanks to the sales she manages to get ahead with her family. She is asking for this loan to buy farming supplies such as fertilisers, manure, weed-killer, seeds, etc., and therefore continue with her work and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as fertilisers, manure, weed-killer, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Margarine

texts.en:
Margarine is a young farmer from Kuserwo, a remote village in Kapsowar, Kenya. She has defied the common thinking about most Kenyans that agriculture is for the older generation. Margarine is a lovely mother who has been farming for the last 10 years to supplement her income from the small business she does. Margarine does crop farming and cattle raising and she enjoys farming a lot. Her biggest challenges are animal diseases and the lack of finances to improve her farming. 

Margarine is seeking a loan of KES 60,000 to purchase sheep. Her projections are that, by the end of the year, these sheep will have given birth to at least four lambs. Through sheep-raising, she will be able to get sheep wool, which is very expensive and fetches good profits. This translates into more income and improved living conditions for her family. Also, she will be able to sell sheep meat and sheepskin, which will increase her income level. The profits will be used to repay the loan on time and to grow the business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: David Emmy

texts.en:
David Emmy is a 47-year-old, hardworking, married man with six children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a farmer and mainly grows coffee; he also earns additional income from livestock rearing. He hopes to specialize in coffee growing and have a better farm. His vision is limited by expensive labor to maintain the farm.

He is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his last born.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his last born.

loans.name: Silver

texts.en: Silver is a 42-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is mainly a farmer and also owns a milling machine to earn additional income. Silver has a vision of owning a big coffee plantation but he faces a challenge of bad weather that affects his level of production. Silver is requesting a loan to buy more cereals and fertilizers to use on his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cereals and fertilizers to use on his farm.

loans.name: Placidia

texts.en: Placidia is an enterprising, married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She used her previous loan to buy more cosmetics to sell. She still has hardships of customers who delay payment , price fluctuations and stiff competition from other traders dealing in similar businesses. However, her vision is to educate her children to higher levels and to own a wholesale cosmetics shop. Placidia is requesting a loan to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Truth Group

texts.en:
These two members form the group called "Truth" and they are driven by a clear desire to change their families' living conditions. This will be their 10th loan cycle. The two women enjoy being together and have good experience in their respective businesses. They live in the same area and share strong ties. Their main activities are selling groceries and maize. 

Angela, 45 years old, is the representative of this group. She is a very dynamic woman and plays a decisive role in the development of the group. She is married and the mother of one dependent child. Angela has a place at her residence where she sells maize and banku (cooked corn and cassava paste). She has extensive experience in this domain. Angela wants to use this loan to buy more maize, corn and cassava dough to prepare banku to sell to customers. The profits will allow her to increase her savings and better help her child. The group members will hold each other responsible for repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more maize, corn and cassava dough to prepare banku to sell

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en: Tomas sells milk and he is a mason. He is a widower and he has five children. He and his family live in Kjasina Community. Tomas offers his services as a mason to the community of Achacachi and that means that he has to travel a lot. Since he is not in contact with his children then, he wants a loan to buy another dairy cow. That will allow him to attend to his milk selling business more and to stay at home more. He hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Moises

texts.en: Moises rents a little apartment and he works as  a taxi driver, using his own car. Moises is divorced and his daughter lives with his ex-wife. Moises needs a loan to buy a new engine for his car because the car is experiencing troubles or failures. Moises takes care of his daughter; that is why he needs your help. Moises would like to have a new car in the future; as you can see in the picture, the one he has is old.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his nursery beds by adding in more plant species.

loans.name: Corona De Cristo Group

texts.es:
Durante el recorrido a la comunidad donde se formó el grupo "Corona de Cristo" se pueden apreciar las plantaciones de caña características de la región y a lo lejos, montañas llenas de vegetación. Algunos de los habitantes aún hablan mazateco, lengua de la etnia indígena que hace tiempo se asentó en el lugar. Las leyendas del origen de la comunidad aún prevalecen y son las que llenan de orgullo a las nuevas generaciones. 

Los integrantes que día a día trabajan en sus actividades para llevar a su familia alimento y mejores oportunidades son:

Sarahi –Calzado Por Catalogo 
Margarita –Ropa 
Isabel –Plantas 
Luisa –Comida 
Fidelina –Refrescos 

El gusto por las plantas, la variedad, las formas de las flores, las hojas, los colores fue lo que motivó a doña Isabel,  a quien todos conocen como doña “Chabe”, a iniciar su actividad. Para empezar, pidió apoyo a su esposo, el señor Lucio; entre los dos limpiaron el espacio donde hoy en día Chabe tiene su pequeño vivero que se mantiene lleno de color desde hace 10 años. Hoy en día, al ver a sus padres trabajar en el pequeño jardín, entre juegos su hijo también ayuda a desyerbar cuando puede. “Estoy feliz con mis plantas, en ellas invierto gran parte de mi tiempo, obtengo ganancias y apoyo con los gastos. Me siento útil, trabajo honradamente y sin descuidar a mi familia.”

El siguiente reto de Isabel es vender en la feria del pueblo, pero para ello necesita tener más variedad de plantas y mejorar la infraestructura de su vivero. El préstamo que solicita le ayudará a lograrlo poco a poco ya que comprará abono, bolsas de plástico y más plantas.

“No cualquiera tiene mano para sembrar plantas y que 'peguen'” comenta Chabe orgullosa de su habilidad. Además ella misma elabora su propia composta y abono orgánico que le ayudan a garantizar la calidad de las flores y la sostenibilidad de su negocio. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en el municipio principal donde vivien las integrantes, doña Isabel es quien viste falda floreada y blusa rosa. El nombre del grupo se debe a la planta que más vende en su vivero.
texts.en:
During the journey to the community where the group "Corona de Cristo" (Crown of Christ) was formed, one can see the sugarcane plantations that are characteristic of the region and, in the distance, mountains that are full of vegetation. Some of the inhabitants still speak mazateco, the language of the indigenous people who settled in the region long ago. The legends of the origins of the community still persist, and they fill the new generations with pride.

The members of this group who work on their businesses day after day to put food on the table for their families and to offer them better opportunities are:

Sarahi – shoes by catalog 
Margarita – clothing 
Isabel – plants 
Luisa – food 
Fidelina – snacks 

Her fascination with plants – the variety, the shapes of the flowers, the leaves, the colors – is what motivated Isabel who everybody knows as "Chabe" to start her business. To begin, she asked her husband Lucio for support. Between the two of them, the cleaned out the space where Chabe now has her small nursery, which has been full of color for the past 10 years. Nowadays, seeing his parents work on the small garden, their son also helps with weeding when he can between games. "I am happy with my plants, and I invest a great amount of my time in them. I earn an income, and I help with household expenses. I feel useful, working honestly without forgetting about my family."

Isabel's next challenge is selling at the village fair. In order to do this, she needs to have a greater variety of plants and to improve the infrastructure of her nursery. The loan that she is requesting will help her achieve this little by little, since she will buy fertilizer, plastic bags, and more plants. "Not everyone has the hands to plant plants and have them 'stick'," remarks Chabe, proud of her abilities. In addition, she makes her own compost and organic fertilizer, which help her guarantee the quality of her flowers and the sustainability of her business.

*The photograph was taken in the main town where the members live. Isabel is the woman wearing a flowery skirt and a pink shirt. The name of the group is also the plant that she sells most at her nursery.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, bags, and plants.

location.town: Palma Cuata, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 35 years old and has a family of four. His wife is employed and earns a salary. He has two kids aged seven and five years old and both are in primary school. He has done the business of bull fattening for five years and he gets an average income of KES 15,000 per month. He currently wants to buy more young bulls for fattening at cheaper prices for his business expansion.

loans.use: to buy more bulls for fattening before selling them.

loans.name: Mandzaano Group

texts.en:
The group, Mandzaano, was formed by women of common interest, sharing similar economic backgrounds, for the purpose of getting a loan. The loan will help them to buy inventory for their various shops, which are the main source of income for their families. The three businesswomen sell smoked fish, African wax-fabric, cosmetics, scarves, underwear and vegetables. 

Sarah (47 years old) is the featured member of the group. She lives in Teshie-Accra, Ghana. Sarah has been in this business for 10 years and it has been the main source of income for the family. She has one child to take care of and it is not easy to assume the responsibilities for herself and her child. Sarah's business brings good income and that is why she is requesting this loan: to stay in this business and make more money. Sarah is in urgent need of money to buy fish and firewood to smoke the fish to sell to her customers so that she can save money for herself and child.

loans.use: To buy fish and firewood to smoke the fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
