Alla and her family live in Vodyanoye. She owns a lot next to her house, where she constructed 3 spacious greenhouses and a seed bed for seedlings. Alla grows tomatoes and cucumbers there. Alla started out small. She worked hard raising 20 pigs and selling their meat. This endeavor helped her raise enough money to construct her first greenhouse. A year later she built her second  one.

Alla is hoping to invest 13,000 UAH (hryvnias) to purchase fertilizers and plastic film to cover a new greenhouse this early spring season, making an air-cushion inside. Alla has a big piece of land and has many plans to build additional greenhouses on her property. Alla is very sociable and active. Recently she organized a fundraiser for her daughter's classmate who had a serious disease and needed urgent surgery. The raised funds were invested in the boy's treatment.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and plastic film to cover a new greenhouse this early spring season, making an air-cushion inside

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander, 23 years old, is from Vinogradovo. He is married and has a son. Alexander is in the sports footwear sales business. His parents helped him start this business when he was looking for ways to support his young family. 

Alexander is planning to use the loan of 15,000 UAH (hryvnias) to buy additional footwear to sell in the spring. Income generated as a result of sales will be re-invested in the business to stimulate its growth and further expansion. One of Alexander's long-terms plans is to open his own footwear store in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional footwear to sell in the spring

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina is 49 years old and she lives at El Alto. She makes Andean skirts and blankets. She learned about the business many years ago. Cristina has a store but the place doesn't belong to her. She also uses the store as a workshop. Cristina needs a loan to buy items to make skirts and blankets. She has a daughter and hopes you can help her to improve her family's situation.

loans.use: to buy items to make skirts and blankets

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en: Dionisia is 70 years old and is a widow. She makes cheese. She lives alone and it is very hard for her to make cheese every day but she needs the work. Dionisia needs a loan to buy a dairy cow that will help her to have more milk and to sell more cheese. She hopes you can help her. She would like to hire an assistant in the future. Dionisia doesn't have relatives that can help her.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mayela Jorleny

texts.es:
Hay personas que tienen por vocación servir a los demás, y está, es la felicidad que los lleva a vivir y vivir el esfuerzo. Entre estas personas esta Mayela, una carismática joven de 26 años que actualmente cursa el último año de la carrera de enfermería. Ella desde siempre sintió el deseo de estudiar esta profesión para ayudar a las personas. Es madre de dos niñas de 6 y 1 año. Su esposo ha sido su apoyo incondicional, tanto en el hogar como en sus estudios.

Mayela solicita el crédito porque desea pagar los gastos de su título universitario, el cual, le ayudara a obtener un trabajo que le permita tener mejores condiciones de vida. Las metas de esta joven esforzada son luchar para salir adelante con su esposo e hijas. Sus planes son seguir especializándose en la materia de enfermería.
texts.en:
Some people pursue vocations that involve serving others. Happiness is what it takes to live and living is effort. This describes people such as Mayela. She is a charismatic young woman who is 26 years of age. Mayela is currently in her final year of study toward a Nursing degree. She always had the desire to study for a profession in which she can help people. Mayela is the mother of two daughters, ages 6 and 1. Her husband provides unconditional support, both at home and with her studies.

Mayela is requesting a loan because she want to pay her university degree expenses. This will help her secure a job that will allow her to have better living conditions. The goal of this young woman is to move forward along with her husband and daughters. Her plans include pursuing a specialization in the nursing field.

loans.use: to pay her university degree expenses.

loans.name: Michelle Georgina

texts.es:
Michelle es una joven mujer de 19 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de odontología.
Ella es inteligente, dulce, sincera, sensible, responsable y trabajadora. Sus estudios los realiza en la universidad pública ubicada en la zona de ‘Miraflores” que se encuentra al sureste de la ciudad, tiene como sus principales atractivos el Jardín Botánico, la avenida Busch, la plaza Villarroel, el Estadio Hernando Siles junto a la Plaza Arqueológica entre otros, es un barrio residencial y está completamente urbanizado, El clima es templado de alta montaña, el mes más cálido es noviembre mientras que el mes más frío es julio, el invierno es seco y frío.
Michelle es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, estatura mediana, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que casi no habla porque sus estudios los realiza en español y estudia inglés como segunda lengua. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que trabajan y viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Ella estudia la carrera de odontología en la universidad pública y se prepara para ser  capaz de resolver los problemas dominantes de salud bucal, previniendo, tratando, restaurando y rehabilitando las lesiones bucodentales más frecuentes, aportando de esta manera al estado de salud completa de los individuos. Paralelamente a sus estudios trabaja atendiendo una tienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad. “trabajo y estudio para poder pagar mis gastos estudiantiles, con estas 2 actividades no me sobra tiempo para nada más…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una casa propia, ella desea realizar la compra de una computadora portátil y materiales de odontología para sus estudios. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en un año y medio que estudia y 6 años que trabaja.
Es por esos motivos que Michelle solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil y materiales de odontología para continuar con sus estudios profesionales.
texts.en:
Michelle is a young 19 year old woman, single with no children. She is studying dentistry. She is intelligent, sweet, sincere, sensible, responsible and hard-working, She studies at a public university located in the ‘Miraflores” area in the south-east of the city. It's main attractions are the Botanical Gardens, Busch Avenue, Villaroel plaza and the Hernando Siles stadium, along with Arqueológica plaza amongst others. It is a residential neighborhood and completely urbanized. It has a high altitude temperate climate, the hottest month being November, the coldest is July. Winter is dry and cold.

Michelle is dark-skinned, long black hair tied up, dark eyes, medium height and medium build. Her native language is Aymara which she hardly uses because her studies are in Spanish and she is studying English as a second language. She lives in the house of her parent's who work. It is a rented house made from brick and cement with a metal roof that has running water, sewage, electricity and cooking gas.

She is studying dentistry in a public university and becoming prepared to be able to resolve the predominate and most common dental problems contributing in this way to the state of total health of individuals. While doing her studies she also takes care of a neighborhood store with basic food items. " I work and study to pay my student expenses. With these two activities I have no time for any thing else", she commented.

Her dream is to have her own house. she wants to buy a laptop and dental materials for her studies. This is her first loan with the institution in the year and a half that she has studied and the 6 years she has worked. For these reasons Michelle is requesting a loan to buy a laptop and dental materials to continue with her professional studies.

loans.use: to buy a laptop and dentistry materials to continue with her professional studies.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en: Glenda is a single woman and she works at a store that sells products for ladies. Glenda is also an artist who paints mostly portraits. Glenda pays rent. She lives alone and she needs another loan to buy paint, canvas and brushes. Glenda's dream is to have her own gallery and to dedicate all her time to painting. She hopes you can help her again.

loans.use: to buy paint, canvas and brushes.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco has three little children that are going to school. He is not married but he has a girlfriend. He is a farmer and he also works for a government institution. Francisco works hard to sell milk and he needs a loan to buy a dairy cow, which will help him to increase his milk production. Francisco is healthy and he is convinced that the loan won't be a problem for him. He loves his family a lot and he hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy oil, rice, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for his barber shop.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en: Franklin is a carpenter who learned this trade many years ago. He wakes up very early in the morning to start making furniture. Franklin is divorced and his 2 daughters live with him and his parents. He is the only person who supports the family. Franklin needs a loan to buy wood. He hopes you can help him .

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Nueva Ilusión Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Nueva Ilusión” se encuentra en una comunidad muy tranquila, sus habitantes aún tienen costumbres y tradiciones muy arraigadas. Para las integrantes, el nombre que las identifica significa tanto: la oportunidad de recibir un préstamo es una nueva ilusión para su negocio y con su familia. 

Doña Francisca está casada con Eduardo, quien trabaja el campo; son padres de 4 jóvenes de los cuáles ya sólo 2 dependen de ellos y afortunadamente continúan sus estudios. 

Hace 9 años, Francisca inició una pequeña tienda de abarrotes por la necesidad de tener un poco más de dinero para su familia y para mostrar apoyo a su pareja. Comenzó vendiendo dulces y refrescos que simplemente exhibía fuera de su casa. Hoy en día Francisca ya tiene un local y ofrece un extenso surtido de productos a sus clientes. Estos avances los ha logrado gracias a su esfuerzo y a los préstamos de VisionFund México que recibe desde hace 8 años y que ha utilizado para comprar arroz, pasta, frijoles, productos enlatados, galletas, refrescos, jugos, dulces, entre otros.

La mayor ilusión de Francisca es que sus hijos estudien una carrera profesional y dar continuidad a su negocio que es el patrimonio para ellos. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en el jardín del municipio, Doña Francisca es quien tiene el reboso en color morado*
texts.en:
The “Nueva Ilusión” (New Hope) group comes from a very tranquil community where the people maintain their well-rooted customs and traditions. For the members, the name of the group means a lot: the opportunity of receiving a loan is a new hope for their businesses and their families.  

Doña Francisca is married to Eduardo, who works in the fields. They are parents with 4 children, only 2 of whom still depend on them and are fortunately continuing their studies.  

9 years ago, Francisca opened a small grocery shop because she needed a little more money for her family and to show some support for her husband. She started out selling confectionery and soft drinks which she simply displayed outside her house. Now she has a shop and offers an extensive range of products to her customers. She has made these advances thanks to her hard work and the loans from VisionFund Mexico which she has been receiving for 8 years and which she has used to buy rice, pasta, beans, canned good, biscuits, soft drinks, juices, confectionery and other products. 

Francisca's greatest dreams are that her children will study for professional careers and to continue running her business, which is their heritage.  

*The photograph was taken in the town hall garden. Doña Francisca is the one with the violet shawl*

loans.use: to buy rice, pasta, beans, canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks, juices and confectionery

location.town: La Virgen del Centro, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Nikolai

texts.en:
Nikolai is from Zaporozhye. He is 38. He is married with two kids. Nikolai sells men's footwear: shoes, sneakers, tennis shoes and boots. His vending locations offer a nice selection of merchandise at affordable prices, as well as seasonal discounts.

Nikolai is planning to buy seasonal merchandise for 60,000 grivnyas, mostly targeting younger clientele. Having this business as the only source of income for his family motivates Nikolai to work hard and seek ways to further develop his business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana has already received financial assistance from Kiva. She used it to increase her winter merchandise – jackets and headgear. Moreover, she purchased additional dresses and gowns for sale, too. Tatyanya's prices went up due to new available merchandise which helped her increase her income as well. Tatyana's store is one of the best in her town offering a variety of good quality merchandise. She bought a piece of land recently and started construction work on her new house. She could also remodel a room for two young sons and purchase needed furniture for their room.

Tatyana is seeking additional 60,000 grivnyas to purchase spring and summer clothing merchandise for children. Tatyana is hoping to see how the situation in Ukraine will get stable which would ultimately lead to better sales rates.

loans.use: to purchase spring and summer clothing merchandise for children

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia is a single mother and she has a little daughter but she has her own house the place is small but Julia and her daughter are happy. Julia learned to make cheese since she was a child. She visits the fair in Pongohuyo to sell his products Julia needs a loan to buy a milking cow.  She hopes you can help her.
texts.en: Julia is a single mother and she has a little daughter. She has her own house and the place is small, but Julia and her daughter are happy. Julia learned to make cheese when she was a child. She visits the fair in Pongohuyo to sell her products. Julia needs a loan to buy a milking cow. She hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi is a farmer from Vodyanoye. He has two sons – a 10-year-old and a 13-year-old. He owns some land property in his home town. Vitalyi has two big greenhouses and one smaller greenhouse for seedlings. He has heating in all of his greenhouses. He has been running his farming business growing cucumbers and tomatoes for 12 years. Vitalyi used to work as a welder and then he had a job in a bakery. However, he realized that it would be better to be self-employed and started his agricultural business.

Vitalyi needs an additional 12,000 grivnyas to cover his greenhouses with plastic film for the coming spring season and to fix one of his greenhouses, making a seed bed which requires buying wood, wiring and electrodes. In the future Vitalyi is planning to reconstruct his greenhouses, making them bigger and more spacious to make it easier to work in them.

loans.use: to cover his greenhouses with plastic film for the coming spring season and to fix one of his greenhouses, making a seed bed.

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.en:
Santa Maria is a small rural community outside Quetzaltenango, the second largest city in Guatemala. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank of the same name is located here and has just made their final payment on their very first loan, generously funded by Kiva investors. The businesses of the ladies, which include the sale of food items (bakery items, tortillas, fruit, vegetables, chicken, meat), are prospering. The group is requesting a new loan.

Natalia is a 39-year-old member of the Trust Bank. She is married and has three children. Natalia is the owner of a small restaurant and has three employees. The business is open every day from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. Natalia is requesting a new loan that she will use to purchase rice, corn, pasta, fruit, vegetables and oil. She reports that because of her income, she is able to send all three of her children to school.

The women realize the value of education, both for their children and for themselves. Each month at their Trust Bank meetings, a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer shares useful information with the women in their own language (often they only speak their native dialect). The trainings are taught with stories and pictures as the women have had little or no education. A recent topic concerned the goals and dreams of the women. Other subjects covered include effective business practices (planning, budgeting, pricing, marketing, customer service, accounting), health, hygiene, nutrition, women’s rights and violence against women.

Kiva investors are very much appreciated by the women in the “Santa Maria” Trust Bank. The women are poised to step into a more prosperous future, benefiting themselves, their families and their community of Santa Maria. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase rice, corn, pasta, fruit, vegetables and oil for her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase supplies like glue, nails and leather to make shoes

loans.name: Darkul

texts.ru: Даркул 41 год, есть 3 детей, образование высшее. Даркул работает учителем в лицее, получая ежемесячную зарплату в размере 65,000 сом (KGS). Она решила обратиться в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS), целью которого является ремонт квартиры с последующей сдачей ее в аренду. На заемные средства она приобретет обои, краску, радиаторы батарей. Сдача квартиры в аренду позволит получать дополнительный доход. Свою заработную плату она планирует направлять на обучение детей.
texts.en: Darkul is 41 years old and the mother of three. She has a college degree and works as  high school teacher, receiving a monthly salary of 65,000 KGS. She has decided to reach out to the Bai Tushum microfinance association for a loan in the amount of 65,000 KGS in order to renovate her apartment and subsequently offer it for lease. She will use her loan to buy wallpaper, paint and heating radiators. Leasing her apartment will allow her to receive an additional income. She plans to use her regular salary to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy wallpaper, paint and radiators in order to renovate her apartment and prepare it for leasing.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Зарина, 29 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Зарины высшее образование, на протяжении 4 лет занимается торговлей, полеводством и животноводством, у нее развитое хозяйство. Есть 4,20 Га земли, где она выращивает фасоль для реализации, также собственные магазины, в которых она продает продукты питания и одежду. Ежемесячная совокупная прибыль составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зарина обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, семян и топлива для обработки почвы. Доходы Зарина планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Zarina is 29 and married with three children. She has a higher education and has been working in retail, agriculture and animal husbandry for four years. She has a diverse business that includes 4.2 hectares of land where she grows beans for sale, as well as her own shops in which she sells groceries and clothing. Her total monthly income is about 20,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Zarina has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 80,000 KGS to purchase fertilizers, seeds and fuel for her farming. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fuel and fertilizers for land cultivation and development of her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more hens, chicks, and poultry feed.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 48 years old. She is divorced and she has two sons. Lucia lives with her in-laws and she is still cooking Bolivian food to make money. Lucia needs a loan to buy meat, rice, noodles, soft drinks, and fruit (to make juices). Lucia still wants to have a big restaurant. Right now, she is the only one in her home who makes money, which is why it is important that you help her.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice, noodles, soft drinks, and fruit (to make juices).

loans.name: Milenka

texts.en: Milenka is 19 years old. She pays rent and she helps her sister. Milenka is a seamstress and she was trained by her sister. Together they make gloves, hats, and other clothes. Milenka and her sister support their family. Milenka needs a loan to buy wool. That item will be very useful for her. Milenka is single and she is very responsible.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en: Candelaria lives alone but she has her own house, although the place has no sewerage. Candelaria makes cheese to make some money. Candelaria needs a loan to buy a milking cow. Candelaria doesn't know people who can help her with the loan, which is the reason that she is asking help from Kiva. She promises she will do her best.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 37 years old and she sells books and library products. Alicia is married and her husband is a taxi driver. The couple has five children. 

Alicia wants to offer more products, so she needs a loan to buy library products. She is convinced that she can improve her income. That is why she is asking for extra help, because her husband can't give her all the money she needs for her business.

loans.use: to buy library products.

loans.name: Benito

texts.en:
Benito is 66 years old. He is married and he is a father, but all of his kids are adults already. He lives alone with his wife. 

Benito is an expert at making cheese and he makes it every day. The work is hard for a senior citizen, but Benito is not tired yet. Benito needs a loan to buy a milking cow. He hopes you can support him.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Valeria

texts.en:
Valeria, 53, is married and has three children. All the family members live in the same house, which Valeria owns. Valeria's husband travels around Bolivia for his work selling cheese. 

With help from her family, Valeria makes the cheese. She is requesting a loan to buy cattle. She knows how to attend to milking cows, a skill she learned when she was a child. She hopes you can trust her.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Nuevamente María solicita un crédito a FUSAI dado que desea invertir en la construcción de las paredes de su baño sanitario. Ella es una mujer increíble quien se esfuerza por dar a su familia condiciones más cómodas e higiénicas. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, hierro y para pagar por la mano de obra necesaria para la construcción.  María expresa estar muy agradecida por el apoyo recibido para la mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en: María is requesting another loan from FUSAI because she wants to invest in building the walls of her bathroom. She is an amazing woman who works hard to provide more comfortable and hygienic conditions for her family. She will use the amount she is requesting to buy cement, sand and and iron, and pay for the labour she needs to build the bathroom walls. María says that she is very grateful for the support she receives to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and iron, and pay for the labour she needs to build the bathroom walls.

loans.name: Yesenia Rubi

texts.es:
Yesenia es una joven mujer de 23 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de derecho.
Ella es inteligente, responsable, comprometida, constante, dulce, cariñosa, sensible y sincera. Sus estudios los realiza en la universidad Tecnológica en la zona Central, un área caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas, y que alberga a universidades, oficinas públicas y empresas privadas que conviven lado a lado, de clima frío y seco, con una temperatura ambiente entre 14-24 grados centígrados que varía durante el día
Yesenia es de tez morena, cabello castaño largo peinado a la moda, ojos obscuros, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará el cual ya no habla porque estudia y vive en la ciudad. Su vida la realiza junto a sus padres que trabajan como comerciantes, viven en una casa propia que cuenta con los servicios de luz, agua y alcantarillado. Ella cursa la carrera de derecho y se encuentra en 3 año de 5 años que dura la carrera; disfruta ayudando a las personas, le gusta conciliar a la gente, su carácter es de servicio. Trabaja realizando ploteo de planos, actividad que le resta tiempo. “deseo terminar mi carrera para trabajar en mi rubro y generar mejores ingresos económicos…” comenta. Su sueño es ser profesional para conseguir un buen empleo y desea pagar las cuotas de su carrera por adelantado para así obtener un descuento. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica al estudio profesional. 
Es por esos motivos que Yesenia solicita un préstamo para pagar las cuotas de todo el año de su universidad y obtener un descuento.
texts.en:
Yesenia is a young, 23-year-old woman. She is single, does not have any children, and studies law.

She is intelligent, responsible, committed, persevering, sweet, caring, sensitive, and sincere. She studies in the University of Technology in the central zone. It is an area known for all kinds of commerce, and it is home to many universities, government offices, and private companies, which are side-by-side. The area has a cold, dry climate, with a temperature that varies between 14-24ºC [57-75ºF] during the day.

Yesenia has dark skin; brown, long hair which is styled fashionably; dark eyes; and a slender physique. Her native language is Aymará, but she doesn’t speak it anymore since she studies and lives in the city. He shares her life with her parents, who work as merchants. They live in their own house, which has light, water, and plumbing. She is studying law and she is in her third year of the five-year program. She enjoys helping people. She likes to help people reconcile their differences. She has a very helpful character.

She works making blueprints, which is a job that takes a lot of time. “I want to finish my studies to work in my line of business and to generate more income,” she says. Her dream is to be a professional and to find a good job. She wants to pay off her university bills ahead of time so that she can get a discount. This is the first sequence of loans that she borrows from the institution in the 3 years that she has been studying.

It is for these reasons that Yesenia is requesting a loan to pay her university bills for the whole year and obtain a discount.

loans.use: to pay her university bills for the whole year and obtain a discount.

loans.name: Polleritas Multicolor Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “POLLERITAS MULTICOLOR” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Adela es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ensaladas de frutas, venta de aguayos, venta de tucumanas, venta de mantas, servicio de transporte, venta de polleras, venta de leche.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Adela es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de aguayos; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio por el incentivo de su madre, a quien le ayudaba desde niña, con el pasar del tiempo decide implementar un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de aguayos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará a solicitud del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The credit association “Polleritas Multicolor” [Multicolored Skirts] will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the focal center of Villa Adela. It is made up of eight members, and it is directed by a board of directors where Adela is the Secretary. The members’ businesses are varied and include: selling fruit salads, selling wool cloths, selling meat pastries, selling blankets, providing transportation services, selling skirts, and selling milk. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small entrepreneurs. Adela is a member of the group. She says that this is the first time that she participates in Pro Mujer. She joined because of the invitation she received through one of the institution’s massive promotions in the area. Currently, she has a business where she sells wool cloths. She let us know that she started the business because of the encouragement of her mother, who she helped since she was a little girl. As time passed, she decided to start her own independent business.

The loan that she is taking out now is to increase her capital (to buy wool cloth on wholesale). She will get the cloths from the wholesale vendors in La Paz, and then she will sell them at the request of her customers. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wool cloths on wholesale.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es una joven mujer de 21 años, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de utensilios de plástico.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, generosa, sensible, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘16 de julio’; un área estratégica porque tiene un alto flujo comercial; es una vitrina de la producción de la pequeña y mediana empresa, la zona es una muestra del panorama típico comercial e industrial de la ciudad, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre  0-16 grados centígrados y se encuentra a una altitud de 4070 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Lidia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. su vida la comparte con su papá que trabaja y con sus 2 hermanas que trabajan en el comercio, viven en una casa alquilada, que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el comercio de utensilios de plástico como; jarras, baldes, bañadores y otros. Actividad que realiza de forma ambulante en diferentes ferias y mercados de la ciudad, en diferentes horarios según la distancia de los comercios. “mis productos tiene gran demanda porque se utilizan para todo tipo de actividad, mis ventas bajan cuando existen paros de transporte, porque no puedo movilizarme…” comenta. Su sueño es incrementar sus ingresos económicos para abrir un restaurante, ella desea realizar la compra de productos plásticos por mayor, como; bañadores grandes y jarras medianas, para ofertar mayor variedad a sus clientes y aumentar sus ventas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Lidia solicita un préstamo para la compra de utensilios plásticos por mayor para incrementar sus ventas y abrir un restaurante.
texts.en:
Lidia is a single, 21-year-old young woman with no children, and her business is selling plastic products. She is entrepreneurial, independent, generous, sensible, responsible and hardworking. 

She grew her business in the ‘16 de julio’ zone, a strategic area because it has a high volume of commercial traffic and showcases the work of small and medium businesses. The area is an example of the typical commercial and industrial work in the city, with a cold, dry climate with temperatures ranging between 0 and 16 degrees Celsius and an altitude of 4,070 meters above sea level.  

Lidia is dark skinned; has long, black hair and dark eyes; and is short statured. Her native language is Aymará that she speaks with her family, but she also speaks Spanish due to the general culture and doing her business. She shares her life with her father that works and her two sisters that work in the business. She lives in a rental house that has running water, electricity, gas and a sewage system. 

Her business is the selling of plastic products such as pitchers, buckets, pails and other items. She conducts her business as a street vendor at various festivals and markets in the city, on different schedules according to the distance from the commercial area. “My products are in great demand because they’re used for all types of activities. My sales fall when there are transportation strikes because I can’t get around,” Lidia shared. 

Her dream is to grow her income in order to open a restaurant. She wants to purchase wholesale plastic products such as large pails and medium pitchers to offer a greater variety to her customers and increase her sales. This is the first loan in two years with the institution that supports this type of independent business.  

It is for these reasons that Lidia is requesting a loan to purchase wholesale plastic products to increase her sales and open a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy wholesale plastic products to increase her sales and open a restaurant.

loans.name: Comadres Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “COMADRES” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Haydie es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de flores, servicio de transporte, venta de llantas, venta de cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Haydie es integrante, ella indica que hace varios años estaba en la institución sin embargo salió y ahora vuelve a integrar Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de llantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia, al observar que estos productos eran ampliamente comercializados en el mercado. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de llantas por mayor) que adquirirá de vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The credit association “Comadres” [Close Friends] will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the focal center of Santiago II. It is made up of eight members, and it is directed by a board of directors where Haydie is the President. The members’ businesses are varied and include: selling flowers, providing transportation services, selling tires, and selling cosmetics. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small entrepreneurs. Haydie is a member of the group. She says that, years ago, she was in the institution, but she left and she is now returning to be a member of Pro Mujer. She rejoined because of the invitation she received from a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business where she sells tires. She let us know that she started the business years ago because of her own initiative, after seeing that these products were widely sold in the markets.

The loan that she is taking out now is to increase her capital (to buy tires on wholesale). She will get the tires from the wholesale vendors in La Paz, and then she will sell them in her shop. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is single and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy tires on wholesale.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
In May of 2000, Jose decided to start his own business providing physicals, drug tests, and background checks for companies. He wished to address what he saw as a lack of efficient services in the sector of health testing. Now he employs three contractors, and evidence of his success can be found in past contracts with well-known sports organizations and university sports teams.

Jose moved from Puerto Rico to the United States sixteen years ago. He currently lives with his wife, and his business helps him support his daughter.

This loan will allow him to spearhead a marketing initiative to augment his client base and expand his business. In the future, he plans to finish his Master’s in Business Administration in the next year, with a concentration in Human Resources. He hopes to grow his business enough to hire more people and expand his business to other parts of the US and the globe.

loans.use: to improve marketing efforts and expand the client base for his business that provides physicals, drug tests, and background checks for companies.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
Ninfa tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente y los pobladores se dedican principlamente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 03 años y cuenta con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite, etc, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, esto le servirá para tener mayor variedad de productos de primera necesidad esto con la finalidad de poder satifacer los gustos de sus clientes y asi poder incrementar sus ventas lo que le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ninfa is 43 years old. She has a partner, and she lives in her own house in a rural area of the Oyotún district, which is located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru. Life in this district is calm, and the people there primarily work in agriculture, livestock, and commerce.

She makes a living selling staple goods such as rice, sugar, and oil, among other things. She has had this business for 3 years, and she relies on regular customers, who provide very good personal and professional references. She is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, noodles, oil, etc. to increase the stock of her business. This will help her have a greater variety of staple products, which will allow her to satisfy the tastes of her customers. This way, she will increase her sales, which will allow her to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, oil, etc. to increase the stock of her business.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 46 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school.

Margie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like snack food, canned goods, diapers, and other miscellaneous items.

Margie has been in this business for four years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Margie aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack food, canned goods, diapers, and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines.

Editha requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional containers of purified drinking water to sell. Editha has been in this business for six years now.

Editha would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Artesanas Santa Catarina Group

texts.en:
Santa Catarina Palopo is on the shores of the beautiful Lake Atitlan. It is a very small town where the Friendship Bridge's Artesanas Santa Catarina was formed by seven extraordinary craftswomen. Making handicrafts is the primary and most productive form of work for the women of Santa Catarina Palopo, a place where exquisite blue colours infuse the tones of the local typical clothing. These blue hues make the huipiles and cortes very distinctive throughout the region. 

The leader of this group, Ana, is 37 years old and married with seven children. She never had a formal education. Nevertheless, she works the best she knows how at producing fine crafts. Since childhood, Ana has been making the traditional regional fabric and also has done painting. Over time, she opened up a shop in the center of town, where she sells many different local crafts.  

Ana is asking for a loan to buy a variety of fabrics, accessories and paintings to sell along with her own crafts. This will allow her to meet the higher demand that comes with summer time, which is rapidly approaching. 

Ana and the other group members are very happy with the monthly meetings that the Trust Bank facilitator coordinates. These meetings include educational topics that are a part of Friendship Bridge's "microcredit plus" program, which gives women the opportunity to learn about self-esteem, medicinal plants and mental and preventative health. They also learn about business, such as budgeting, accounting, marketing and customer service -- all very important topics for the success of their businesses. Ana says that this program has helped improve the group’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy a variety of fabrics, accessories and paintings to sell along with her own crafts

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia is 31 years old and she lives with her parents in law Every tuesday and friday she goes to Desaguadero to buy women t shirts to sell them in many places and also she has a DVD store Sonia is a good business manager so she is asking a loan to open a liquor store because she thinks she has the chance to make more money and to improve the life quality of her family Sonia is the mother of 3 children
texts.en: Sonia is 31 years old and lives with her parents-in-law. Every Tuesday and Friday she goes to Desaguadero to buy women's t-shirts to then sell in many places. She also has a DVD store. Sonia is a good business manager, so she is asking for a loan to open a liquor store because she thinks she has the chance to make more money and to improve her family's quality of life. Sonia is the mother of three children.

loans.use: to open a liquor store

loans.name: Gabriela Alejandra

texts.es:
Gabriela es una joven mujer de 18 años, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la confección de tejidos.
Ella es dulce, sincera, sensible, cariñosa, amable, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla de forma ambulante en la zona ‘16 de julio’; caracterizada por el comercio informal, donde se puede encontrar desde una aguja para coser hasta un tractor para arar. De clima frio y seco  con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0ºC -16ºC, a una altura promedio de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Gabriela es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por el comercio que realiza. su vida la realiza en compañía de su madre, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección y elaboración de prendas de vestir en lana, anteriormente sólo se dedicaba a la confección de pantalones de lana tipo buzo, con el anterior préstamo que obtuvo pudo ampliar su mercadería y obtener mejores ingresos, con esos ingresos extras accedió a estudiar corte y confección en un instituto privado. “con el préstamo kiva obtenido anteriormente, tuve buenos resultados y generé mejores ingresos, logrando acceder a un instituto, mis estudios me dejan menos tiempo para vender pero como vendo ambulantemente me acomodo en buenos lugares y vendo mis prendas rápidamente…” comenta. Su sueño es incrementar su producción, contratar tejedores y aumentar su variedad de productos, ella desea realizar la compra de variedades de lanas por mayor para contar con material de trabajo constante y mejorar su variedad de oferta. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Gabriela solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedad de lanas por mayor para incrementar su producción y continuar estudiando.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a young, 18-year-old woman. She is single, does not have children, and she works in fabric production.

She is sweet, sincere, sensitive, caring, friendly, responsible, and hardworking. She carries out her business as a street vendor in the July 16th area. The area is known for informal commerce, and is a place where one can find everything from a needle to sew to a tractor to plow. It has a cold, dry climate, with a temperature that varies throughout the day between 0ºC-16ºC [32ºF-60ºF]. The area is at an average altitude of 3800 meters above sea level.

Gabriela has dark skin; long, black hair that she wears tied back; brown eyes; a short stature; and a slender physique. Her native language is Aymará, which is what she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish because of her commerce. She shares her life with her mother. They live in their own house, which is made of brick and cement and has a corrugated iron roof. The house has potable water, electricity, gas, and plumbing. 

Her business is the production of wool garments. Before, she only made wool sweatpants. With the prior loan that she obtained, she expanded her merchandise and started obtaining better income. With the extra income, she started studying sewing and dressmaking in a private institute. “With the Kiva loan I got before, I had good results and generated more income. I was able to join an institute. My studies leave me less time to sell, but since I am a street vendor, I put myself in good locations and I sell my garments quickly,” she comments. 

Her dream is to increase her production, to hire weavers, and to expand her variety of products. She wants to buy a variety of wools on wholesale to be able to have a constant supply of working material and to improve the variety of what she offers. This is the second sequence of loans with the institution in the one year that she has been working in this occupation.

It is for these reasons that Gabriela is requesting a loan to buy a variety of wools on wholesale, in order to increase her production and continue studying.

loans.use: to buy a variety of wools on wholesale, in order to increase her production and continue studying.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey is 35 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with two children who are at school age. Rey has diversified business activities. He earns a living from his own motorcycle for hire business. He is also engaged in hog fattening and gardening activities. Now, he wants to venture into another business for additional income. 

He has requested a loan to purchase groceries and other consumable products for his newly opened sari-sari store business. Rey has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. In the future, Rey hopes to expand his sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: Ma. Novie

texts.en: Ma. Novie signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Ma. Novie is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Millali

texts.en:
Creative, eight-year-old Milla loved making jewelry for fun. But unlike most artistic eight-year-olds, she took her passion several steps further and funded the opening of a unique bead and craft store in Somerville.

Milla was inspired to turn a life-long passion into a profitable business. She wanted to provide an opportunity to other jewelry designers to sell their products, and provide a craft space where anyone could be inspired by creative arts, as she was as a young girl.

The store has experienced constant growth, but has experienced some difficulty obtaining enough capital to invest and expand the company as needed. This loan will support operational costs through the winter and allow Milla to finish the craft school section of the store.

Milla is originally from Venezuela and moved to the US over five years ago to pursue and grow her career in sustainable engineering. While she is not involved on the day to day store activities she enjoys seeing it grow. She hopes to see the store provide multiple crafting programs and create a community maker-space for jewelry design, as well as continue to help local designers sell their works.

Check out the store’s website at www.beadkreative.com

loans.use: to cover operational costs and finish the craft section of her bead and jewelry shop.

loans.name: Mitchel

texts.en: Mitchel is 27 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two school-aged children. Mitchel earns income from meat butchering and vending business together with her husband. She is also engaged in snack processing and vending business. The couple earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing ingredients and aluminum foil for her snack vending business. Mitchel has been a member of PMPC for almost a year. In the future, Mitchel hopes to expand her snack processing, meat butchering and vending business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing ingredients and aluminum foil for her snack vending business

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
Adam is well known in his community as a passionate fitness instructor with an inspirational background. After losing 125 pounds through exercise and healthier habits, Adam decided to develop his fitness interests into a business. Several years ago, he started his own business offering exercise classes and personal training. He was recently named Cleveland’s #1 Fitness Instructor and has been featured on “LIVE with Kelly and Michael.”

As could be expected, demand for Adam’s fitness classes is high, and he seeks to expand his services. With this loan, he hopes to purchase much-needed exercise equipment, such as spin bikes, to address the requests of his current customers and draw in new ones.

In the future, he hopes to expand his business enough to open a second location. Help him continue to encourage and facilitate healthy lifestyles for his community!

loans.use: to purchase spin bikes to expand services and increase revenue for his fitness company.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase essential tools and equipment to expand the services of his plumbing company.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is grateful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan which she used to buy raw ingredients needed in her food stall business. Her earnings help support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like now to apply for another 20,000 PHP which she will use to buy more ingredients to make bean curd pudding to sell. She is encouraged by the positive sales of her pudding. She is positive that her earnings will increase as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Carol dreams that all her hard work will bear fruit to give her family a bright future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the ingredients for bean curd pudding.

loans.name: Charie

texts.en:
Charie, 36, is married with one child, who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Charie buys and sells eggs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years.

She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan, of 10,000 Philippine pesos, through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy more trays of eggs to sell to her customers and further develop her business.

Charie would like to build and expand her business to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more trays of eggs to sell to her customers

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Emma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Emma  is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell to her customers for her buy and sell rice business.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester works hard to support her family. Ester is married and has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Ester requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Ester has been in this business for four years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ester would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Charito has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 49 years old and married with four children. Evangeline works very hard to provide for them.

Evangeline runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Evangeline has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, sanitary pads, detergent soap, fabric conditioners, coffee, sugar, etc. 

Evangeline would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Carla Selena

texts.es:
Carla es una joven mujer de 18 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, tiene 6 hermanos, y estudia en la universidad.
Ella es inteligente, amable, alegre, feliz, comprometida con sus estudios, responsable y trabajadora. Sus estudios los realiza en la universidad técnica privada ubicada en el tercer anillo interno a poco más de dos kilómetros del centro de la ciudad, de clima cálido subtropical donde los meses de mayor precipitación pluvial son enero y febrero, el mes más caliente es enero, y el mes más frío es julio.
Carla es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que ya no habla y habla español porque estudia en la universidad. Su vida la comparte con su madre que vende comida y con sus 6 hermanos que estudian en la escuela. Viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Los estudios en la universidad los alterna con la venta de comida que realiza ayudando a su madre en el negocio familiar. Ella estudia la carrera de contabilidad porque tiene conocimientos en matemáticas y maneja bien el lenguaje, además posee capacidad de discernimiento para tomar decisiones y mucho interés por la informática y el acontecer económico y financiero del país. “estudio contabilidad porque deseo ampliar el negocio familiar y realizar mejores cuentas y una correcta administración…” comenta. Su sueño es terminar su carrera profesional y ampliar el negocio de su madre, ella desea realizar el pago de las cuotas de su universidad y comprar los libros necesarios para sus materias. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en su 2 año de estudios y 8 años de trabajo.
Es por esos motivos que Carla solicita un préstamo para pagar las cuotas de su universidad y comprar libros para continuar con su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Carla is a young woman, 18 years old, and single, without children, who has six siblings, and studies at the university.

She is intelligent, friendly, happy, pleasant, devoted to her studies, responsible and hard-working. Carla studies at the private technical university located on the third internal ring, a little over two kilometers from the city center. Here the climate is hot and subtropical and the months of heaviest rain are January and February; the hotest month is January, and the coldest month is July.

Carla is dark-complexioned with long black tightly-knotted hair, dark eyes, short of stature, and slender. Her mother tongue is Guarani, which she no longer speaks; now she prefers Spanish while she studies at the university. Carla shares her life with her mother, who sells meals, and with her six siblings who also study in school. They live in a rented house constructed of blocks and cement with a calamine roof, potable water, electricity and tile floors.

In addition to her university studies, Carla sells meals, aiding her mother in the family business. Carla is pursuing a career in accounting; she has some knowledge of mathematics and handles the language well. In addition, she possesses the capacity and discernment to make decisions, plus much interest in computer technology, accounting economics, and national financial matters. “I study accounting because I want to expand the family business and keep better accounts and establish a correct administration...,” she commented.  

Carla's dream is to complete preparation for her professional career and to expand her mother's business. She wants to pay her fees at the university and purchase the necessary books for her courses. This is her second loan cycle with this institution and her second year of studies, and her eight year of working.

These are Carla's motives for soliciting a loan to pay her university fees and buy books to continue her professional career preparation.

loans.use: to pay university fees and purchase books in order to continue her studies for a professional career.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.en:
Santiago completely paid off his last Kiva loan, and has now qualified for another to expand his cleaning and repair company!

Over 20 years ago, Santiago came to the United States from Ecuador with the dream of creating a better life for both himself and his family. In 1998, he started working as a handyman for multiple hotels in the state of Florida. However “handyman” is most certainly an understatement. A jack of all trades, Santiago focuses on everything from maintenance to janitorial work and effectively ensures the hotels run smoothly and efficiently. In 2004, two hotels required Santiago to incorporate, and thus, Solutions Maintenance Corp. was born. He has received a steady flow of business over the past few years and has earned a reputation as a hardworking and friendly man. However, Santiago needs to purchase new cleaning equipment in order to provide better and expanded service to his growing customer base. Help this hardworking man make a better life for both himself and his family!

loans.use: to purchase new cleaning equipment

loans.name: Las Princesas Del Castillo Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Princesas del Castillo estaba conformado inicialmente solo por mujeres. Su unión y amistad la demuestran al  disfrutar los momentos de convivencia compartiendo la comida cada que terminan un ciclo de préstamo. 

Doña Teresa o Tere, como le llaman sus conocidos, es una mujer muy platicadora, siempre está de muy buen humor. Ella está casada con Juan y tienen una niña que actualmente estudia su educación primaria. 

Tere y su esposo se dedican a dar servicio de taxi y actualmente necesitan apoyo económico para terminar de pagar su nuevo auto. Don Juan inició trabajando como chofer y con el paso del tiempo se dio cuenta de las ganancias que podría obtener y se aventuró a ser independiente. Hoy en día la pareja ya cuenta con dos autos y gracias a sus ganancias han podido mejorar su vivienda. 

"Realmente las ganancias son buenas, nos alcanza bien para solventar los gastos del hogar, la educación de mi niña y para el pago del préstamo" comentó Doña Tere. Doña Tere tiene un local retando y su sueño es poder establecer un negocio; le encantaría vender diferentes tipos de productos para el hogar. 

Los integrantes del grupo son Yolanda quien invertira en maiz para tortillas, Luisa en becerros,Tomasa en miselanea, Tomas corral para borregos, Adriana Cafe internet, Cayetana pollos, Angelica en estética.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el negocio de Doña Yolanda quien viste pantalón rosa. Doña Tere es quien tiene un rebozo color gris*
texts.en:
The group “Princesas del Castillo” [Princesses of the Castle] was originally made up of only women. They show their unity and friendship when they enjoy moments together, sharing food whenever they finish a loan cycle.

Teresa – or Tere, as her friends call her – is a very chatty woman. She is always in a good mood. She is married to Juan and they have a daughter who is currently studying in elementary school.

Tere and her husband make their living by providing a taxi service, and they currently need financial support to finish paying off their new vehicle. Juan started working as a chauffer, and with the passing of time he realized the earnings that he could make and he set off to become independent. Today, the couple has two vehicles, and, thanks to their earnings, they have been able to improve their home.

“Really, the earnings are good. We make enough to resolve our household expenses, pay for my daughter’s education, and to pay back the loan,” Tere commented. Tere has a shop, and her dream is to open a business. She would love to sell different types of products for the home. 

The members of the group are: Yolanda, who will invest in corn for tortillas; Luisa, who will invest in bull calves; Tomasa, who will invest in miscellaneous items; Tomas, who will invest in a pen for his sheep; Adriana, who will invest in her internet café; Cayetana, who will invest in chickens; and Angelica, who will invest in her aesthetics business.

*The photograph was taken in Yolanda’s business. She is wearing pink pants. Tere is the one with a grey shawl.*

loans.use: to finish paying off her new taxi.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Eighteen years ago, Carlos moved to the US from Brazil and began to build an impressive career as an entrepreneur. After years of working hard and building an acute understanding of Florida business opportunities, Carlos is currently the president of Upmatrix Corporation, a commercial electronics sales company, and holds highly influential roles in several other companies, including a web design business.

Carlos lives with his wife and two children, whom he supports with his companies. For the past eight years, his company, Upmatrix Corp., has worked with electronics and technology distributors to sell products at affordable prices to local companies. However, he occasionally has to worry about having enough money to provide all the merchandise his clients request. With this loan, Carlos will be able to improve the services of his electronics sales company by purchasing more merchandise such as computer parts, computer accessories, and commercial electronics. In the future, Carlos plans to expand his client base and increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy more mechandise for his commercial electronics sales company

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Elvira works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Elvira is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients, like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, and more, for her food production business.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, and more, for her food production business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Virginia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from making and selling bags. Virginia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients like flour, sugar and other spices for her food business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar and other spices for her food business.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gabriela is 44 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Gabriela has a general store business in the Philippines. Gabriela requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock like shampoo, cereals, milk, fabric conditioners, soft drinks, beers, etc. to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Gabriela has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Gabriela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock like shampoo, cereals, milk, fabric conditioners, soft drinks, beers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Karisa

texts.en:
Karisa originally started court reporting to support herself through law school. However, she soon discovered that her love and talent for court reporting made it a more logical career choice than law. She decided to go into the field because she loved the flexibility, the people she met, and the exposure to all types of law and cases. As a single mother, she wanted to make her own hours and be able to spend as much time as possible with her children. 

An Oklahoma native, Karisa started her own court reporting business over 10 years ago. She is proud to have been able to set a good example for her children by working very hard, independently running a successful business, and single-handedly providing for her family. She currently supports three children, one of whom is in college. 

This loan will help Karisa with advertising efforts to expand her client base and increase business. By increasing business, she hopes to be able to take on her two employees full-time and hire an office assistant.

loans.use: to grow her client base and hire an office assistant for her court reporting company

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her construction company services to include municipal and state projects

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia, 68, is married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for eight years. She sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, vinegar, cooking oil and detergent.
 
She has requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, vinegar, cooking oil and detergent.

In the future, Cresencia would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items, such as canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, vinegar, cooking oil and detergent, to sell.

loans.name: Lucelly

texts.es:
Lucelly una mujer de 33 años de edad, carga sobre sus hombros una enorme responsabilidad mantener la cantidad de 6 hijos ellos tienen 17, 15, 13, 10, 7, 3 años de edad lo más impresionante es que ella es separada, es cabeza de familia a todos sus hijos los ama, quiere lo mejor para ellos y con su negocio de cría de aves hace lo posible por generar los recursos para mantenerlos. 
Ella quiere mejorar sus ventas, esto le permitiría mejorar su calidad de vida, comer mejor, permitir la educación de sus hijos y la sostenibilidad de su negocio.
Solicita un préstamo para  el cual invertirá en la compra de pollos y alimento, la verdad vale la pena ayudar a esta joven, porque mostro responsabilidad, y carácter a asumir las riendas del hogar y no dejar pasar necesidades a su familia.
texts.en:
Lucelly is 33 years old and carries a massive weight on her shoulders.  She supports six children that are 17, 15, 13, 10, 7, and 3 years old. She is separated from her husband and she is the head of her family. She loves all of her kids and wants the best for them. She supports them via her business of raising chickens, which makes it possible to generate the income she needs to support them.

She wants to improve her sales, which will help her improve her family's quality of life, enable them to eat better, provide an education for her children, and sustain her business.

She is seeking a loan which she will use to invest in chicken and feed.  It is worth it to help this young woman because she is responsible and has a strong character, as we can see by how she has taken the reigns of her household and meets her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy chicken and feed.

loans.name: Geogette

texts.en:
Geogette is 46 years old and a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Geogette has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Geogette has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Geogette would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Gabriela Andrea

texts.es:
Gabriela es una joven de 20 años, nació en ciudad de La Paz – Bolivia y vive junto a su mamá y sus abuelos, ella comenta que cuando era pequeña su padre tuvo que dejar su hogar pues se encontraba delicado de salud, sin embargo menciona que tanto sus abuelos como sus tíos, le brindaron el cariño y la protección, supliendo de alguna manera el vacío que dejó su padre.
Actualmente Gabriela trabaja durante el día para apoyar económicamente a su familia y por las noches se dedica a estudiar; se encuentra cursando el séptimo semestre de la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial y solicita financiamiento para su titulación; señala que al concluir sus estudios universitarios, contará con las herramientas necesarias para enfrentar un mercado laboral competitivo, y tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar su calidad de vida. Su sueño es poder emprender su propio negocio, y así constituir una fuente de empleo estable para sus dependientes. Gabriela agradece a las personas que a través de sus recursos le brindan la oportunidad de alcanzar su sueño.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a 20-year-old woman who was born in the city of La Paz, Bolivia, and lives with her mother and her grandparents. She says that when she was little her father had to leave home because his health was in a delicate condition. She also mentioned that her grandparents as well as her uncles and aunts gave her love and protection, in some ways filling the gap that her father left behind. 

Gabriela currently works during the day in order to support her family economically and at night she studies. She is in the seventh semester of her Business Engineering degree and she is asking for a loan to pay for her graduation. Once she finishes her university studies she will have the necessary tools to face the competitive jobs market, and she will have the opportunity to improve her quality of life.

Her dream is to be able to launch her own business and in this way continue to be a source of secure employment for her dependants. Gabriela is grateful to the people who use their resources to give her the opportunity to achieve her dream.

loans.use: to pay for her graduation from her degree in Business Engineering

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mercedes is 46 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Mercedes has a upholstery business in the Philippines. Mercedes requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials like textiles, nails, wood, etc. for her business.

Mercedes has been in this business for six years. In the future, Mercedes would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like textiles, nails, wood, etc. for her business

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing net and other equipment.

Jesusa successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Jesusa's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es:
Jaime es un hombre muy dedicado y entregado a su familia y trabajo, no le importa pasar largas jornadas con tal de llevar un alimento digno a su hogar, se dedica a la fabricación de calzado, trabajo pro pedidos y en ocasiones cuando le sobra material fabrica calzado para el mismo vender.
Jaime vive junto con su pareja con la cual tiene dos hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad, se preocupa no solo pro que estudien, coman bien, porque tengan juguetes, una sonrisa en su rostro y se desarrollen normalmente. 
Entre sus sueños más anhelados está poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, hacer mejoras locativas y poder dejarles a sus hijos una buena casa para vivir.
Jaime solicita un préstamo pensando en aumentar el nivel de producción por eso quiere comprar una remachadora, tapas, pegamento y suelas.
texts.en:
Jaime is very devoted to his family and his work. He spends long hours doing whatever is needed to make a decent living.  He makes and fixes shoes. He works from orders he receives and sometimes he fashions shoes from extra materials from the vender.

Jaime lives with his wife and they have two kids that are 7 and 5 years old. He worries not only that they study, but also that they eat well, they have toys, they smile, and they grow up well.  One of his biggest dreams is to be able to provide better living conditions, make improvements to their home, and provide his children with a good home to grow up in.

Jaime is seeking a loan so that he can increase his production. To do this, he need to buy a riveting machine, caps, glue, and soles.

loans.use: to buy a riveting machine, caps, glue, and soles.

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rodelia works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Rodelia is borrowing 11,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers for her vegetable vending business.

Rodelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is a 28-year-old high school graduate and lives in Bago City. She is married to Rey who works as a farmer. They have 2 children aged 8 and 6.  Their total monthly family income is only PHP 7,500 ($170). Joy has long seen the need to help her husband but didn’t have the means until she learned about the 2-month training program of Bagosphere that could lead to a call center job. Now that she has passed Bagosphere’s selection process, she needs your help to finance her tuition. Once Joy starts earning, she can help provide for her family’s basic needs and save some money for her children’s education. Joy is working towards a goal that will improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Raela Mae

texts.en:
Raela Mae is a 19-year-old college undergraduate living in a rural village in Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She  belongs to a family of five.
