Her father works as a fisherman and her mother is a housewife. Raela Mae has two siblings. Both of them are in elementary level. Their total monthly family income of PHP 10,000 ($226) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. 

This motivates Raela Mae to find the means to help the family have more income. That's why she braved the selection process of Bagosphere. She successfully passed it to qualify for the 2-month training program that could lead to a call center job. Apart from helping her family, she aims to finish her training and help her family and provide for their basic needs. Raela Mae would like to enhance her communication skills and to learn how to communicate with other people and earn a big salary.  Her biggest dream in life is to become a successful call center agent and to help her family. Your generosity in funding her loan will help Raela Mae have a better income in the coming months.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina tiene 27 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su hijo de 5 años de edad. Reina se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como junto a su esposo mantienen la economía del hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito para invertir en la reparación del techo y para la construcción de una pared en la vivienda. Con el crédito comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro,  grava, polines y lámina. Espera poder contar con este crédito y de esta forma poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en: Reina is 27 years old and she lives in her own house with her husband and their 5 year old son. Reina has worked  as a domestic worker for a very long time. This is how she and her husband maintain the economy of their household. Wishing to improve their quality of life, she is asking for a loan to repair their roof and to build a wall in their house. With this loan she will buy cement, sand, bricks, iron, gravel, reed matting and metal sheets. She hopes to get this loan to be able to improve the condition of their home.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, brick, iron, gravel, reed matting, and metal sheets to repair the roof and to build a wall in the house.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre de 32 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 3 años y una hija de 1 año, y su negocio es la venta de estuco.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor, solidario, de buena actitud, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla de forma ambulante de diferentes construcciones de la ciudad, situada al oeste del país a una altura de 4.000 metros sobre el nivel del mar en la meseta altiplánica y forma la aglomeración urbana más grande del país, el clima es frío durante todo el año y no llega superar los 17º grados Centígrados en verano.
Pedro es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultural general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica a labores de casa y con sus hijos que aún no están en edad escolar. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina y que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de estuco que es una pasta de grano fino compuesta de cal apagada, mármol pulverizado, yeso, pigmentos naturales, etc. Y que se endurece una vez mesclada con agua y se utiliza sobre todo para enlucir paredes y techos. Inicio esta actividad produciendo estuco hace más de 16 años, posteriormente se dedicó sólo al comercio de este producto. “mi principal ventaja es que cuento con mi camión que me sirve para repartir y vender estuco por toda la ciudad…” comenta. Su sueño es constituir su empresa de comercio de estuco a nivel masivo, él desea invertir en la compra de una carrocería para su camión, la que tiene esta dañada y filtra agua malogrando sus productos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Pedro solicita un préstamo para la compra de una carrocería para su camión para que su mercadería sea comercializada en perfectas condiciones.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 32-year-old man that lives with his wife and has a three-year-old son and a one-year-old daughter. His business is selling stucco. He is a good father, entrepreneurial, dependable, good natured, responsible and hard working. 

He developed his business as a short-term worker on different buildings in the city, located in the western region of the country at an altitude of 4,000 meters above sea level in a high plateau – forming the country’s largest urban area. The climate is cold throughout the year, and the temperature doesn’t raise above 17 degrees Celsius in the summer. 

Pedro is dark skinned; has short, dark hair and dark eyes; is short statured; and has a strong physique. His native language is Aymará, which is spoken in the area, but he also speaks Spanish because of the general culture and the business he conducts. He lives with his wife that takes care of household tasks and with his children that are not yet of school age. They live in their own home built of brick with a corrugated iron roof that has running water, electricity, gas and a sewage system. 

His business involves selling stucco, which is a paste made of lime powder, powered marble, plaster, natural pigments, etc. The stucco hardens once mixed with water, and it is used to plaster walls and ceilings. He began making stucco 16 years ago, and now dedicates his business to only this product. “My main advantage is that I have my truck that allows me to distribute and sell stucco throughout the city,” Pedro explained.   

His dream is to operate his stucco business on a larger scale. He wants to invest in the purchase of a body for his truck, which is currently damaged and has filtered water ruining his products. This is the first sequence of loans with this institution in eight years that supports this form of independent business.  

It is for these reasons that Pedro is requesting a loan to purchase a truck body so that his goods are sold in perfect condition.

loans.use: to buy a body for his truck so that his goods are sold in perfect condition.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 34 and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ronilo, an engineer. She manages her household while operating a business. She works to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs.

Melanie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 700 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as rice, canned goods, noodles, soda and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her, for it will fund their everyday sustenance.

Melanie hopes to maintain and grow her business. She prays that they will be blessed with a baby soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Las Preciosas Group

texts.es:
Arminda es una mujer de 36 años de edad, casada, tiene 5 hijos de 18, 16, 14, 9 y 2 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buen madre, paciente, atenta, sincera, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrollan en la zona ‘La guardia’ un área rural ubicada aproximadamente a 32 kilómetros de la ciudad dónde la producción de cítricos abarca 2500 hectáreas, por ello, se ha organizado la feria de la fruta que se realiza los sábados y domingos, allí los productores llegan a vender sus mandarinas y naranjas y el contacto directo con el público les da mejores ganancias. El clima se caracteriza por ser templado, al estar comprendido entre las llanuras y los valles mesotérmicos, aunque se registran vientos fuertes y lluvias tormentosas en ciertas épocas del año.
Arminda es de tez trigueña, cabello negro corto hasta la altura de los hombros, ojos obscuros, estatura mediana, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al comercio de fruta y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, el mayor trabaja con su padre, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua de pozo y electricidad. La necesidad por cumplir con los gastos de su familia para darles un futuro mejor la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios y emprendimientos como; mototaxi, venta de jugos cítricos, venta de bisutería, elaboración y venta de empanadas, librería, venta de comida y comercio de verduras, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, procedente de estados unidos, ropa para damas y caballeros como; camisas, pantalones, blusas, poleras, camisetas, etc., actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana durante el día; bajo el fuerte sol lugareño, sobre una tela en el piso, abre su puesto de venta diariamente, el viento levanta polvo, el sol es agobiante, de esa manera sus clientes escogen las prendas a su gusto y medida. “voy a realizar este negocio hasta que mis hijos sean profesionales, todos me conocen y saben que la ropa que vendo es de buena calidad, porque me escojo los mejores fardos para vender…” comenta. Su sueño es sacara a sus hijos profesionales, ella desea aumentar el volumen de ropa para ofertar mayor cantidad y generar mejores ingresos. Esta es la 8 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Arminda solicita un préstamo para aumentar el volumen de ropa en oferta para sacar a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Arminda is 36 years old, she is married, and she has 5 children that are 18, 16, 14, 9 and 2 years old. She sells second-hand clothing.
She is a great mother, patient, attentive, sincere, responsible, and hard-working. Her business is in the "La guardia" area, which is a rural area about 32 kilometers from the city where there is over 2500 hectares of citrus production. Because of this, there is a fruit market on Saturdays and Sundays and it is where the farmers sells mandarins and oranges directly to the public.  The climate is temperate since it is located between the valleys and plains, but there are strong winds and rains at certain times of the year.

Arminda has a dark complexion, dark hair cut to her shoulders, dark eyes, a medium height, and a robust physique.  Her first language is Guaraní, which is what her family speaks, and she speaks Spanish with her neighbors and in order to do business.  She shares her life with her husband who sells fruit for a living.  Her children are in school.  The oldest child helps his father with work.  They all live in their own home which is made of brick and has a corrugated iron roof. They house has running water and electricity.

In order to pay the household expenses and to provide her children a better future, she became the leader of a group of entrepreneurs so that she could find loans and improve her business. Other people in the group have businesses in moto-taxis, juice sales, jewelry sales, sales of empanadas (traditional food), book sales, food sales, sales of vegetables, etc. 

She sells second-hand clothing, mostly from the USA, for both men and women. She sells t-shirts, pants, blouses, polo shirts, tops, etc. She sells every day of the week in the bright sunshine on a blanket on the ground. She sells every day, even if it's very windy and uncomfortable.  She says that she is going to continue doing this work until her children become professionals.  Everyone knows her and knows that the clothing is good quality because she chooses the best stock.

Her dream is that her children become professionals.  She also wants to increase the volume of clothing that she sells in order to generate a higher income.  This is the 8th loan cycle with this institution in the 7 years that she has done this work.

This is why Arminda is seeking a loan, in order to increase the volume of clothing that she sells so that her children can become professionals.

loans.use: to increase the volume of clothing she sells in order to help her children become professionals.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is thankful that she was granted a 12,000 Philippines Peso (PHP), loan which she used to purchase supplies and merchandise products for her direct selling business. Her earnings support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would now like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy footwear, undergarments, shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap and fabric softener needed in her business. Her income from selling as a dealer help cover her family’s daily needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her, and a good return on her investment for it will surely fund their everyday needs and the education of her high school-age child and her two elementary school children as well.

Erlinda dreams of having a store of her own to display her products and attract more customers. She aims to send all her children to college to allow them better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products such as footwear, beauty, skin products and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Gera

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Gera works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. Gera is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and other tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Gera has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth is 37 years old and widowed with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Janeth has a food vending business in the Philippines. Janeth requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like cooking oil, bananas, sugar, etc. for her food production business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Janeth has been in this business for six years. Janeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like cooking oil, bananas, sugar, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 60 years old and married with two children. Helen works very hard to provide for them. Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, beer, sugar, cereals, milk, juice, detergent soap, etc. to sell. Helen has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, beer, sugar, cereals, milk, juice, detergent soap, etc. In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, beer, sugar, cereals, milk, juice, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jecil

texts.en: Jecil is single and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Jecil requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional bicycle unit for her business. Jecil has been in this business for six years now. In the future, Jecil would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional bicycle unit for her business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her furniture-making business. Lucia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Lucia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lilibeth is 54 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Lilibeth has a soft drinks dealer business in the Philippines. Lilibeth requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more trays of soft drinks to sell to her customers.

Lilibeth has been in this business for six years. In the future, Lilibeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more trays of soft drinks to sell to her customers

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Melanie works hard to support her family.

She has a business making and selling peanut butter in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Melanie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her peanut-butter-making business.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her peanut butter making.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Liza works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Liza is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Liza has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lorelie is 31 years old and has three children who are in school.

Lorelie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lorelie requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials like meat, utensils, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Lorelie has been in this business for six years. In the future, Lorelie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials like meat, utensils, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food vending business

loans.name: Ma. Ligaya

texts.en: Ma. Ligaya works hard to support her family. Ma. Ligaya is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Ligaya requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients and materials for her business. Ma. Ligaya has been in this business for five years now. Ma. Ligaya would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients and materials for her business

loans.name: Maria Lydia

texts.en: Maria Lydia works hard to support her family. Maria Lydia is married and has a handicraft business in the Philippines. Maria Lydia requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials like nylon threads, wire, shells, etc. for her business. Maria Lydia has been in this business for 21 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Maria Lydia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like nylon threads, wire, shells, etc. for her business

loans.name: Mylene Grace

texts.en:
Mylene Grace is 29 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Mylene Grace has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Mylene Grace requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mylene Grace has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Mylene Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lourdevica

texts.en:
Lourdevica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 14,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell to customers.

Lourdevica successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Lourdevica's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 47 years old, married and has four children, one of whom is in school. 

Mary Jane is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Mary Jane has been raising pigs for 14 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough to support her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy works hard to support her family. Mercy is married and has a meat vending business in the Philippines. Mercy requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more meat to sell to her customers. Mercy has been in this business for six years now. Mercy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell to her customersl

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients like spices, noodles, hot dogs, fish, and other items for her food vending business.

Salome has been in this business for seven years. Salome earns more income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Salome has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, noodles, hot dogs, fish, and other items for her food production business

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para superarlas y salir adelante junto con su hija y su esposa. 

Hace aproximadamente 15 años inició desesperadamente la búsqueda de una fuente de ingresos para su hogar. Fue así como inició la cría y venta de pollos, negocio que le ha venido generando ganancias con las cuales puede sostener los gastos de su hogar. 

Luis busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de pollos, cuido y adecuar el corral de sus pollos. Sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar puede lograrlo.

Luis tiene la esperanza en que el préstamo le permita salir adelante con su negocio. 

Además, espera que su negocio crezca y genere mayores ingresos con los cuales les pueda ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso. 

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Luis!
texts.en: Luis is a person who has had to face many adversities in his life. However, he has always been able to overcome them and to get ahead with his wife and daughter. About 15 years ago, he desperately looked for a source of income for his home. He then started breeding and selling chickens, which allowed him to generate earnings to support the expenses of his household. Luis is looking for a loan to buy chickens, as well as to maintain and fix his chicken coop. He knows that with the help of Corporacion Interactuar he can achieve this. Luis hopes that this loan will help him get ahead in his business. He also hopes that the business will grow and will increase his earnings, which will allow him to offer a better quality of life to his family, and to get better opportunities for progress. With a loan made today, you will be able to improve Luis's life and business!

loans.use: To buy chickens, as well as maintain and fix his chicken coop.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 32 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Analie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of snack goods, rice, diapers, sardines and other groceries.

Analie has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Analie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of snack goods, rice, diapers, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Bambie

texts.en:
Bambie is a 34-year-old college graduate and lives in La Carlota City. She is married to Milbet Sr. who worked as an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker) before and currently he has a pig fattening business. They have 2 children aged 10 and 7 years old, and both are in elementary school. Their total monthly family income is only 10,000 PHP ($226).

Bambie has long wanted to help her husband but didn’t have the means until she learned about the 2-month training program of Bagosphere that could lead to a call center job. Now that she has passed Bagosphere’s selection process, she needs your help to finance her tuition. Once Bambie starts earning, she can help provide her family’s basic needs and then save some money for her children’s education.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Goldie

texts.en: Goldie is a 31-year-old college undergraduate living in Bago City. She is married to Jonathan who works as a farmer. They have two children (twins) who are four years old. Their total monthly family income is only PHP 10,000 ($226). Goldie has long seen the need to help her husband, but didn’t have the means until she learned about the 2-month training program of Bagosphere that could lead to a call center job. Now that she has passed Bagosphere’s selection process, she needs your help to finance her tuition. Once Goldie starts earning, she can help provide for her family’s basic needs and then save some money for her children's education and to have a better future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 per month

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is thankful that she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy raw ingredients needed in her food stall business. Her earnings help support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would now like to apply for another 30,000 PHP which she will use to buy additional raw ingredients such as pork, beef, chicken, and seasonings, vegetables and other ingredients that are needed to make "siopao" (steamed buns) and "siomai" (Chinese dumplings) to sell at her food stall. She is encouraged by the good return on her investment, and is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely help fund her family's everyday needs. 

Alicia hopes that her food stall will continue to grow, so that she will be able to save for her old age. She prays for strength to enable her to take care of her aging parents. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food stall.

loans.name: Nenette

texts.en:
Nenette is 51 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Nenette is in an agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business. Nenette has been in pig fattening for 20 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Nenette would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Donald

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Donald works hard to support his family.

He has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling firewood and charcoal. Donald is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle transportation business.

He successfully repaid his previous loan and now has requested another loan to further build his businesses.

Donald has been sustaining his business activities through his past 13 loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 27 years old and married. She has two children, one of which is in school. 

She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Jenelyn has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins.

Jenelyn has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married and works hard to support her family by buying and selling footwear in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by selling personal products. She has requested a loan for PHP 25,000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. Rose has sustained her business with help from four prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that hard work will help her save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more foot-wear and other personal product to sell.

loans.name: Lory Jane

texts.en: Lory Jane works hard to support her family by selling vegetables in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan from NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell. She has been in this business for five years and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en: Marisol is 33 years old, married and the mother of three children, one of whom attends school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by direct sales to her friends and neighbors in the Philippines. Marisol has requested a PHP 13,000 loan from NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. She has been in her current line of work for one year and would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sher Ann

texts.en:
Sher Ann is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Sher Ann is 36 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Sher Ann requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready to wear items like blouses, bags, watches, etc.

She has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Sher Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready to wear items like blouses, bags, watches, etc.

loans.name: Julenine

texts.en:
Julenine is a 29-year-old college undergraduate and lives in a rural village in Bago City. She is married to Julieto, who works as a taxi driver in Bacolod City. They have 1 child aged 9.

Julenine has a home-based cake and pastries business. Their total monthly family income of only 8,000 PHP ($181) is not enough to provide even for their family’s basic needs. Thus, when she qualified for the 2-month call center training program from Bagosphere, she saw a glimmer of hope that there's actually a chance for her to uplift her family’s life in a few months. 

Julenine dreams to have their own house, become financially stable, send her daughter to school, and finish her studies. Your tuition loan assistance might just make her reach those.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery es una mujer de 28 años de edad, tiene un hijo varón de 14 años de edad y 3 hijas mujeres de 4, 6 y 9 años, y su negocio es la venta de alimentos de primera necesidad en una tienda de barrio.
Ella es buen madre, emprendedora, amable, generosa, comprensiva, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘kalajahuira’ ubicada al noroeste de la ciudad, se constituye en la zona más grande del municipio, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-16 grados centígrados.
Rosmery es de piel morena, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, complexión física delgada, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), y su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en compañía de su pareja que viaja constantemente porque trabaja como transportista interdepartamental y con sus hijos; los 3 mayores estudian en la escuela el menor de todos aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo y cemento y cuenta con energía eléctrica, recibe agua de un estanque cercano y no cuenta con alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de artículos y alimentos de primera necesidad, como; pan, arroz, azúcar, golosinas, refrescos, gaseosas, y otros, su hija de 9 años la ayuda con la atención de la tienda porque conoce muy bien los precios y sabe reconocer el dinero. “trabajo sola porque mi esposo viaja constantemente a otra ciudad manejando un micro con pasajeros…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una casa propia donde pueda establecer a su familia y darles una mejora calidad de vida a sus hijos, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una heladera y muebles para su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rosmery solicita un préstamo para la compra de una heladera y muebles para su negocio para aumentar la oferta de productos y generar mejores ventas.
texts.en: Rosmery is 28 years old. She has a 14 year old boy, and 3 daughters ages 4, 6 and 9 years old. Her business is selling staple foods in a neighborhood store. She is a good mother, enterprising, kind, generous, understanding, responsible, and hard working. She works in the "kalajauira" zone located in the northeastern part of the city. This is the largest zone in this municipality, with a cold and dry climate with a temperature that fluctuates from 2-16 degrees Celsius. Rosmery is dark skinned, she has dark eyes, short stature, with long braided black hair, she has a thin body built, and a traditional way of dressing (hat, shawl, big skirt.) Her native tongue is Aymara which she speaks with her family.  She speaks Spanish as a general practice and for business purposes. She shares her life with her partner, who travels frequently as an interstate driver, and with her children. The 3 older kids go to school, and the youngest is not of school age yet. They live in a rented home, built of brick and cement, with electricity and water supplied from a nearby pond, and no sewage. Her business is primarily selling staple foods such as bread, rice, sugar, sweets, juices, soda pop, and others. Her 9 year old daughter assists in the store, because she knows the products well and she is good with money. "I work by myself because my husband travels constantly to another city driving a mini passenger bus," she states. Her dream is to have her own house where she can settle with her family, and to give her children a better quality of life. She would like to expand her business by buying a refrigerator and furniture for the shop. This is the first loan with the institution in the two years she has been working in this activity. Rosmery is asking for a loan to buy a refrigerator and furniture for her business to increase the supply of products and to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and furniture for her business to increase the supply of products and to generate better sales.

loans.name: Ma. Eleonor

texts.en:
Ma. Eleonor is grateful for the 45,000 PHP loan assistance that was previously granted to her. She used it to buy additional laptops and office supplies her accounting firm needed. Her earnings were a big help for her personal family needs and household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 45,000 PHP loan to purchase an additional computer unit, papers, folders, ledgers and other office supplies she needs to improve her business. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Ma. Eleonor dreams that her business will become more established and she also desires to explore other business opportunities. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for laptops that will be used in her accounting business

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia used a prior 15,000 PHP loan to buy ingredients needed in her food-stall business. Her earnings help support her family and meet their daily basic needs. She is requesting a new loan for PHP 20,000 which she will use to buy more supplies. Letecia is sure that her earnings will increase as she expands her business. Her goals are to pay for her children's education and open a small restaurant that will improve her family's quality of life. She aims to send her children to college and see them become professionals.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion

. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital and repay loans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Ann Mae

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ann Mae works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Ann Mae is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

Ann Mae has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Thelma works hard to support her family.

She has a firewood selling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Thelma is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of firewood to sell to her customers for her firewood business.

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of firewood to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ma. Genevie

texts.en:
Ma. Genevie is 37 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Ma. Genevie works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Genevie runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Ma. Genevie has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as spices, canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future Ma. Genevie would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 33 years old and married with two children. With both children currently in school, Nancy works very hard to provide for them.

Nancy runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Nancy has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, coffee, detergent, soap, shampoo, hair conditioners, and sanitary pads.

In the future, Nancy would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Corazon

texts.en: Ma. Corazon is 52 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan from NWTF to purchase additional items, such as soft drinks, biscuits, and sardines, to sell to her customers. Ma. Corazon has borrowed and repaid eleven prior loans from NWTF and has been running her general store for 16 years. She supplements her income by raising and selling pigs. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional item to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es: Leonel, tiene 37 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Morazan, Yoro. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura en la producción de maíz, pero hace dos años decidió vender productos desechables para reciclar. Leonel realiza las compras ambulantemente como ser botellas, baterías en mal estado, bolsas plásticas, aparatos electrónicos en mal estado, piezas de aluminio, hierro, cobre, bronce y los revende. Ha solicitado un prestamo por 10,000 lempiras para invertirlo en la compra de más productos chatarra en aluminio, cobre, hierro, plástico para revender y seguir obteniendo sus ingresos. Su meta es comprar un vehículo para movilizarse con su negocio.
texts.en: Leonel is 37 years old. He is married, with two children and he lives in a small village in the municipality of Morazan, Yoro. He has always worked in agriculture raising corn, but in the last two years he decided to sell disposable products for recycling. Leonel buys products on the street such as bottles, worn out batteries, plastic bags, broken appliances, aluminum pieces, iron, copper, bronze, and he resells them. He is asking for a loan of 10,000 lempiras (US $500,) to buy more junk products such as aluminum, copper, iron, plastic to resell and to continue generating earnings. His goal is to buy a car to drive around with his business.

loans.use: To buy more junk products in aluminium, copper, iron, plastic to resell.

loans.name: Nurzhan

texts.ru: Нуржан 45 лет, замужем, мать 6 детей. У Нуржан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Нуржан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 10 коров, 20 овец. На 3,0 Га собственной земли выращивает люцерну и пшеницу. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нуржан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Нуржан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства на образование ее детей.
texts.en:
Nurzhan is 45 years old, married and the mother of six children. Nurzhan has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started 23 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som (KGS). 

Thanks to Nurzhan's persistent work, her farm currently has ten cows and twenty sheep. She also grows alfalfa and wheat on her own plot of land of 3.0 hectares. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Nurzhan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 75,000 som (KGS) to purchase two steers to fatten and resell. Nurzhan plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock, and also plans to save money for educating her children.

loans.use: to buy two steers for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Cerecia

texts.en:
Cerecia works hard to support her family. Cerecia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Cerecia has requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for thee years now.

Cerecia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Zairbek

texts.ru: Заирбек, 27 лет, женат, есть сын. У Заирбека- среднее образование, с 2010 года занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Заирбека, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, он обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита помогут ему в дальнейшем развивать бизнес.
texts.en:
Zairbek is 27 years old, married and has a son. Zairbek has secondary education. Since 2010 he has worked with livestock breeding. Thanks to Zairbek's persistent work, his farm currently has 15 sheep. The monthly income is around 15,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop his business, he turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase sheep to increase his herd. The income from the loan will help him further develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep in order to increase his herd

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 54 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosita has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from selling personal products.

Rosita is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 38 years old, married, and has two children who are both in school. Ligaya is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Ligaya requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maricon

texts.en:
Maricon is 52 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Maricon runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like shampoo, soap, rice, etc. to sell. She has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. Maricon has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns income from pig fattening. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of shampoo, soap, rice, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is 49 years old, married, and has six children, two of whom are currently in school. Lerma is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Lerma requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines, vitamins, and other supplies for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines, vitamins, and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Bressa

texts.en:
Bressa is 48 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Bressa is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a business buying and selling slippers in the Philippines.

Bressa requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more slippers to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for five years. Bressa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more slippers to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura is 64 years old and widowed with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Maura runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of coffee, milk, biscuits, etc. to sell. Maura has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of coffee, milk, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Nargizakhon

texts.ru: Наргизахон успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Ее бизнес по продаже женской одежды приносит прибыль в размере до 20,000 сом (KGS). Сейчас наблюдается рост цен на товары, поэтому Наргизахон решила вновь обратиться в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товара в обороте, часть средств она вложит сама. Наргизахон планирует доходы от бизнеса направлять на дальнейшее его развитие, так как это ее любимое дело.
texts.en: Nargizakhon successfully paid back her previous loan, using it for its designated purpose. She is grateful to Kiva and to all those who helped her finance her loan. Her business of selling women's clothing brings a profit of up to 20,000 som (KGS). Now the cost of her merchandise has increased which is why Nargizakhon decided to again turn to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 40,000 som (KGS) to increase her stock of merchandise; a portion of the funds she will contribute herself. Nargizakhon plans to spend the income from her business in its further development as it is her favorite activity.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing for retail sale.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Juanita works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising ducks.  Juanita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF.

Juanita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.ru: Салтанат 42 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. Супруг и дети активно помогают по хозяйству. У Салтанат среднее образование. В качестве дополнительного источника доходов для семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав бизнес в 1996 году с 8,000 сом (KGS). Хозяйство на сегодня приносит в среднем 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц в основном от продажи экологически чистого, вкусного молока. На данный момент в хозяйстве Салтанат имеется 2 коровы. Также на 3,60 ГА земли, она выращивает картофель и люцерну. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Салтанат обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец и 2 тонн семян картофеля. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Saltanat is 42 years old, married and the mother of four children. Her husband and children actively help her with her farm. Saltanat has secondary education. As an additional source of income for her family, she works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started this business in 1996 with 8,000 som (KGS). 

Currently the farm brings in 12,000 som (KGS) per month on average, mainly from selling tasty milk of ecological quality. Saltanat currently has two cows at her farm. She also has 3.60 hectares of land, where she grows potatoes and alfalfa. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Saltanat turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) to purchase sheep and 2 tons of seed potatoes. She plans to invest the income from the loan in increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase two tons of seed potatoes and some sheep in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Tinatin

texts.ru: Тинатин 27 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Тинатин средне-специальное образование, работает поваром, также она занимается животноводством, выращиванием, заготовкой и реализацией сельхозкультур. В хозяйстве есть 2 лошади, 2 коровы, 5 овец, 4 козы. На участке мерою 3,30 Га, она выращивает люцерну и ячмень. Вся семья с радостью помогает Тинатин в ведении ее бизнеса. Тинатин обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 6 овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить на покупку грузовой машины.
texts.en:
Tinatin is 27 years old, married and the mother of two children. Tinatin has vocational education. She works as a cook and she also works with livestock breeding and growing, harvesting and selling crops. Her farm currently has two horses, two cows, five sheep and four goats. She has a plot of land of 3.30 hectares, where she grows alfalfa and wheat. The whole family gladly helps Tinatin in managing her business.

Tinatin turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase six sheep. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock and would also like to save money for purchasing a truck.

loans.use: to purchase six sheep for fattening up and reselling

loans.name: Nurkul

texts.ru: Нуркул 47 лет, вдова, воспитала 3 детей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, в 2000 году Нуркул начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Начатое со стартовой суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и сельскохозяйственных продуктов, этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 3 бычка и 17 овец. На 2,88 Га земельной доли выращивает картофель и ячмень. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нуркул обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 тонн семенного картофеля для полеводства и коров. Доходы Нуркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en:
Nurkul is 47 years old and a widow. She has raised three children. 

As a main source of income for her family, Nurkul started working with field crop cultivation and livestock breeding in the year 2000. Starting with an amount of 15,000 som (KGS) her farm currently brings in around 20,000 som (KGS per month from the sale of milk and produce. This money is not enough for a decent life. There are two cows, three bulls and 17 sheep at the farm. Nurkul also grows potatoes and barley at a plot of land of 2.88 hectares. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Nurkul turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase 4 tons of seed potatoes, and to purchase some cows. Nurkul plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her farm.

loans.use: to purchase seed potatoes and some cows in order to increase her income

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan helped her with her house rental business. She was able to pay for maintenance of the house and she has increased her profits. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

Evelyn is positive that she can improve more her business if you will let her borrow again in the amount of 30,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies and products she needs for her sari-sari (variety) store. Simultaneously, she will be able to meet the needs of her family with the help of this loan.

Evelyn wants to expand her business so that she will be able to give her family a better life in the future. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries and other supplies for her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Isabel Kaiusca

texts.es:
En  el Florón  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socias  del Grupo De Crédito Jesús Con Nosotros, este es un lugar urbano marginal en el cual las personas luchan cada día para sacar adelante a sus familias.
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Isabel tiene 39 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 13 y 12 años  de edad ambos estudian en colegio.
Nuestra amiga es una mujer muy trabajadora que le toco luchar muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos  ella  se dedica a la venta de comida, ella hace ya 8 años  puso un  pequeño comedor en su casa, el mismo que poco a poco ha mejorado con la ayuda de los créditos  allí trabaja de lunes a sábados, ella prepara almuerzos y meriendas, ella varia el menú de acuerdo a las preferencias de sus clientes que son lo más importes en su negocio, sus hijos le ayudan cuando ellos pueden, así es como ella sale adelante trabajando duro para conseguir sus ingresos para vivir.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede sacar adelante su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su hijos.
texts.en:
The credit group 'Jesús Con Nosotros' meets every fortnight in 'El Florón', an outlying urban zone of Portoviejo city where people strive every day to provide for their families.

Here we met Isabel. She is 39 years old, separated and with two children from that relationship, ages 13 and 12, both in school. Our friend is a hardworking woman who struggled hard to raise her children.

She makes a living selling food. Eight years ago, she set up a small dining hall in her house, which she has been gradually improving thanks to previous loans. She works there Monday to Saturday preparing lunch and snacks. She varies the menu according to her customer's preferences, which are what matters most in this business. Her children help her whenever they can. This is how she manages to get by, working hard to earn a living.

She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish and other ingredients for cooking.

She belongs to the credit group from the beginning and she likes it because with the loans she is able to carry on with her business. Her wish is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish and other ingredients

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is married works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years now.

Violeta requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en:
Miraluna is 35 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

Miraluna has borrowed and repaid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 61 years old and married. She works hard to support her husband.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines and also earns income from farming sugarcane.  Thelma is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Toktobubu

texts.ru: Токтобубу успешно погасила свой кредит, она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве есть 2 дойные коровы, 10 овец и 10 лошадей. На участке мерою 4,0 Га она выращивает пшеницу, ячмень и клевер. На доходы от бизнеса Токтобубу удалось приобрести необходимую в хозяйстве грузовую машину и начать постройку дома. Ее деятельность приносит доход около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку кормов для скота, что позволит сохранить поголовье и прокормить животных в течении зимы. На доходы от бизнеса она хочет открыть швейный цех.
texts.en: Toktobubu successfully paid back her previous loan. She is grateful to Kiva and to all those who helped her finance her loan. She currently has 2 dairy cows, 10 sheep and 10 horses on her farm. On a 4.0 hectare plot of land she grows wheat, barley and clover. With the income from her business, Toktobubu managed to buy a necessity for her farm - a cargo truck. She was also able to start building a house. Her business brings in an average monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her business, she turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 35,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle feed, which will allow her to preserve the size of her herd and feed her livestock over the winter. She wants to use the earnings from this business to open her own seamstress shop.

loans.use: to purchase cattle feed.

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en:
Lucina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Lucina has been in this business for nine years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia es una mujer de 56 años de edad, divorciada, con hijos independientes, y su negocio es la confección de mantas de vicuña. 
Ella es emprendedora, sincera, Inteligente, generosa, comprensiva, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ’16 de julio’, un área caracterizada por la feria los días jueves y domingos, donde se puede encontrar desde una aguja para coser ropa hasta un tractor para sembrar la tierra. De clima frío (4-12 grados centígrados) y rayos solares muy fuertes que pueden quemar la piel, a una altura promedio de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Eusebia es de piel morena, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, complexión física delgada, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), y su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en compañía de sus hijos que son independientes y trabajan, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento y cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la elaboración de mantas de vicuña; inicio su negocio por la necesidad de mantener a sus hijos, actualmente cuenta con proveedores de lana constantes y clientes fijos. “aprendí a  tejer por necesidad, tengo mi puesto fijo de venta y todo lo que tejo se vende…” comenta. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y contar con una tienda donde pueda exponer sus tejidos, ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de lana de vicuña por mayor, para contar con material de trabajo constante y cumplir con los pedidos pendientes que tiene. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 22 años que lleva realizando esta actividad de forma independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Eusebia solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana de vicuña por mayor para contar con material de trabajo y cumplir con sus pedidos pendientes.
texts.en:
Eusebia is a 56 year old woman. She is divorced and has children who are already independent. Her business is to make vicuna blankets. She is enterprising, honest, intelligent, generous, understanding, patient, responsible and very hardworking. She does her business in the neighborhood of "16 de julio", an area known by its fair on Thursdays and Sundays, where one can find from a sewing needle to a tractor to cultivate the soil. It is a region with cold weather (4-12 degrees Celsius), and very strong sunbeams that can burn the skin, at an average altitude of 3800 meters above sea level. 
Eusebia is dark skinned, with dark eyes; short in height, with black, long braided hair and thin. She wears traditional clothing (hat, shawl and skirt), and her native language is Aymara, which she speaks with her family. She speaks Spanish as general knowledge and in commerce. She lives with her children, who are independent and work. They live in their own house, made of brick and cement, with running water, electricity, gas and sewage. Her business is to make vicuna shawls. She started her business because of the need to support her children. Currently, she has constant wool providers and set customers. "I learned to knit because of need. I have a fixed stall from where I sell and everything I knit is sold..." she comments. Her dream is to expand her business and have a store where she can exhibit her fabrics. She wants to invest in her business through the purchase of vicuna wool at wholesale prices, in order to have constant work material and meet her pending orders. This is the first cycle of loans with the institution in 22 years that she has been working in this job independently. These are the reasons why Eusebia is requesting a loan to buy vicuna wool at wholesale prices in order to have work material and meet her pending orders

loans.use: to buy vicuna wool at wholesale prices in order to have work material and meet pending orders.

loans.name: Marcel

texts.en:
Marcel is grateful for the 10,000 PHP loan assistance that was previously given to her. She was able to buy more quantities of raw meat and products, seasonings, and other supplies she needed in her siomai business. Her earnings were a big help for their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business.She will also use her loan for her variety store business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marcel wants to have other sources of income other than what she has now. She dreams to give her family a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients she needs in her siomai business.

loans.name: Leonicisima

texts.en:
Leonicisima is a 47-year-old married woman with eight children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur in the Philippines. 

She has a shell craft business and has requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her business.

Leonicisima has been in this business for three years. In the future, Leonicisima would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda is married and has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more used clothing to sell. Erlinda has been in this business for 5 years now. Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Meressa

texts.en:
Meressa works hard to support her family. Meressa is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Meressa requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials and gears for her business. Meressa has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Meressa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials and gears for her business

loans.name: Toch

texts.en: Toch is a 43-year-old married rice farmer with a child in her care. She lives in the Takeo province in Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice for over 30 years. Her husband is 43 years old and he uses a cart to carry soil and sand to sell for profit. Her child is a 23-year-old factory worker. The family can earn around USD 14.5 a day. Toch wants to buy a cow to fatten and breed for calves to sell but she doesn’t have enough money, so she would like a loan. This loan will help her have enough money to buy a cow and earn more income in the future. Her plan is to build fences around her house.

loans.use: to buy a cow to fatten and breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Sreymach

texts.en:
Sreymach is a 40-year-old married mother of two children, who lives in Siem Reap province in Cambodia. She is also a staff who works in the tourism field and she has worked since 2009. Her husband is a 36-year-old motorcycle mechanic and one of her two children attends school. Both Sreymach and her husband can make around $23 a day. 

She wants to help her husband in earning more income to support their family; therefore she has decided to apply for a loan for her husband to buy an old motorcycle to fix and clean to resell. This loan will help her husband to improve the family’s finances. In the future, Sreymach hopes to expand her husband’s business, renovate her house, and help her children in earning high education.

loans.use: to buy an old motorcycle to fix and clean to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his cleaning, restoration, and renovation company

loans.name: Louis

texts.en:
After years of working for a textile company, Louis took his love for the textile sector a step further and started his own business. In 2013, DecoPro was born. The company manufactures decorative trimming and tassels for interior decorating applications. Louis loves having the creative freedom to design and manufacture uniquely exclusive products. However, he has run into difficulties funding his new product lines. 

This loan will allow Louis to invest in more production equipment so he can continue to create new designs and have the capital to market them. In the future, he hopes to become a dominant brand for the retail and wholesale segments of his industry. He also hopes to improve his company’s self-sufficiency so he can spend more time with his family.

loans.use: to accelerate manufacturing and production in his interior decoration manufacturing business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is grateful that she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan, which she used partly to purchase supplies and merchandise for her direct selling business and partly for her small store business. Her earnings helped support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would now like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more footwear and bags for her direct selling business and also to pay for grocery items such as rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles and beverages to add to her small general store for additional income. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her and also for a good return on her investment, believing that it will surely fund her family's everyday needs and the school needs of her child.

Evelyn's dream is to have a store of her own to display her personal products and to have a bigger grocery store someday. She aims to send her only child to college and see her become a professional. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship group* to share stories of her work every week in a setting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more footwear and bags for her direct selling business and also to pay for grocery items to add to her small general store.

loans.name: Higinio

texts.en:
Higinio is thankful that he was granted a PHP 20,000 PHP loan which he used to buy raw ingredients needed in his food stall business. His earnings help support his family and meet their daily basic needs.

He would like now to apply for PHP 25,000 which he will use to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products to cook dishes to sell at his food stall. He is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on his investment and the financial help that will be extended to him for it will surely cover their everyday needs and fund the education of his children. 

Higinio dreams that all his hard work will bear fruit to give his family a better future. He aims to send all his children to college to allow them better opportunities in life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies

. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren is 66 years old, married, and works hard to support her family.

He has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Efren is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like rice, coffee, sardines, etc. to sell for his general store business.

He successfully repaid his previous loan and now he has requested another loan to further build his businesses.

Efren has been sustaining his business activities through his past 15 loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like rice, coffee, sardines, etc. to sell

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
