Cynthia is 54 years old and single. She works hard to help her nephew in his studies.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell.

Cynthia has been in this business for nine years.

In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 42 years old and married with six children. Five of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Gina has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her vulcanizing shop business.

Gina has been in this business for six years. In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is the responsible mother of a son. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 12 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of entire family. 

Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to perform maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Farzana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Farzana's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily, and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Farzana  also plans to make savings with the profit of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future. Farzana is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: help her husband to repair his taxi

loans.name: Rehmat Bibi

texts.en:
Rehmat Bibi is a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for five years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to repair his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good as it requires maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to repair his taxi. Therefore Rehmat Bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With this loan Rehmat Bibi's husband will be able to afford the maintenance costs and  provide better transport facilities to earn a more profitable income. She also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future. She is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Ana Mae

texts.en:
Ana Mae is a 28-year-old high school graduate and lives in Bago City. She is married to Wenido Jr. who works as a farm laborer at Hawaiian Philippine Company in Silay City. They have no children. Ana Mae worked before as a casual employee in Gaisano City. Their total monthly family income of 10,000 PHP (226 USD) is not enough to provide even for their family’s basic needs. Thus, when she qualified for the two-month call center training program offered by BagoSphere, she found hope that she can improve her family’s life in a few months.

Ana Mae dreams to have a stable job and have a small business, and your tuition loan assistance might just make her reach that.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Kousar Parveen

texts.en:
Kousar Parveen is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 17 years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Kousar Parveen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Kousar Parveen's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. It will enable him to provide improved transport facilities to earn a more profitable income. Kousar Parveen also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Kousar Parveen is very grateful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enable her husband to repair his taxi

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 42-year-old woman and the mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. He sells fruits, e.g. apples, bananas, grapes, etc. Her husband is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Razia's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in condition to purchase fruits for his business purposes.

Therefore Razia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: help her husband to  increase his fruit business

loans.name: Lily More

texts.en: Lily More is a 25-year-old college undergraduate and lives in Bago City. She is married to Erwin who works as a tricycle driver. They have 1 baby.  Lily More currently works as market vendor selling foodstuff. They don't have their own house, and they're living with her parents. Their total monthly family income is only Php 4,000 ($91).Thus, when she qualified for the 2-month call center training program of Bagosphere, she found hope that there's actually a chance for her to uplift her family’s life in a few months. Lily More dreams to rise from poverty and have her own house and a stable job. Your tuition loan assistance might just help her reach that.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en: Ma. Theresa is 53 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with three children who are now adults. At present, Ma. Theresa earns a living from cosmetics and a ready-to-wear dealing business. She is also engaged in a hog-fattening business. She's been in the business for almost six years already. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stock of cosmetics and ready-to-wear for resale. Other proceeds will be for the purchase of three sacks of grower feeds for her hog-fattening business. Ma. Theresa has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. In the future, Ma. Theresa hopes to expand her hog-fattening business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional stocks of cosmetics and ready to wear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Anjeline

texts.en: Angeline is a Kiva borrower. She has two children. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be perishability of products. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits. She hopes that in the future she will improve her living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy ready to wear items and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve more her business if you will let her borrow again an amount of 35,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies and products which she resells. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Wilfreda wants her business to continue to flourish. She hopes that her family is always healthy. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for an additional stock of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en: Jared is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be kind. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are individuals. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to expand within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Purita has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Purita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like rice, soft drinks, milk, bread, chips, noodles, etc.

Ailyn has been in this business for eight years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Ailyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like rice, soft drinks, milk, bread, chips, noodles, etc

loans.name: Airyn

texts.en:
Airyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Airyn has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Airyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Jojie

texts.en:
Jojie works hard to support her family. Jojie is married and has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Jojie has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Jojie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Louella

texts.en:
Louella is 37 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school, Louella works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like coffee, sardines, noodles, soap, milk, etc. to sell.

Louella has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Louella would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like coffee, sardines, noodles, soap, and milk to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is married and 39 years old with three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a buy and sell frozen products business in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of frozen products to sell.

Arlene has been in this business for four years. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of frozen products to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 52 years old, married and has three children, one of whom is in school.

Carmelita is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and pay for her laborers.

Carmelita has been farming sugarcane for 10 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money in order to support her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for her laborers.

loans.name: Louie

texts.en: Louie is a 22 year old vocational graduate and lives in Valladolid Negros Occidental. He belongs to a family of 13. His father is a tricycle driver and at the same time a fish vendor, while his mother is a housewife. He has 10 siblings and three are working as a tricycle driver, a security guard, and a massage therapist. Their total monthly family income of 15,000 PHP ($339) is not enough to provide for their basic needs. This motivates Louie to find means to help the family have more income so he underwent the selection process of Bagosphere and successfully passed it to qualify for the 2-month training program that could lead to a call center job. Louie aims to finish his training and help his family provide their basic needs. Louie would like to enhance his communication skills and to learn how to communicate with other people. His biggest dream is to become a successful call center agent for a prestigious BPO company and to help his family. Your generosity in funding his loan would greatly motivate Louie to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Arifa

texts.en:
Arifa is the responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 18 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Her husband needs to perform maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Arifa has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Arifa's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily, and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Arifa  also plans to make savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.  Arifa is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: help her husband to repair his taxi

loans.name: Sabra

texts.en: Sabra is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past several days his rickshaw has not been working properly. Because of this,her husband is unable to generate any amount of income. Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore Sabra has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Sabra is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Jennifer Andrea

texts.es:
En  el Florón  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socias  del Grupo De Crédito Jesús Con Nosotros, este es un lugar urbano marginal en el cual las personas luchan cada día para sacar adelante a sus familias.
En este lugar vive la señora Jennifer, tiene 20 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 2 hijos 3 y 1 año de edad. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Jennifer es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su esposo  el cual tiene un pequeño  negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres, su esposo en la madrugada se va hasta el mercado de mayoristas en esta ciudad a abastecerse de sus productos para luego ir a vender por la localidad, recién hace poco con la ayuda del crédito empezó con  su negocio y esto ante la necesidad que tenían ya que él no tenía trabajo y ahora gracias e este crédito espera aumentar más el negocio.
Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres para su negocio. Lleva 2 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos salen adelante. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio y que  a sus pequeños no les falte el pan diario.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the members of the credit group 'Jesús Con Nosotros' meet in a neighborhood in the city of Portoviejo. This is a marginally urban area where the people strive every day to move their families forward. This is where Jennifer lives. She is 20 years old and is in a common-law marriage from which she has 2 children ages three and one. Her husband is a merchant.

Jennifer is a homemaker, and is requesting a loan to help her husband who has a small business selling fruits and vegetables. In the early morning her husband heads to the wholesale market in the city to acquire products to then go and sell them locally. Recently, with the help of a loan he started his business given their need since he didn't have a job. Now, thanks to this loan he hopes to expand his business.

This loan is to buy fruits and vegetables for his business. He has done 2 cycles in the credit group, and he likes it because they can get ahead with the loans. Their dreams are to continue improving the business, and that their children never lack their daily bread.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: José Alexander

texts.es:
En  el Florón  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socias  del Grupo De Crédito Jesús Con Nosotros, este es un lugar urbano marginal en el cual las personas luchan cada día para sacar adelante a sus familias.
En este lugar vive el señor José, tiene 38 años de edad, es padre  soltero de un hijo de 19 años el cual estudia en universidad, ellos  viven en casa de sus padres. El está desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta ya que con los créditos él está logrando aumentar su negocio.
Don José es un hombre que le gusta trabajar para salir delante de una manera honrada, el tiene un local en Chone en el cual el vende todo tipo de accesorios para carros como luces, parlantes, radios, amplificadores, plumas, antenas y una gran variedad de accesorios, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 l,  lleva más de  15 años en este negocio con el cual sale adelante. 
Este crédito es para comprar parlantes, luces, radios y todo de lo que ellos venden en su local. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio para salir adelante.
texts.en:
The members of the "Jesús Con Nosotros" (Jesus is With Us) lending group meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo.  Portoviejo is an urban area where people strive everyday to get their families ahead.  José lives in Portoviejo.  He is 38 years old, and he is a single father of a 19 year old who attends college.  They live in his parents' house.  José has been in the lending group since its inception, and he enjoys it because the loans allow him to expand his business.  

José is a man who enjoys working in order to get ahead honorably.  He has a store in Chone where he sells all sorts of car accessories such as lights, speakers, radios, amplifiers, windshield wipers, antennas, and many other accessories.  He works everyday day from 8am to 6pm.  He has over 15 years of experience in this business.  The loan will be used to purchase speakers, lights, radios, and other accessories for his business.  His dream is to continue improving his business so that he can get ahead.

loans.use: purchase speakers, lights, radios, etc.

loans.name: Edwin Steeven

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Bella Vista de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora. 
En este lugar vive el señor Edwin, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y estudia Auditoria en una universidad de la localidad, el aun  vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva un año  en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
Don Edwin es un joven muy trabajador que le gusta con su esfuerzo poder salir adelante y  continuar con sus estudios, el trabaja en un taller de  mecánica automotriz, ahí el aprendió todo lo referente a arreglos en automóviles, por lo cual el recibe un sueldo semanal que le sirven para seguir adelante, el de a poco y con la ayuda de los créditos recibidos ha ido comprando ciertas herramientas que necesita para realizar su trabajo, ya que el también realiza sus trabajos de forma independientes que son los que le dejan muy buenos ingresos extra. 
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar llaves, playos y otras herramientas que el necesita y de a poco ir comprando todo lo necesario para algún día tener su propio taller ya que ese es su sueño.
texts.en:
The "María Auxiliadora" lending group meets every two weeks in the Bella Vista citadel in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  For many years, it has been known as the city of the real tamarinds.  Edwin lives in this city.  He is 19 years old, single and is studying auditing at his local university.  He still lives with his parents.  He has been a member of the lending group for about a year and he likes the help that the loans provide.  

Edwin is a hardworking man who enjoys getting ahead and continuing his education through his effort.  He works at an automotive service workshop where he learned everything about auto repair.  For his work, he receives a weekly salary that helps him to get ahead.  Through this salary and the help he has received from loans, he has been able to slowly purchase tools that he needs for his work since he also works as an independent mechanic, which allows him to earn a little extra income.

This loan will allow him to purchase wrenches and other tools that he needs so that he can slowly acquire what he needs to someday have his own repair shop.

loans.use: purchase wrenches and other tools.

loans.name: Las Propias Originales Group

texts.es:
Mirtha es una mujer de 35 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, comprensiva, paciente, luchadora, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Cotoca’ un área rural ubicada al este de la ciudad, es conocida por sus comidas típicas y por la producción de jalea y melao (derivados de la caña de azúcar), como también por sus horneados de maíz y yuca, como el sonso, roscas, arepas, cuñapés y bizcochos, su gente son herederos especialistas en artesanía; especialmente de cerámicas, de clima cálido cuya temperatura media es de 24ºCentigrados.
Mirtha es de tez trigueña, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, estatura mediana, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (al centro usa blusa roja y pantalón corto negro). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de madera con techo de calamina, que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado . Su deseo por pagar los gastos de sus hijos la animó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; taximoto, comercio de huevo, tienda de barrio, venta de tarjetas de teléfono, elaboración de horneados, venta de pollo frito y pintura de interiores, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano para niños; ella se especializa en la ropa infantil, sus clientes son padres y madres de familia que constantemente compran ropa para sus niños, y oferta variedad en colores, diseños y también marcas. “los niños crecen todos los días y eso hace que en poco tiempo la ropa que compraste con esfuerzo y mucha ilusión les quede pequeña…”comenta. Su sueño es ser dueña de una tienda de ropa y vender sus propios diseños. Ella desea realizar la compra de ropa infantil variada para contar con mayor oferta y aumentar sus ventas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Mirtha solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa infantil variada para incrementar sus ventas y pagar los gastos de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mirtha is a 35-year-old woman, single, and has two children who are 13 and 12 years old. Her business is selling secondhand clothing. She is a good mother, understanding, patient, determined, responsible, and hardworking.

She carries out her business in the town of ‘Cotoca,’ a rural area located east of the city. It is known for its traditional foods and for the production of jelly and cane syrup (derived from sugar cane) and also for its baked corn and yucca, such as sonso [yucca and cheese], sweet breads, arepas, cheese bread balls, and biscuits. Its people are heirs that specialize in handicrafts, especially ceramics. The town has a warm climate with a median temperature of 24 degrees Celsius. 

Mirtha has dark complexion, long dark hair that she ties back, dark eyes, medium stature, and a strong build. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks in town, and she speaks Spanish for general knowledge and for her business (in the center wearing a red blouse and short black pants). She shares her life with her children who study in school. They live in their own home built of wood with a corrugated iron roof that has potable water, electricity, and a sewage system. 

Her wish to pay her children’s expenses motivated her to create an association of people with businesses such as a taxi motorcycle, egg business, neighborhood store, phone card sales, baked good sales, fried chicken sales, and interior painting to request a loan and expand their businesses.

Her business is selling secondhand clothing for children. She specializes in children’s clothing and her customers are fathers and mothers that constantly buy clothing for their children. She offers a variety of colors, designs, and also brands. “Children grow every day and that makes it so in a short time the clothing that you bought with effort and excitement is too small for them…” she says. Her dream is to be the owner of a clothing store and sell her own designs. She wants to buy a variety of children’s clothing to have a better selection and increase her sales. 

This is the first loan sequence with the institution in two years that she comes carrying out this business. For these reasons Mirtha requests a loan to buy a variety of children’s clothing to increase her sales and pay her children’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy a variety of children’s clothing to increase her sales and pay her children’s expenses.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Lunimar

texts.en:
Lunimar is 27 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Lunimar is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of new rice variety and a sack of rice.

Lunimar has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of new rice variety and a sack of rice

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en:
Marivel is 34 years old and married with four children. With all four children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Marivel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like cereal, canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, toothpaste, bath soap, diapers, etc. to sell.

Marivel has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as cereal, canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, toothpaste, bath soap, and diapers.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like cereal, canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, toothpaste, bath soap  and diapers to sell.

loans.name: Silvia Gabriela

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Bella Vista de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora. 
En este lugar vive la señorita Silvia, tiene 20 años de edad y es soltera, ella estudia el séptimo semestre de Arquitectura en una universidad de la localidad y aun  vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva un año  en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y de mucha ayuda.
Doña Silvia con la intención de ganar para los gastos de estudios se dedica al comercio, ella  vende de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa y en la universidad en la cual estudia ya que sus compañeras de estudio son sus mejores clientes, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Lleva un año con este negocio. 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusa y camisetas. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
In the citadel Bella Vista in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, every 15 days the members of the credit group María Auxiliadora meet. 

Silvia lives in this place. She is 20 years old and single. She is studying in her seventh semester in Architecture in a university in her town and she still lives in her parents’ house. She has been with the credit group for one year and she likes it because the loans are fast and very helpful. 

Silvia, with the intention to earn money to pay for her studies, works in business. She sells all kinds of clothing. She sells door-to-door and also from her home and at the university where she studies since her classmates are her best customers. She allows credit and collects every 15 days. She has had this business for one year. 

This loan is to buy pants, blouses, and shirts. Her dreams are to finish her studies and practice her profession.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, and shirts.

loans.name: Dermis Farlene

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Bella Vista de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora. 
En este lugar vive la señora Dermis, tiene 64 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad, con ella vive una hija. 
Doña Dermis es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder salir adelante con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta sabanas y ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale de lunes a viernes en las tardes  a realizar sus recorridos con la ayuda de su hija que siempre la acompaña, aunque también vende en su casa,  ella  deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, lleva más de 20 años con esta actividad con la cual se gana el sustento diario.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo y sabanas, lleva más de 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta la organización del grupo y la facilidad que brinda la Fundación para dar los créditos, sus sueños son continuar con buena salud y en su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the María Auxiliadora communal bank meet every 15 days in the Bella Vista neighborhood in the city of Portoviejo.  It is the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarinds.

This is where Dermis, age 64, lives.  She is separated, and she has four grown children.  One daughter lives with her.  Dermis is a housewife.  In order to get her own resources with which to get ahead with the household expenses, she sells sheets and all types of clothes.  

She sells door-to-door.  She leaves on Monday through Friday afternoons to make her rounds.  She does this with help from her daughter, who always accompanies her.  She also sells at her house.  She sells for credit and collects every eight days.  She has been engaged in this business activity with which she earns her daily sustenance for 20 years.

This loan is to buy all types of clothes and sheets.  She has been in her communal bank for two years.  She likes the group’s organization and the ease of getting loans with the Foundation.  Her dreams are to continue in good health and to continue in her business.

loans.use: to buy all types of clothes and sheets.

loans.name: Fátima Susana

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Bella Vista de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora. 
En este lugar vive la señora Fátima, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos  aún viven con ella. Su esposo es maestro en una  Universidad en Manta.
Doña Fátima es una mujer que le gusta valerse por si misma y conseguir sus propios ingresos por el bien de ella y su hogar, ella  se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale a realizar sus recorridos tres o cuatro  días por semana y también vende en  su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan algo de lo que ella vende, ella deja sus productos a  crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince días.  Lleva más de 10 años con esta actividad con la cual además de ganarse algo se entretiene con sus ventas.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, zapatos, entre otras cosas. Lleva 5 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la facilidad que le dan  los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando cada día más.
texts.en:
In the Bella Vista neighborhood of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarind trees, the members of the “María Auxiliadora” communal loan group meet every two weeks.

This where Fátima lives. She is 58 years old, married, and from this marriage has two grown sons, one of whom still lives with her. Her husband is a professor at the university in Manta.

Fátima is a woman who likes to have her own work and her own income, for her own good and that of her family. She sells clothing, shoes, and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories). She sells door-to-door. She does her route three or four days per week, and she also sells from her house, where her clients come when they need something that she sells. She sells her products on credit and collects every week or every two weeks. She has been in this business for more than 10 years, which in addition to providing her some income also keeps her busy with her sales.

This loan is to buy pants, blouses, perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and shoes, among other things. She has been in the loan group for 5 years and she likes it because of how easy it is obtain the loans. Her dream is to continue improving more each day.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and shoes, etc.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Bella Vista de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora. 
En este lugar  vive la señora Ana, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 21, 17 y 14 años de edad, todos  aun vive con ella y estudian dos en universidad y el menor en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una institución médica.
Doña Ana es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarles a sus hijos en los gastos de sus estudios, hace ya 4 años arreglo un local en su casa en la cual instalo un pequeño bazar, allí ella vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y productos de Yanbal,  Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), cosas para regalos entre otros productos, ella trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 y mantiene su negocio abierto hasta las 19h00, lo cual no le incomoda ya que es un negocio que no le quita mayor tiempo y puede estar atenta a su hogar y ganarse lo suyo al mismo tiempo.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, artículos para regalos, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y todo lo que ella vende. Lleva más de 8 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los servicios médicos que ofrece la institución. Sus sueños son tener un centro de rehabilitación física.
texts.en:
The members of the María Auxiliadora Credit Group meet every 15 days in the citadel of Bella Vista in Portoviejo, the capital city of Manabí known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Ana, who lives in this same place, is 45 years old and married, and from this marriage she has three children of 21, 17, and 14, who all still live with her.  Two of them study at university and the youngest one goes to school.  Her husband works at a medical institution.  Ana is a housewife who, in order to make her own way and help her children with their school expenses, fixed up an area in her house 4 years ago where she set up a small shop selling all kinds of clothing, shoes, Yanbal products, Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories), gift items, and other products.  She starts work every day at 8:00 a.m. and keeps her business open until 7:00 p.m., which is not inconvenient for her since it doesn't take up the majority of her time and she can be attentive to her home and make a living at the same time.  

The loan will be used for buying clothing, shoes, gift items, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and all of the products that she sells.  She has been a member of the Credit Group for more than 8 years and she likes it for the medical services that the institution offers.  Her dream is to have a physical rehabilitation center.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, gift items, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and other products

loans.name: Ramona Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Bella Vista de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora. 
En este lugar vive la señora Ramona, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene una hija de 11 años que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es maestro soldador. Ella hace varios años aprendió belleza.
Doña Ramona es una joven mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ganarse lo suyo para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella tiene un salón de belleza en su casa donde realiza diversidad de trabajos como tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas entre  otras cosas. Trabaja casi todos los días, ella realiza sus trabajos en su local y también a domicilio si así lo requieren sus clientes. Lleva más de 3 años con esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, permanentes y herramientas que aun necesita. Lleva 3 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco. Sus sueños son llegar a tener un salón de belleza más grande.
texts.en:
The members of the María Auxiliadora communal bank meet every 15 days in the Bella Vista neighborhood in the city of Portoviejo.  It is the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarinds.

This is where Ramona, age 32, lives.  She is married and has an 11 year old daughter who goes to school.  He husband is a master welder.  She learned the beauty trade several years ago.

Ramona is a very hard-working young woman, and she likes to earn on her own in order to help her husband with the household expenses.  She has a beauty salon at her house.  That is where she does diverse work like dyes, haircuts, manicures, and other things.  She works almost every day at her place and also at customers’ homes if they require it.  She has been engaged in this business activity for three years, and through it she earns something for the good of her family.

She will use this loan to buy dyes, permanents, and tools that she still needs.  She has been in the communal bank for three years.  She likes it because of the help and the benefits that she gets from the bank.  Her dream is to come to have a bigger beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy dyes, permanents, and tools.

loans.name: Mercy Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Municipal  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Estrella Solidaria.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercy tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen  tres hijos de 5, 6 y 14 años que estudian escuela y colegio. Su esposo es marino mercante en Galápagos.
Doña Mercy es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para así salir adelante, tiene un pequeño taller de costura en el cual desde hace muchos años atrás cose ropa a particulares, ella también  hace dos años empezó a vender  ceviche de sardina o pinchagua (pez pequeño de 12 centímetros y lleno de espinas) curtida o cocida  con limón, vende todos los días  de Lunes a Domingo de 7h00 a 12h00 en un kiosco ubicado en un lugar que es muy concurrido y donde sus ventas son muy buenas. En las tardes se dedica a sus costuras y al cuidado de sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar sardina ingrediente principal, otros víveres (cebollas, limón, etc.) y materiales de costura. Lleva 5 años en el grupo de Crédito  y le gusta la unidad del grupo. Su metas es tener una cevicheria bien grande.
texts.en:
The members of the "Nueva Estrella Solidaria" (New Star Solidarity) Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the Municipal citadel of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi. The city has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees. 

Here we met Mercy, who is 35 years old, married and has three children from the same marriage who are 14, 6 and 5 years and all in school.  Her husband is a merchant seaman who works in the Galapagos. 

Mercy is a woman who likes to work to get ahead.  She has a small tailoring shop where she has sewn clothing for individuals for many years.  2 years ago, she also started selling ceviche made from sardines or pinchagua (a kind of small herring which is 12 centimeters long and full of bones), cut up and cooked with lemon.  She sells ceviche every day from 7:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. at a kiosk located in a very popular area where her sales are very good.  In the afternoon, she spends her time sewing and taking care of her children.  

She will use this loan to buy the principal ingredient of her ceviche, sardines, as well as other supplies (onions, lemon, etc.), and sewing materials.  She has been a member of this group for 5 years and she likes the unity of the group.  Her goal is to have a very big ceviche restaurant.

loans.use: to buy sardines and other supplies to make ceviche, and sewing materials

loans.name: Perlie

texts.en:
Perlie is 42 years old and lives in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children who are now school aged.
 
Perlie is engaged in operating a (public utility vehicle) PUV-Van and motorcycle for hire business for the past four years. At present, she is also an appointed Barangay Treasurer in her community.  She earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of business activity.  

She has requested a loan to be used in paying the annual registration fees of her PUV-Van unit. Perlie has been a member of PMPC for 12 years. In the future, Perlie hopes to purchase additional units of PUV-Vans for hire to add to their daily income.

loans.use: to be used in paying the annual registration fees

loans.name: María Leonor

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Municipal  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Estrella Solidaria.
En este lugar vive la señora Leonor, tiene 40 años de edad, está divorciada y de esa relación tiene dos hijos de 13 y 14 años que estudian en  colegio. Ellos viven en casa de una hermana. 
Doña Leonor es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos para sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogo y los fines de semana trabaja en un restaurante todo el día. Trabaja en sus recorridos tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, gracias a esto ella puede ganar lo necesario para sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que ella es madre y padre a la vez.
Este crédito es para comprar camisetas, blusas y otras prendas. Lleva 10 años en el grupo de crédito y le gusta es la unidad del grupo y porque los créditos son agiles. Su sueño es tener una casa ya que donde vive es de su hermana.
texts.en:
In the municipal area of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the loan group Nueva Estrella Solidaria (New United Star) meet every two weeks.

Señora Leonor lives in this place. She is 40 years old. She is divorced, and from this relationship she has two children, ages 13 and 14, who are in school. They live in her sister's house.

Doña Leonor is a housewife who, in order to obtain her own resources to raise her children, sells clothing by catalog, and on the weekends she works in a restaurant all day. She makes her rounds three days a week, from two to three hours each day. She leaves her products on credit and collects every week. She has been doing this work for five years, and it is going very well for her. Thanks to this, she can earn the necessary [income] to raise her children, since she is both mother and father at the same time.

This loan is to buy t-shirts, blouses, and other articles of clothing. She has been in the loan group for 10 years, and she likes it because of the unity of the group and because the loans are flexible. Her dream is to have a house, since the place where she lives is her sister's.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, blouses, and other items of clothing to sell

loans.name: Gladys Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Ave Fénix. 
En este lugar vive la señora Gladys, tiene 43  años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 24 Y 10 años los mismos que estudian en la Universidad y el otro en escuela. El marido es gasfitero. 
Doña Gladys es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catálogo y perfumes para damas. Trabaja tres días a la semana cuatro horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito. Tiene cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien,  lo que más vende son los perfumes y zapatos para damas.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes y zapatos. Tiene 9 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque son puntuales. Su sueño tener es tener un buen local.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many, many years as the city of the royal tamarind trees, the members of the “Ave Fénix” [Phoenix Bird] communal loan group meet every two weeks.

This where Gladys lives. She is 43 years old, is in a common-law marriage, and from this relationship has two children, who are 24 and 10 years old. They study in the University and at school. Her husband is a plumber.

Gladys is a homemaker who, in order to earn her own income and help her husband with the household expenses, sells shoes from catalogs and also women’s perfumes. She works three days per week, four hours per day. She sells her products on credit. She's had this business for 5 years and it's going very well for her. The things she sells the most of are shoes and perfumes for women. 

This loan is to buy perfumes and shoes. She has been in the loan group for 9 years and she likes it because they [the members] are punctual. Her dream is to have a good store location.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and shoes.

loans.name: Zita Del Rocio

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Ave Fénix. 
En este lugar vive la señora Zita, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos  aun  vive con ella. Su esposo es maestro constructor. Ella aprendió hace varios años corte y confección en una academia en la ciudad.
Doña Zita con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, ahí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, aunque  lo que más le gusta elaborar es ropa de mujer o de niñas ya que hay más diseños y con estos aprende aún más, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y en temporadas también elabora uniformes para instituciones, escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Lleva  6 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande.
texts.en:
The members of the Ave Fénix Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi, which is known as the city of the Royal Tamarind Trees. 

Here we meet Zita, 53, who is married and has three adult children from the same marriage, one of whom still lives with her.  Her husband is a master builder. Several years ago, she learned cutting and dressmaking at an academy in the city.  Towards the aim of earning her own income and profiting from her knowledge about tailoring, Zita set up a small sewing workshop in her home where she sews all kinds of clothing for women, men, and children, though she most enjoys making clothing for women and girls since there are more designs and she can learn even more through making them.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. and sometimes even later when she has orders to fill.  

She will use this new loan to buy fabric and other sewing materials.  She has been a member of the Communal Bank for 6 years, and she likes it because the loans are a great help to her.  Her dream is to have a larger workshop.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other sewing materials

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expenses of her children and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 15,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stocks of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result for her business to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Amanda dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman, for she wants to give her family a better future. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Sol

texts.en:
Ma. Sol is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, chips, etc. for her general store business.

Ma. Sol has been in this business for 20 years. Ma. Sol earns more income from food vending and farming sugarcane.

Ma. Sol has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, chips, .

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Estrella is 34 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

She has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines. Estrella requested a 16,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items like slippers, jackets, blouses, and shorts to sell.

Estrella has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items of dry goods like slippers, jackets, blouses, and shorts to sell.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice-retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Magdalena has been in this business for six years. Magdalena earns more income from farming rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Magdalena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 17 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good, and it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to do the maintenance on his taxi. 

Therefore, Zareena has applied for a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Zareena's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily. He will then be able to provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Zareena  also plans to make savings with the profits from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Zareena is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Nora Zoraida

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Ave Fénix. 
En este lugar vive la señora Nora, tiene 41 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, uno mayor de edad e independiente y uno de 15  y otro de 12 años de edad los mismos que estudian en colegio. El marido es taxista.
Doña Nora se dedica a la cría de cerdos, tiene una pequeña propiedad que compraron hace dos años en un lugar que se llama estancia vieja, los cerdos los faenan y luego venden la carne por libras,  lleva 2 años dedicada a esta labor y le ha ido bastante bien, le ayuda el hijo mayor quien inicio el negocio y el esposo ya que es una forma de ganar algo de dinero con su familia, lo inicio con el crédito que le apoyo la fundación.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en mejorar el corral donde cría a los chanchos y alimentos para estos. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta la responsabilidad del grupo. Su sueño es terminar de hacer su casa e incrementar el negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the loan group Ave Fénix (Phoenix) meet every two weeks.

Señora Nora lives in this place. She is 41 years old and maintains a free union relationship from which she has three children. One is an adult and independent, one is 15, and the other is 12. The younger ones are in school. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Doña Nora raises pigs. She has a little piece of property that they bought two years ago in a place called Estancia Vieja. They slaughter the pigs and then they sell the meat by the pound. She has been doing this work for two years, and it has gone quite well for her. Her older son, who began the business, and her husband help her, since it is a way to earn some money with their family. They began it with the loan that the foundation supported.

She is going to use this new loan to improve the pen where she raises the pigs and buy feed for them. She has been in the loan group for three years, and she likes the responsibility of the group. Her dream is to finish building her house and expand the business.

loans.use: to improve the pen for the pigs and buy food for them.

loans.name: Teresa Amelia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Ave Fénix. 
En este lugar vive la señora Teresa,  tiene 61  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen  tres  hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo trabaja en la empresa de agua potable.
Doña Teresa para salir adelante junto a su familia tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa,  ahí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hija y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando ellos pueden y están desocupados, pero por lo general es ella la que mas pasa en su negocio ya que  es ahí donde le gusta estar porque además de ganarse la vida se entretiene y se informa de las novedades que pasan a su alrededor. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace 5 años y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí , known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the 'Ave Fénix' communal bank meets every fortnight.

Teresa lives here. She is 61 years old, married and from this relationship has 3 grown and independent children. Her husband works in a drinking water company. Teresa in order to get ahead with her family has a food store in her house where she sells all sorts of products like rice, sugar, oil, detergent, vegetables, greens and fruit. She works every day from 6 am until 8 pm and at times later. Her daughter and her husband help her with the work when they can and aren't busy. But generally it is her that passes most time in the business as this is where she likes to be. Besides making a living she enjoys herself and learns the news of what is happening around her. She has run this business for one year and things are going well for her.

This loan will be used to buy more stock for her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cold cuts and other basic food items. She has been in the communal bank for 5 years and she likes it as she has made more friends in the group. Her goals are to continue ahead with her business and have her store grow each day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cold cuts and other basic food items.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
This is Ramon. He sends you his thanks for your generosity because his previous loan had enhanced his business. He was able to buy spare parts and accessories for his Tricycle (motor cycle with sidecar). The loan also helped him provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

He is very positive that he could improve more his business if you will let him borrow again an amount of 15,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of accessories and spare parts for his Tricycle. He could sustain the needs of his family if the Tricycle unit is regularly maintained and in good condition.

Ramon hopes that his unit is always in good working condition so that he could have enough income for their daily needs. He only dreams of a simple, yet healthy life for his family. He meets every week with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.*

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Narcisa Isabel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Ave Fénix. 
En este lugar vive a la señora Narcisa, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija de 19 años que esta por ingresar a la universidad. Su esposo trabaja en una imprenta, viven en casa propia.
Doña Narcisa es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogo y sandalias. Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son las sandalias para el diario y camisetas de damas.
Este crédito es para comprar sandalias para la temporada y están con descuentos. Está  en el Grupo De Crédito 12 años y le gusta porque son agiles y rápidos los créditos. Su meta es que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many, many years as the city of the royal tamarind trees, the members of the “Ave Fénix” [Phoenix Bird] communal loan group meet every two weeks.

This where Narcisa lives. She is 50 years old, married, and from this relationship has a 19 year-old daughter, who is about to start at the university. Her husband works at a printing company. They live in their own house.

Narcisa is a homemaker who, in order to have her own income and help her husband with the household expenses, sells clothing from catalogs and also sandals. She works three days per week, two or three hours per day. She sells her products on credit and collects every eight days. She has been doing this work for one year and it’s going very well for her. What she sells the most of are sandals for daily use and women’s t-shirts.

This loan is to buy sandals for the season and they’re on sale. She has been in the loan group for 12 years and what she likes about it is that it’s fast and easy to get the loans. Her goal is for her daughter to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy sandals.

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en: Isaiah is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a farm where he grows tea. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a strategic place. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. His business goal is to expand within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Ruvelyn

texts.en:
Ruvelyn is 40 years old and married with three children who are all in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles, and shampoo to sell.

Ruvelyn has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Fatima works hard to support her family.

She has a computer gaming station business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from general store business. Fatima is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy an additional unit for her computer games business.

Fatima has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy an additional unit for her computer games.

loans.name: Viviana Del Rocio

texts.es:
Viviana tiene 34 años, tiene 2 hijos está casada vive en el barrio pugacho que pertenece a Ibarra lugar donde la mayoría de personas se dedican al comercio y también a la agricultura, hay lugares que también son visitados por turistas como la laguna yahuarcocha de Imbabura.
Viviana se dedica al comercio de verduras en ferias ambulantes de los mercados de Ibarra ofreciendo los productos que ella vende ella hace los recorridos todo los días con la ayuda de su marido, el esposo trabaja como chofer en un taxi de la zona, son personas muy trabajadoras, el crédito que solicita lo va invertir en la compra de más verduras capital de trabajo para incrementar el negocio y que siga siendo el sustento de la familia y solventar los gastos del mes.
El negocio empezó hace 7 años por iniciativa propia con el apoyo del esposo durante todo este tiempo ha sido de bajas y altas en el negocio aun así ha seguido manteniendo las mismas ventas.
Agradece a Fundación Alternativa por el apoyo que le brindaron con el capital para seguir incrementando el negocio.
texts.en:
Viviana is 34 years old and has 2 children. She is married and lives in the Pugacho neighborhood which is part of Ibarra, a place where the majority of people work in commerce or in agriculture. There are also place where tourists visit such as Yahuarcocha de Imbabura lagoon.

Viviana works selling vegetables in itinerant markets of Ibarra offering the products that she sells. She makes her rounds every day with the help of her husband. Her husband works as a taxi driver in the area. They are very hard-working.

The loan that she is requesting will be invested in buying more vegetables as working capital to expand her business and sustain her family and pay the monthly expenses. She started the business 7 years ago on her own initiative with the help of her husband. In all this time there have been ups and downs in the business but even so she has continued with the same sales. She is grateful to the Fundación Alternativa for the support that they provide with the capital to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and continue to sustain her family.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
The above picture presents Anne. Anne is a 47-year-old farmer from Kipsaiya, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. She is a role model, a mentor, and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience, despite personal challenges and her passion to support her family as a primary caregiver. 

For the past six years, Anne has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been growing maize, poultry, tomatoes, and also keeping dairy cows. Anne has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She is most passionate about horticulture farming. She takes pride in being a part of the fastest-growing agriculture industry category in Kenya. However, she is facing serious challenges brought about by harsh weather conditions. 

Anne is seeking a loan to invest in the expansion of her horticulture farm. She sees a lot of room for improvement and growth. What is lacking is the capital to drive the positive change. With your loan, Anne will make enough income to take care of her family and other farming expenses. She wakes up early and goes to sleep very late every day to give her family a decent living and afford her children proper education. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. Help this wonder-woman realize her dreams!

loans.use: to expand her horticulture farm

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Melanie works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.  Melanie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra lives in the Spitamen district with her family. She is 45 years old. Gulchehra is a kind and wise woman. 

She has been involved in animal husbandry for eight years. She works from early morning till night. Thanks to her hard work, she can provide her family with dairy products. 

Gulchehra would like to develop her business and requested a loan, with the hope that she will be able to purchase a few livestock and expand her business. She really needs your support, because she does not have enough money. 

In the future, she hopes to obtain a larger loan and increase her activity.

loans.use: purchase livestock

loans.name: Susana Beatriz

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Ave Fénix. 
En este lugar vive la señora Susana, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 18 y 14 años que estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo es cómico. 
Doña Susana para ayudarle a sus esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que con lo que él hace no alcanza para cubrir los gastos hace varios años empezó un negocio, ella tiene una pequeña tienda - Bazar en su casa, allí vende víveres, útiles escolares, ropa de todo tipo, perfumes, productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja sola y cuando está desocupada la hija le ayuda pero la señora Susana es quien atiende. su negocio lo tiene más de 15 años, ella también recorre vendiendo sus productos los que deja a crédito para que le paguen cada 15 días. Hasta el momento le va muy bien y piensa  agrandar su local.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar víveres, perfumes, ropa, etc. Lleva 12 años en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque es muy unido el grupo.  Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y tener un local más grande con más variedad de productos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus compradores
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the loan group Ave Fénix (Phoenix) meet every two weeks.

Señora Susana lives in this place. She is 40 years old. She is married and from this relationship she has two children, ages 18 and 14, who attend the university and secondary school, respectively. He husband is a comedian.

Doña Susana, in order to help her husband with the household expenses, since what he earns doesn't go far enough to cover the expenses, began a business a number of years ago. She has a little store- bazaar in her house. There she sells groceries, school supplies, clothing of all types, perfumes, Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women). She works alone, and when she is free her daughter helps her, but Señora Susana is the one who tends the business. She has had her business for more than 15 years. She also goes out to sell her products, which she leaves on credit so that they pay her every two weeks. Up to now it has gone very well for her, and she is thinking of enlarging her store.

She is going to use this loan to buy groceries, perfumes, clothing, etc. She has been in the loan group for 12 years, and she likes it because the group is very united. 

Her goals are to continue forward in her business and to have a bigger store with more variety of products to satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy groceries, perfumes, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had entrenched her business. She was able to grow her fund used for repair shop. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expenses of her children and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve more her business if you will lend her an amount of 20,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional spare parts and supplies she needs to improve her service and increase her profit from business. An increase on profit will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her business, Corazon aims to have more customers patronizing her shop. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and supplies for her appliance repair shop

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be strong willed. She operates a retail business where she sells maize flour, sugar, milk and other items. Her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy flour, sugar, milk and other items. Her business goal is to have a supermarket within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, milk and other items

loans.name: Analina

texts.en:
Analina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Analina is 48 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Analina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Analina requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business like flour, sugar, spices, etc.

Analina has been in this business for 1 year. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business like flour, sugar, spices, etc

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 66 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lucia has been in this business for 18 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Regen

texts.en:
Regen is 41 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Regen is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds .

Regen has been raising pigs for eight years and also earns additional income from buy and sell livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gloria is 44 years old and has two children who are currently in school.
