Gloria has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en: Adelfa is 57 years old and married with ten children. She earns a living farming pigs in the Philippines. Adelfa is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Adelfa has been in this business for two years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is a 38-year-old married woman with six children, three of whom are still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Alma has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell. Alma has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Evaline, a 24-year-old, very hardworking, honest, and ever-smiling mother. She lives in the lush hills of Nandihills, in the rift valley region of Kenya. Evaline passionately loves farming. She has been farming for the past five years and has always managed to provide for her family. Feeding the large family she has requires a lot of hard work and determination. Her other sources of income are crops and some personal business that she does in order to provide food for her large family. 

In farming, she enjoys the returns she gets but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living. Evaline has identified a free space in her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and milk prices in the recent past have been going up, so Margaret, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she learns that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure and this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling the milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also sell to big dairy processing firms. 

Evaline said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agricultural-based loans and their interest rate is low and on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo and from the training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro finance institutions. Evaline hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change her life and  secure her future . She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Brian

texts.en: Brian is a twenty-five-year-old married man without children. He has been running a general store retail business for six years. He also owns a human medicine drug shop in the care of a qualified worker. Brian hopes to expand his business; however, inadequate capital is a challenge he faces. Brian is a hardworking man who is requesting a loan to buy sugar, rice, millet flour, cassava flour, bread and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, millet flour, cassava flour, bread and soda to sell.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 18 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to perform maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good; it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to perform maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Bushra has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Bushra's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide the better transportation facilities to earn a profitable income. Bushra also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.
Bushra is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his taxi.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
Elena tiene 30 años está casada, tiene 2 hijos el marido tiene 31 años, ellos viven en el barrio el cercado que pertenece a Atuntaqui lugar donde la gente se dedica a las artesanías como a la elaboración de muebles y también a la agricultura, la gente se dedica al comercio de las productos que ellos mismo fabrican son personas muy trabajadoras y responsables por la zona que ella vive.
Elena tiene su taller donde trabaja con su hermana brindando servicio de maquilado de prendas de vestir esto ya vive realizando más de 4 años por el sector, tiene clientes de distintas fabricas que hay por Atuntaqui, ella brinda los servicio maquilando a algunos talleres que va en busca de ella para que realice los terminados de las prendas de vestir es una persona muy conocida por el sector, es muy amable ha ganado el aprecio de las personas por ser puntuales en las obras que ella realiza.
Con el crédito de Fundación Alternativa va invertir en la compra de una maquina nueva para brindar más servicios en su taller y seguir incrementando más clientes para que en el futuro tener un taller que pueda brindar empleos a personas del sector.
texts.en:
Elena is 30 years old, married, and has 2 children. Her husband is 31 years old. They live in the “El Cercado” neighborhood of Atuntaqui, a place where people work in crafts, such as furniture making, and also agriculture. People sell the things they themselves make. People are very hardworking and responsible in the area where she lives.

Elena has a shop where she works with her sister, providing assembly services for making clothing items. She has been working in this business for more than 4 years. She has clients from various factories in Atuntaqui. She provides assembly services for several workshops that seek her out for her to finish clothing items. She is very well known in the area. She is very friendly and has earned the esteem of clients because she is punctual in the work she does.

With the loan from Fundación Alternativa, she will invest in the purchase of a new sewing machine so she can provide more services in her shop and continue increasing her number of clients, so that in the future she can have a shop that will provide jobs to people in the area.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine so she can provide more services in her shop.

loans.name: Gandy Rafael

texts.es:
Gandy está casado tiene 39 años la esposa tiene 33 años , tiene hijos con los cuales viven en casa arrendada en el barrio Ibana que pertenece a Ibarra, por sector que ellos viven hay turismo como la laguna de yahuarcocha y también la mayoría de personas por el sector se dedican al comercio de diferentes productos de aseo, artefactos y otros productos más.
Gandy desde hace 8 años atrás viene dedicándose al comercio de productos de primera necesidad como son pasta dental, detergentes y otros productos que le ha llevado a seguir creciendo personalmente también en su negocio, el comercio lo realiza en las ferias ambulantes de la provincia conjuntamente con su esposa salen todos los días a realizar el comercio ella ha sido su motor para seguir con el negocio familiar que hoy día están manejando y así mismo quiere que sus hijos estudien terminen su carrera y que administren el negocio que algún rato también van a ser parte de ellos, es por eso que Gandy solicita el crédito para comprar más mercadería para ofrecer en el mercado y también dar trabajo a otras personas para que ellos también puedan surgir en la vida y que brinden un mejor estado de vida a sus familias.
Agradece a Fundación Alternativa por la ayuda que le brindan con el capital para seguir incrementando más el negocio familiar.
texts.en:
Gandy is 39 years old and married.  His wife is 33, and they have children who live in a rented home in the neighborhood of Ibana which is a part of Ibarra.  
There is a lot of tourism in the area because of nearby Lake Yahuarcocha, and the majority of people in the area also make a living selling various cleaning products, appliances, and other merchandise.  

Gandy has been making a living selling daily necessities such as toothpaste, detergent, and other products for 8 years, and this business has allowed him to grow personally and professionally.  He and his wife do business at various traveling markets around the province.  They work every day, and she has been the motor that drives him to continue on with the family business that they are managing today.  Likewise, he wants his children to finish their degrees and manage the business so that they can also be a part of it for some time.  

For these reasons, Gandy is applying for a loan to buy more merchandise to offer at the market and also to employ other people so that they can improve their lives and provide their families with a better life as well.

He is thankful to Fundación Alternativa for the capital assistance that they provide so that he can continue growing his family business.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and educate his children, as well as improve the quality of life for his family

loans.name: Chrep's Group

texts.en: Chrep’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chrep makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for ger family.

loans.name: Ley's Group

texts.en: Ley’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Ley makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Luom's Group

texts.en: Luom’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Luom makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer, seller and food-marker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en: Channy’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Channy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Meng's Group

texts.en: Narin’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Meng makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.pt:
A sra Amelia tem 53 anos de idade, casada e mae de 04 filhos frenquentam dos quais 02 estao no lar e 02 estao na sua responsabilidade.
 Com o empréstimo pretende comprar duvetes, mantas, fatos, camisas e calças( roupa usada) para revender e ajudar o seu marido nas despesas do dia-a-dia. O seu sonho é ter uma viatura que a facilite nas suas deslocaçoes.
O seu desafio é trabalhar mais de modo a superar as dificuldades financeiras que enfrequenta
texts.en: Amelia, age 53, is married and the mother of four children, two of whom still live at home and the others who she is also responsible for. With this loan she plans to buy bedding, blankets, shirts, pants, and other used clothing to resell so as to help her husband with their daily expenses. Her dream is to have a car to make it easier for her to get around. Her main challenge is to work more so as to overcome the financial difficulties she faces.

loans.use: to buy and sell used clothing.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim, 46, lives in the community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has one child. To make a living and support the family, she manages and operates a farming process, primarily growing rice and cassava, and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in market. Until now, she has been in this business for 17 years. On average, she is able to make an earning of 2 USD a day. 

The current farmland that she owns is small and provides less benefits to her. She wants to hire one more plot of farmland to grow cassava but she cannot afford it. Therefore, Kim would like to get a Kiva loan to hire a plot of farmland for growing cassava. She hopes this additional farmland will help to improve her living conditions. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: hire a plot of farmland for growing cassava.

loans.name: Arlindo

texts.pt:
O senhor   Arlindo de 36 anos é motorista pai  de 2 dois filhos que frenquentam o ensino  primário e secundário e sustenta 1 sobrinho.
Diz que com este crédito ira comprar tijoleira, chapas de zinco, cimento, portas, para dar continuidade a sua  obra. 
O empréstimo anterior amplicou para iniciar a construcao da casa com o presente empréstimo pretende cobrir a casa e seu sonho terminar a sua obra para melhor confortar sua famίlia.
Desafios insufiênciencia de fundos para ultrapassá los faz xitique  e tem  uma conta onde faz depósitos como forma de poupar.
texts.en: Arlindo, age 36, is a driver and father of two children, both of whom are in school. He is also responsible for a nephew. He says that he will use this loan to buy tiles, sheet metal, cement, and doors to continue with his home improvement work. He used his prior loan to begin construction on his house, while this loan is intended to cover the rest. His dream is to finish with this work so he can make his family more comfortable. His main challenge is a lack of funds to build on what he has access to through an xitique [traditional savings system] and his savings account.

loans.use: to buy tiles, sheet metal, cement, and doors.

loans.name: Remia

texts.en:
Remia is 37 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like oil, soap, spices, canned goods, coffee, etc. to sell.

Remia has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like oil, soap, spices, canned goods, and coffee to sell

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is single and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Lea requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. in order to buy more items like blouses, pants, towels, curtains and other ready-to-wear clothing.

She has been in this business for nine years.

In the future, Lea would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like blouses, pants, towels, curtains and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe is 37 years old and widowed with four children. With three children still in school, Cleofe works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, noodles, sugar, milk, bread, etc.

Cleofe has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, noodles, sugar, milk, bread, etc.

loans.name: Mary El

texts.en:
Mary El is 38 years old and married with one child who is in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 26,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items such as bread, noodles, soft drinks and other groceries.

Mary El has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years, and also earns an income from gasoline retailing. She aspires to save money to provide and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as bread, noodles, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson, who lives in Kasese, Uganda, is 48 years old and widowed with ten children. He is responsible for paying the school fees for his children. He has operated a general store shop, selling at a retail price, for 15 years now. He also owns rentals and trades in gonja (sweet bananas) in order to make enough income to look after his family as a single parent. 

In the future, Jackson wants to start selling at a wholesale prices. However, he is faced with the challenges of market competition and limited capital. Jackson is requesting a loan to buy sugar, salt, millet, flour, cassava flour and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, millet, flour, cassava flour and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Milton

texts.en: Milton is 25 years old and single with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has operated a general merchandise store since 2012 and is also a farmer. Milton has a dream of finishing the construction of his commercial house and growing his business into wholesale. However, he is faced with the challenge of limited capital. Milton intends to use this loan to buy rice, sugar, cassava flour and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cassava flour and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Milton

texts.en:
Milton is a hard-working, married man living in Kamwenge Uganda. He deals in farming where he grows coffee and sugarcane alongside cattle fattening, where he earns an extra income. He started these businesses to earn a living and meet his family's needs. His main challenge is the high rate of taxation and price fluctuations, though he hopes to increase on his profits and have educated children. 

Milton is requesting for a loan to buy manure and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Edgar German

texts.es:
German tiene 67 años vive con su hija en una casa arrendada en el sector de Huertos Familiares que pertenece a la Ciudad de Ibarra por el sector que el vive la gente se dedica al comercio y también al turismo, la gente son muy amables respetuosas y muy hospitalarias.
German se dedica al comercio de repuestos de licuadoras esta actividad lo viene realizando más de 10 años en el mercado, actividad que aprendió por iniciativa propia porque la necesidad lo llevo a realizar esto y es por eso que hoy en día es su fuente de ingresos en su hogar y quiere que su hija tenga todo lo mejor en la vida y lo demuestra con el trabajo que el lo realiza día a día también su hija le ayuda a comercializar los productos en el mercado de Ibarra por el sector es muy conocido por ser comerciante ambulante hay días que no es deja vender por el mercado y aun así hace todo lo posible para seguir manteniendo el negocio que él quiere que sea familiar y que vaya creciendo.
El crédito lo va invertir en la compra de más mercadería para ofrecer a más clientes que necesitan estos repuestos para las licuadoras que son la necesidad del hogar.
texts.en:
German is 67 years old. He lives with his daughter in a rented house in the Huertos Familiares neighborhood, which belongs to the city of Ibarra. In the neighborhood where he lives, people work in commerce and also tourism. The people are very friendly, respectful, and hospitable.

German sells replacement parts for blenders. He's had this business at the market for more than 10 years. He learned the business on his own due to necessity, and this is whyit’s his source of income. He wants his daughter to have all the best in life, and he shows this through the work he does day after day. His daughter also helps to sell the products in the market in Ibarra. He is well known in the neighborhood as a street vendor. There are days when he doesn’t sell anything in the market, but even so he does everything he can in order to keep the business going for his family and to keep it growing. 

He will invest the loan in the purchase of more merchandise so he can sell to more customers who need these blender replacement parts because they are a household necessity.

loans.use: to buy more replacement parts for blenders.

loans.name: Jose Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso, tiene 60 años, la esposa tiene 61 años, tiene 2 hijos con los cuales viven en casa propia en el barrio el chamanal que pertenece a la parroquia de San Roque lugar donde la gente se dedica a las artesanías y comercio comercializan en diferentes lugares de la provincia dentro y fuera de ella.
Alfonso tiene en su propia casa el negocio de elaboración de helados la cual viene realizando desde hace 16 años por el sector, las ventas lo realiza por toda la provincia donde hay campeonatos, fiestas y otros eventos que hay por la zona con la ayuda de la esposa andan recorriendo por todos los sectores.
El crédito que solicito en fundación alternativa lo va invertir en la compra de materia prima como azúcar por quintales, crema, frutas y otros para seguir en más procesos de helados para seguir ofreciendo a más clientes y seguir incrementando día a día para brindar un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Alfonso, 60, and his wife of 61 have two children who live with them in their own home in the neighborhood of El Chamanal, a part of the Parrish of San Roque, an area where the people make a living in handicrafts and commerce both within the province and outside of it.  

Alfonso has a business making ice cream in his own home, which he has been doing for 16 years.  He sells his products throughout the province wherever there are tournaments, festivals, or other events that take place in the area. He and his wife go all over the area doing business.

The loan that he is applying for from Fundación Alternativa will go towards buying primary ingredients such as sugar by the quintal (a unit of measurement equal to 100 pounds), cream, fruit, and other ingredients to make into more ice cream products so that he can continue serving more customers and growing day by day to provide a better future to his family.

loans.use: to buy primary ingredients and continue providing ice cream to his customers

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is 46 years old and married with five children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He has operated a general merchandise shop, selling at a retail price, for four years now. He is also a farmer and deals in timber cutting in order to increase his income. Christopher has a dream of educating his children and lifting his family to a desired standard of living. However, he is faced with the challenge of limited capital. Christopher wants money to buy rice, sugar, cassava flour and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cassava flour and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
A sra Isabel de 27 anos de idade, é casada e mãe de 02 filhos que estão na sua responsabilidade. Vive em casa dos seus pais e conta com ajuda dos seus irmaos nas despesas familiares. 
Com o empréstimo, pretende comprar cervejas, refrigerantes, carnes, feijao, arroz , azeite para revender na sua mercaria, porém, o seu sonho é construir uma mercearia grande para fornecer quase todos os produtos da 1ª necessidade aos residentes da sua comunidade.
Apesar de enfrentar dificuldades financeiras, o seu desafio é reembolsar o crédito dentro do prazo acordado
texts.en: Isabel, age 27, is married and the mother of two children, both of whom are her responsibility. She lives in her parents' house and counts on the support of her sisters to cover the household expenses. With this loan she plans to buy beers, soft drinks, meat, beans, rice, and oil to sell in her market. Her dream is to build a big market to provide for almost all the daily necessities of the people in her neighborhood.  Despite the financial difficulties she faces, her chief objective will be to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy beers, soft drinks, meat, beans, rice, and oil to sell in her market.

loans.name: Joaquim

texts.pt:
O senhor Joaquim, tem 42 anos de idade, casado e pai de 05 filhos dos quais 04 frequentam o ensino secundário e primário, respectivamente e 01 ainda é menor de idade. Para além dos seus filhos, vive com uma enteada que também está na sua responsabildade.
Com o presente empréstimo será aplicado para comprar material de construção como cimento, pedra, area, varrões para a construção do muro de vedaçao da sua casa. Ele sonha em concluir a sua casa e o seu muro de modo a acomodar a sua esposa e os seus filhos.  Tem o desafio de reembolsar o empréstimo dentro do prazo estipulado.
texts.en: Joaquim, age 42, is married and the father of five children, four of whom are in school and one of whom is not yet school-aged. Aside from his children, he lives with a stepdaughter who is also his responsibility. With this loan he plans to buy construction materials like cement, stone, gravel, and beams to build a security wall for his house. His dream is to finish with this work to better look after his wife and children. His main objective will be to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement, stone, gravel, and beams to build a security wall for his house.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is married and works hard to help provide for her family, especially her children. For the past 11 years, she has run her own school supplies shop, and has made a good living doing so.

Belen has taken out and successfully repaid previous loans for her business through CCT. To improve sales, she is applying for a 30,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of school/office supplies to sell.

Belen is determined to earn a greater income so she can better provide for her family. She sincerely wishes to give you her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for any assistance in advance.

All CCT community clients, including Belen, are organized into fellowship groups of 15 to 30 members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to pay for school/office supplies to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had entrenched her business. She was able to grow her fund used for her food stall business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenses.

She is very positive that she could improve her business even more if you will lend her an amount of 15,000 PHP. This new loan will go to more raw ingredients and supplies she needs to make more viands and food she sells so she can increase her profit from business. An increase in profit will also result for her business to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her business, Lourdes aims to build their house through all her hard work in business. She also wants their lives to be improved and successful. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is 46 years old and married with five children.

Ritchel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ritchel requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed, medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Ritchel has been raising pigs for six years and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF and more recently from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 47 years old and married with six children.  With two children still in school, Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, sugar, milk, bread, etc.

Ann has been in this business for 7 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, sugar, milk, bread, etc

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 31 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, chips, etc.

Rowena has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from buy and sell rice.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, chips, etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel used his previous loan to buy more crates of beer and soda to sell. He is a hard-working divorced man with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He earns a living from his bar business, which he started to look after his children. He still faces hardships of inadequate capital and scarcity of resources. His dream is to diversify his business.

He intends to use the loan to buy more crates of beer and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 43 years old and married with five children.

Cristina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like shampoo, noodles, canned goods, spices, bread, etc.

Cristina has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Cristina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like shampoo, noodles, canned goods, spices, bread, etc

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: HELLO! Meet Jane, who is 35 years old, and is very hardworking, honest and humble. She hails from Nyamira, Kenya - an area that is blessed with elite and world renowned runners, and also the best weather patterns that favor farming activities. Jane is a proud mother of three children that she really loves and adores and will do anything in her power to always give them the best. She has been farming for the past 10 years and through these years she has always provided them with all the basic needs that they require. Jane practices mixed farming - that is crop and animal farming, and through these two she has been able to support her family, but she still faces challenges, which is why she wants to diversify and start poultry farming so that she can make ends meet. She is seeking a loan to buy poultry. She believes that through the increased income she will be able to comfortably take care of her family and assure her grandchildren-to-come of a secure future. Jane has experienced difficulties in acquiring funds to start her poultry business, but she now feels relieved knowing that Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and other lenders to support aspiring women like her to be economically empowered and be able to realize their dreams. Because of the many years that Jane has had in farming, she has learned the culture of saving and being honest with money She hopes through the loan she will be able to save more and repay the loan on time. She believes that the loan will assist her to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children.

loans.use: To pay for poultry

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 37 year-old man who is married with six children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. Wilson used his previous loan to buy fertilizer and pay for labor. He will be growing maize, cotton and coffee so as to produce better agriculture products. He is a boda boda rider where he gets additional income to care for his family's daily expenditures. He is a hardworking man despite the challenges of pests and diseases plus seasonal weather changes.

Wilson is requesting a loan to buy seeds, pesticides and pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides and pay for labour.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 39 year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in bananas and coffee selling as his main source of income. He also earns extra income from farming. His challenge is inadequate capital to fully fund his business. He has ambitions of raising money to build a personal permanent house and educating his children. 

He is requesting for a loan to buy manure and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.en:
Faustino, who is a thirty-year-old married man with two children, lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy materials to make more bricks to sell. His main business is still brick making, but he also sells goats and sheep in order to earn additional income. He still has hardships of weather, especially the rainy season, when his bricks take a long time to dry, yet he expects a constant income. His dream is to have a machine for making bricks. 

Faustino intends to use the loan to buy more goats to sell.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia es una mujer de 47 años de edad, cada, tiene 2 hijos varones de 17 y 22 años, y su negocio es la venta de material escolar en una librería.
Ella es buena madre, buena oyente, paciente, de buena actitud, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Mururata’ una zona residencial industrial, caracterizada por las diferentes fábricas en todas las áreas dónde los empleados construyeron sus casas en los alrededores para vivir cerca de su trabajo, urbanizando el área y creando escuelas plazas y todo lo necesario para convivir, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-16 grados centígrados.
Teodosia es de piel morena, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), y su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en compañía de su esposo que trabaja como empleado en una fábrica de refrescos y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia y trabaja y el menor estudia en la escuela. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, alcantarillado, gas domiciliario y electricidad, esta se encuentra ubicada frente a un colegio, por ese motivo inicio su negocio de venta de artículos de librería, como; lápices, bolígrafos, cuadernos, hojas blancas, papel de colores, reglas, marcadores, etc. Labor que realiza durante todo el día de lunes a sábado, en esta actividad también participa su hijo menor que combina la escuela con la atención de la librería, los domingos lo dedican a la familia; realizando paseos, y limpieza del hogar. Sus artículos de librería tienen ventas constantes debido a que los alumnos del colegio se acercan constantemente a comprar, las ventas bajan en época de vacaciones, utilizando esas fechas para realizar el inventario y reposición de los materiales faltantes. “mis hijos me ayudan en la atención de la librería, comenzamos con muy poco material, actualmente el ambiente quedó pequeño por la cantidad y variedad de materiales escolares a la venta…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una librería grande y bien consolidada. Ella desea abastecer su stock con material escolar como libros, textos escolares, cuentos, cuadernos, lápices, reglas y otros, para ofertar y cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Teodosia solicita un préstamo para la compra de material escolar para abastecer su librería y ofertar a los alumnos del colegio con todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Teodosia is a 47 year old woman who has two sons who are 17 and 22 years old. Her business is the sale of school supplies in a library.

She is a good mother, a good listener, patient, has a good attitude, and is responsible and hardworking. Her business was made in the industrial residential area of 'Mururata', which is characterized by different factories in all the areas where the employees build their homes in the surrounding areas to live near their work. They have urbanized the area and creates school, plazas, and everything they need to live. It is a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 0-16 degrees Celsius. 

Teodosia has dark skin, dark eyes, short stature, long black braided hair, and a robust physique. Her form of dress is traditional (hat, blanket, and skirt), and her maternal language is Aymará which she speaks with her family. She speaks Spanish generally and for the business she created. She lives her life in the company of her husband who works as an employee in a soda factory with his sons. The older son studies and working and the youngest studies in school. They live in their own house made of brick and cement with a tin roof and that has potable water, sewage, gas and electricity. They house is located in front of a college, and this is why she started her business of selling library items in the library, such as pencils, pens, notebooks, white paper, colored paper, rulers, markers, etc. 

She works all day Monday through Saturday, and her younger son works in this activity and combines school with caring for the library. Sundays are spent with the family, conducting tours and cleaning the house. She has consistent sales of her articles in the library because the college students consistently come to buy. Sales drop during the holidays, but she uses this time to take inventory and replace missing materials. She says "My children help me in caring for the library, starting with very little material, currently the environment was too small for the amount and variety of school supplies for sale...". Her dream is to have a large and well-established library. She desires to increase her stock of school supplies such as books, textbooks, stories, notebooks, pencils, and rulers, etc. to offer and meet the needs of her customers. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in 15 years that has been doing this activity.

It is for these reasons that Teodosia is applying for a loan to buy school supplies to supply her library and offer college students everything they need.

loans.use: to buy school supplies to supply her library and offer college students everything they need.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Sophorn, 58, resides in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has two children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland, which is located in her community. She has been in this type of business for ten years. She is able to make an earning of USD 2.00 a day.

Currently, she would like to request a KIVA loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in livestock and farming. He has been a farmer for the past fifteen years, where he mainly grows bananas. He faces bad weather challenges and scarcity of resources to buy more cows to resell. He has hopes of becoming a rich man and owning a big banana and coffee plantation.  

He is requesting a loan to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.name: Sok Ry

texts.en:
Sok Ry (pictured) is 35 years. She lives in Posen Chey district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has been married since 2007 and has two sons. One is married and they are attending school.

Sok Ry is a garment factory worker with two years experience, while her husband has been a construction worker for four years. She is applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle to take to her work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to take to her work.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 62 years old and a widow with seven children. For the past 26 years she has worked hard buying and selling native products in the Philippines to provide for her family.

Elsie has successfully borrowed and repaid eleven prior loans from NWTF. She has now applied for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy more brooms, rags, coconut husks, etc. to sell. She saves her money to continually expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more brooms, rags, coconut husks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a 39-year-old married woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She raises pigs and cattle to earn an income. The increasing price of pig feed is a challenge for her.

With a previous loan she bought dairy cows for her farm. She has now requested a 4,000,000 UGX loan through HOFOKAM to buy pig feed. Her goal is to expand her stock in order to boost her income.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Vuthy, 29, is single and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. For the past three years he has worked as an auto mechanic, earning an average income of 8 USD a day.

Vuthy wants to pursue his bachelor's degree, but he can’t afford the tuition. He is therefore applying for a 300 USD loan through HKL to pay his university fees. With the support of this loan, he hopes to achieve a higher education and establish a better career in the future.

Vuthy is thankful for Kiva loans granted through HKL, as they charge a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Elvira works hard to support her family.

She has a business farming sugarcane in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods. Elvira is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her sugarcane farming business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 43 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Hello world! This is Mary, a woman with grand aspirations who is humble and grateful. She lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, renowned for its rolling hills carpeted in manicured tea plantations. Mary is the mother of 3 lovely children and she has been in the agriculture business for 15 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and vegetables. Mary has been relying on agriculture to provide all her income. However, the rising costs of farming inputs (such as for fertilizers) and fluctuations in market prices are some of the serious challenges that are cutting farmers' profits significantly. Despite these tough conditions, Mary remains positive and passionate about her economic activity. 

Mary is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This will enable her to expand the section of business least affected by harsh external conditions. Poultry farming is cheaper to run and the demand for chicken products is always high. With this loan, Mary will be able to increase the sales from her poultry business and make more profits. An increase in income for her will be timely since it will enable her to tackle high farm-related costs next season. This will greatly improve the quality of her work since the cost of every input will be adequately met. As a result, she will realize better quality produce and more yields. This loan will support Mary’s economic activity, and will improve her family’s living standards as well.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 40 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Marivic works very hard to provide for them.

Marivic runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits, beer, cereals, coffee, etc., to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits, beer, cereals, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits, beer, cereals, coffee, etc., to sell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 43 years old and has four children. Elisa is married, and one child is still in school.

Elisa is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Elisa requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Elisa has been in her business for four years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 44 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct selling of Tupperware products business in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of Tupperware products to sell.

Joy has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been direct selling Tupperware products for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling herbal medicine and from motorcycle transport.

Joy aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of Tupperware products to sell

loans.name: Ema

texts.en:
Ema, 44, is a married woman with three children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ema has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Ema has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn, 51, is a married woman with nine children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marlyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marlyn has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell to her customers for her fruit-vending business.

Gina has been in this business for eight years. Gina earns additional income from a general store.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en:
Ezra is a 60-year-old married man with 11 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He grows tea and sells it, and at the same time, earns a salary that adds more income. He is faced with the challenge of price fluctuations that hinder growth of his tea business. Besides that, he hopes to expand his tea farm in order to produce more tea and earn more income. 

He has asked for a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Kalemkan

texts.ru: Калемкан 56 лет, вдова, имеет 2 детей. Калемкан в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1992 году с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Калемкан, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 4 коровы, на ежедневной основе она продает молоко. Также на участке 1,44 Га она выращивает люцерну, заготавливая их на зиму в качестве корма для скота, а также на реализацию. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Калемкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 100 тюков сена для скота, таким образом она сохранит поголовье и получит весной здоровый приплод. Также сможет улучшить благосостояние ее семьи. Доходы от кредита Калемкан планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Kalemkan is 56 years old, a widow, and she has two children.  She has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture since 1992, and this activity constitutes her family's main source of income.  She started in this business with an initial capital of 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has four cows on her farm and she sells milk on a daily basis.  On 1.44 hectare of land, she also grows alfalfa which she sells and also stores as feed for her livestock in preparation for the winter.   In order to further develop her business, Kalemkan has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) to buy 100 bales of hay for her livestock.  This will allow her to keep her herd and to have healthy offsprings by the time spring comes in.  This loan will also help her to improve her family's well-being.  Kalemkan is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business.

loans.use: to buy 100 bales of hay as feed for her livestock, in order to help bolster her income.

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Thoeun (pictured) is 59 years old. Widowed, she lives in Khsach Kandal, Kandal province district, Cambodia. She has one son and one daughter .They are students.

Thoeun has been a weaver for thirty years of her own experience.  She would like to apply for a loan to buy silk for weaving and to repair her house.  She hopes that she will pay back Maxima on time.

loans.use: to buy silk for weaving and to repair her house.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмира, 54 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Гульмиры высшее образование. Она по характеру: доброжелательная и ответственная. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес 20 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду, Гульмира в хозяйстве имеет: 4 дойные коровы, 2 бычка, 2 нетели, 2 лошади. А также есть земельный надел мерою 3,0 ГА, на котором она выращивает клевер и клубнику. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем хочет накопить на пышную свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Gulmira is 54 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  She has a college education and by nature, she is friendly and responsible.  She has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture for many years, two activities that constitute her family's main source of income.  She started in this business 20 years ago.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has four dairy cows, two young bulls, two heifers and two horses.  She also grows clover and strawberries on three hectares of land.  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy three cows.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further expand her farming business.  In the future, she also wants to save enough money to treat her son to a lavish wedding ceremony.

loans.use: to purchase three cows in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 55 years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, Felomina works very hard to provide for them.

Felomina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Felomina has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as toothpaste, cereals, chocolate drinks, juice, canned goods, sugar, salt, etc. 

In the future, Felomina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marygrace

texts.en:
Marygrace is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marygrace is 41 years old and all of her children are in school.

Marygrace has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Marygrace requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

Marygrace has been in this business for two years. In the future, Marygrace would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 41 years old and married with eight children, four of whom are in school, Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc. to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for 16 years.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, rice, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Marekhi

texts.en:
Marekhi is a 29-year-old married woman from the village of Kakhati.  She has a husband, two sons and a father-in-law, who is the only breadwinner in the family. He works as a taxi driver and gets a small income. There is a high unemployment rate in the region and thus Marekhi and her husband were unable to find any stable job. Because of the above-mentioned situation, Marekhi plans to start a private business that will satisfy her family's increased needs. She requested a loan to local financial institutions, but she lacks access to capital markets to obtain credit for starting her business, as they require a stable income and business experience.  The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Marekhi to get a loan of 4,300 USD for purchasing a mini-bus. Her husband will work on a bus line and will get the opportunity to make significant income that will cover most of the needs of the family. 

Marekhi and her husband rely on the good will of Kiva lenders and will highly appreciate the help, as their family's living condition will significantly increase because of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a mini-bus and make business income

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang (shown in photo) is 47 years old, a widow, and lives in Khsach Kandal district, Kandal province, Cambodia. She has two daughters - one is married and the other lives with her.

Neang has been a weaver for 20 years, while her daughter is a waitress with 3 years of experience at a private company. Neang is applying for a loan to repair her house because it is so old.

She strongly hopes that she will save some money with her daughter to pay back to Maxima, Kiva's loan partner, on time. Moreover she will improve her house.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is a married woman who is 53 years old with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Florentina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Florentina has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar and spices for her food production business.

Florentina has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar and spices for her food production business.

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri is a 48-year-old, married man from the village of Tskhramukha. He has a pensioner mother, a wife, a son and a daughter. 

The family earns a living through agriculture. In particular, they own one dairy cow and a plot of agricultural land, where they harvest beans and maize. Badri realizes income from selling their agricultural products in the local market, and this is the main source of the family's income. His wife helps him greatly in his everyday activities related to agribusiness. 

However, the income is seasonal and the family requires a more stable source to cover all their basic needs. Badri needs financial support to purchase a stock of products and to have money for working capital in order to start a trading business with various kinds of shoes. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Badri will purchase a stock of shoes at wholesale prices in the capital, where the country's open market is located, and then he will sell locally at increased prices. The loan will greatly assist him and he will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better standard of living.

loans.use: To start trading with shoes and get an additional source of income

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is 46 years old and has three children. Dioscora is married and has one child who is still in school.

Dioscora is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Dioscora has requested a loan of 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her business.

Dioscora has been in the pig fattening business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 26 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Dioscora would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Loeng

texts.en:
Loeng (in the photo) is a 57-year-old widow who lives in the Khsach Kandal district, Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has one daughter, who is married and lives with her in her house.

Loeng has been selling rice, porridge and Vietnamese pancakes for twelve years. Her daughter is a construction worker at a private company and has four years' experience. 

Now Loeng would like to apply for a loan to buy farmed mangoes to sell at the market. Over time she will earn more money to support her family.

loans.use: To buy farmed mangoes to sell at the market

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita works hard to support her family. Isabelita is married and has a bamboo furniture making business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more materials such as bamboo, nails and paint for her business.

Isabelita has been in this business for 12 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials such as bamboo, nails and paint for her business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 30 years old, single and has one child. She is in the pig rearing business in the Philippines. Imelda has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 55 years old and has two children. Fe is widowed and one of her children is in school.

Fe is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Fe requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of feed and vitamins for her livestock

Fe has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feed and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Meldy

texts.en:
Meldy is a 37-year-old married woman with eight children, five of whom are in school.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Meldy has a coconut vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock of coconut to sell. She has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Meldy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of coconut to sell

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 47 years old and married with five children.

Jasmin works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like shampoo, noodles, canned goods, spices, coffee, etc.

Jasmin has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like shampoo, noodles, canned goods, spices, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for poultry.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 38-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jocelyn has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Ninfa works hard to support her family.

She has a rice mill business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Ninfa is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her rice mill business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and has now requested another loan to further build her business.

Ninfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her rice mill.

loans.name: Ma. Janel

texts.en: Ma. Janel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts and for maintenance for her motorcycle transportation. She has been in this business for 2 years now, and also earns additional income from her general store. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and for maintenance for her motorcycle transportation.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.en: Ceferina is 58 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. Ceferina has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, canned goods, candies, biscuits, coffee and sugar. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 67 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 19,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock of items such as rice, soap and sardines to sell.

Pacita has borrowed and paid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport and farming sugarcane. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of items such as rice, soap and sardines to sell.

loans.name: Los Gigantes De Santiago De Chacan Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS GIGANTES DE SANTIAGO DE CHACAN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco

La socia es la Sra. Lucia ella es casada y tiene 32 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “Los gigantes de Santiago de Chacán” communal bank, in the Anta district and province of the Cusco department, Peru.

One member of the group is 32-year-old Lucia. She is married and has two children. She has a business raising and selling animals. She raises and fattens up hens and guinea pigs and then sells them at different markets. This small business allows Lucia to move forward with her children. Lucia’s dream is to have premises where she can sell her hens and guinea pigs. She is applying for this loan in order to buy guinea pigs, hens, and animal feed.

The other members of this group have the following types of business: selling animals, selling cereals, a grocery shop, and a restaurant.

Lucia is grateful to those who, through this loan, are making her dreams come true. She promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, hens, and animal feed.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 59 years old and married with three children. Milagros works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like dried fish, canned goods, and groceries.

Milagros has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, Milagros would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like dried fish, canned goods, and groceries.

loans.name: Maria Teodora

texts.es:
María tiene más de 5 años de dedicarse a la venta de cosméticos y productos de aseo personal;  gracias a los préstamos que  Mi crédito le ha facilitado.  Ella se siente agradecida pues con el último préstamo pudo cumplir con los encargos de sus clientes, comprar más productos y en consiguiente pudo aumentar su capital de trabajo y ofrecer mayor variedad. 

Ahora, ella solicita un nuevo financiamiento para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio con la compra de shampoos, acondicionadores, cremas, lociones, etc. Además, dicho préstamo también le ayudaría para atraer más clientes y ofrecer mayor variedad, ya que ella como vendedora debe ofrecer productos que se ajusten a los gustos y necesidades de los consumidores.
texts.en:
Thanks to the loans from Mi Crédito, María has more than five years’ experience selling cosmetics and personal hygiene products. She is very grateful as her last loan allowed her to fulfil orders from her customers, buy more products, increase working capital, and offer a greater variety of products.

Now María is applying for another loan in order to continue investing in her business. She will use it to buy shampoo, conditioner, lotions and more. In addition, this loan will help María to attract more customers and offer a greater variety of products. As a vendor, she must offer products that match the tastes and needs of consumers.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, conditioner, lotions and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy material like thread, clasps, beads and charms among other things to make costume jewelry

loans.name: Las Luchadoras De Vista Alegre Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LAS LUCHADORAS DE VISTA ALEGRE.
La socia María Celestina alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de internet, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de una maquina.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank LAS LUCHADORAS DE VISTA ALEGRE.

Maria Celestina alternates her daily activities with an Internet business she has been running for some time thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She is a responsible, determined person who wants to continue working to support her family.

The loan she is requesting is for equipment maintenance.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To pay for equipment maintenance.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Roberta works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell herbal products business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a buy-and-sell charcoal and general store. Roberta is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional herbal products to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and has now requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Roberta has been sustaining her business activities through the past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional herbal products to sell.

loans.name: Eddys  Antonio

texts.es:
Eddys es un joven emprendedor que desde su adolescencia aprendió el oficio de zapatero y años después puso su negocio de venta de plasticos juntoa sus zapateria con ayuda de su mamá. Él se siente agradecido pues gracias al financiamiento, que la micro financiera Mi Crédito junto con Kiva le dieron, pudo comprar diversidad de articulos plasticos materia prima para la elaboración y repuestos de zapatos. 
En la actualidad, cuenta con una amplia demanda porque es el único zapatero de su zona, por ello solicita un nuevo préstamo para abastecerse de materiales básicos como: cuero, plásticos, hilos, y hormas de zapatos. Eddys espera hacer cada día más rentable su negocio y ahorrar para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Eddys is a young entrepreneur who learnt the profession of shoemaker as a teenager, and years later he set up his plastics sales and shoe business with the help of his mom. He is very grateful for this and then thanks to the financing provided through the Mi Crédito microfinance organisation in partnership with Kiva, he was able to buy a range of plastic articles that are the raw material for making and repairing shoes.

Today, there is wide demand for his work because he is the only shoemaker in his area, therefore he is requesting another loan to stock up on basic materials such as: leather, plastics, threads and shoe lasts. Eddys hopes to make his business more profitable day by day and to save for home improvements.

loans.use: to stock up on basic materials such as: leather, plastics, thread and shoe lasts

loans.name: Señor De Qoyllority De Chimpahuaylla Group

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE QOYLLORITY DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA, el banco es ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia Estefanía  tiene 30 años de edad tiene 2 hijos y es conviviente, la socia  alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros, la socia vende su mercadería a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, gaseosas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican al reciclaje, venta de leña, brindado el servicio de taxi, venta de emolientes, crianza de gallinas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Señor de Qoyllority de Chimpahuaylla" which is located in the department of Cusco.  Estefania, 30, lives with her partner and two children.  She alternates her daily activities with running a grocery store where she sells rice, sugar, milk, etc.  This is how she earns an income to provide for the family.

The loan she is requesting is to buy rice, sodas, etc.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

The other members are involved in recycling, firewood sales, taxi services, emollient sales and raising chickens.

loans.use: To buy rice, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Los Jardines Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Los Jardines está integrado por tres socios laboriosos que a diario llegan al mercado de la municipalidad a ofrecer sus productos, con el objetivo que no les haga falta el alimento diario a sus familias, para cumplir con este objetivo solicitan el financiamiento en ADIM por vigésima tercera ocasión, ya que con los créditos anteriores han logrado aumentar los productos y por ende sus ingresos. Quien lo coordina es el señor Luis que a sus 55 años de edad ha dedicado veinticuatro años de su vida en la comercialización  de tamales y frutas en el mercado de la municipalidad, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa para la venta de estos productos y el crédito actual lo solicita para invertir en chiltoma, cebolla, tomate, maíz, etc., asegura que aunque existen días en que la demanda es mayor, también hay días con poca demanda, pero que sabe sobrellevar estos momentos, pues ha aprendido que no todo en la vida es perfecto, con los créditos anteriores ha logrado diversificar los productos ofrecidos por lo que tiene más amplio el local donde los comercializa. El resto de las integrantes son las señoras, Gilma que tiene la edad de 42 años y se dedica a la comercialización de perecederos, este negocio lo aprendió desde que era una joven y ha dedicado treinta años de su vida a este negocio, y Juana de 50 años de edad, comerciante de frutas desde hace quince años.
texts.en:
The Los Jardines [The Gardens] Solidarity Group consists of three members who sell their produce every day at the town market in order to put food on the family table. To meet their goal they are requesting a loan through ADIM for the 23rd time.  Their previous loans have been used to increase the amount of produce they sell, hence their income.

The coordinator is Luis, 54, who has dedicated 24 years of his life to selling tamales and fruit at the municipal market.  His wife helps with sales and the current loan he is requesting is to buy sweet peppers, onions, tomatoes, corn, etc.  He says there are still days when demand is higher or lower but he knows he can deal with it all because he has learned that everything in life in not perfect.  With the previous loans he was able to diversify his products and now has a larger stand.

The other members of the group are Gilma, who is 42 and also sells produce which she learned to do when she was young.  She has been in business for 30 years.   The other member is Juana, 50, who has been selling fruit for 15 years.

loans.use: To buy sweet peppers, onions, tomatoes, corn, etc., which are the most popular goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Jolinda

texts.en:
Jolinda works hard to support her family. Jolinda is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jolinda has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Jolinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cecilia is 41 years old and four of her children are currently in school.
