Cecilia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Cecilia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Cecilia has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Cecilia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure, leaf treatment, fertilizers, etc. for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 51 years old and married with six children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Sandra has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Sandra has requested a 25,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new kitchenware and ingredients for her restaurant.

Sandra has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Sandra would like to build and expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new kitchenware and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 29 years old and married with five children. With three children currently in school, Liza works very hard to provide for them.

Liza runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock of items such as bath soap, noodles, sugar, shampoo, fabric conditioner, eggs and bread to sell. She has been in this business for 9 years and sells a variety of items such as bath soap, noodles, sugar, shampoo, fabric conditioner, eggs and bread. 

In the future, Liza would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of items such as bath soap, noodles, sugar, shampoo, fabric conditioner, eggs and bread to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Teresa who is a farming woman and a fighter, pushing ahead at age 60. She is a very hard-working and self-driven farmer who is based in Keera, a remote village in Nyamira. This region has harsh weather patterns, and poultry farming is the only profitable business venture that thrives. Teresa is happily married and blessed with two children. For the past 25 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been selling milk and crop farming. She passionately loves poultry farming. When asked what is most enjoyable about farming, her reply was “selling eggs”. Her biggest challenge is the lack of funds to increase her poultry farming. She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Poultry farming is the only business that thrives in the Nyamira area because of the harsh weather patterns, so she wants to take full advantage of the poultry business. Teresa is a member of Kiangoma self-help group and through the group, she has received training on financial management and saving. Through the loan, she will sell eggs to the local market and to her neighbors, hence improving her living conditions and getting out of the poverty situation she is in currently. Profits from the loan will be used in repaying back the loan and increasing her business.
Help out this heroine!

loans.use: to pay for poultry.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman. She has no children. Monica owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her area.
 
With the loan of 30,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, tiene 10 años de experiencias cultivando ya que su padre fue quien le enseño ese trabajo, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra en la fotografía para luego comercializarlos en los en los alrededores de la zona, el joven es padre soltero vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, formula, sulfato y herbicidas, para poder aumentar la producción con el objetivo de poder mantener a sus hija y darles lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
This young borrower, whose face has been pixelated because he is 29 years old and lives in a high-risk area, makes a living growing corn and sorghum. He has ten years’ experience growing these crops, having learned the trade from his father. When his harvest is ready, the borrower stores his crops at the granaries shown in the photo in order to sell them later on in the surrounding areas. 

This borrower is a single father. He lives in a house that he owns with his two daughters. He is applying for a loan in order to buy manure, fertilisers, sulphate and weed-killer. This will allow him to increase production, and thus support his daughters and give them everything that they need.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilisers, sulphate and weed-killer.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma, a 46-year-old micro-entrepreneur from Pasay City, Philippines, has been running her food stall for five years, and she makes a good income from this. Having a big family requires a lot of effort to provide for everyone’s needs. She is married and she and her husband are determined to work hard to provide their children with a better education than they currently have.

Vilma operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to partake of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend on cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Vilma is taking out a 25,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasoning. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

In the future, she hopes to grow her business, and through it she will be able to give her children the best for their future.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to make improvements to her stall and to buy the necessary ingredients to make more viands.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 35 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general loan in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, soap, milk and sugar to sell. Mylene has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, soap, milk and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Maria Joan

texts.en:
Maria Joan is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maria Joan is 37 years old and all of her children are in school.

Maria Joan has a charcoal retail business in the Philippines. Maria Joan has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of charcoal to sell. She has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida is 52 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Bienvenida has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jennefer

texts.en:
Jennefer is single and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other fishing equipment. She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Jennefer would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el es un hombre muy trabajador, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, adicional trabaja como jornal cerca de su casa, tiene 16 años de experiencia y es la forma más común para ganarse la vida en la zona donde el reside ya que es una zona de cultivos, vende sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene muchos clientes, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía y así poder seguir trabajando para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan lives in a privately-owned house with his family. He is hard-working and earns a living growing corn and sorghum. He also works as a labourer at a job near to his home. Juan has 16 years’ experience in this work. Agriculture is the most common way to earn a living in Juan’s local area. Juan sells his products in neighbouring towns and has many customers.

Juan is applying for a loan in order to buy fertilisers, manure, anti-pest controls, and to improve his land, which is shown in the photograph. With this loan, he can continue working in order to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, manure, anti-pest controls, and to improve his land.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos (maíz y frijol),  su padre fue quien le enseño este trabajo por esa razón posee desde hace ya más de 20 años experiencia en el rubro, el esposo también le ayuda con el trabajo, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía y así poder seguir con su trabajo para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old and lives in a privately-owned house with her husband and son. María makes a living growing basic grains (corn and beans). She learned the trade from her father and has more than 20 years’ experience in the field as a result. María’s husband helps her with his work. María sells her products at different markets and uses her profits to get ahead in life.

María is applying for a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-pest controls, and to improve her land, which is shown in the photo. She can thus continue with her work in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-pest controls, and to improve her land.

loans.name: Pedro Noel

texts.es: Pedro de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de arroz pues de ahí obtiene sus ingresos, tiene 20 años de experiencia en el rubro, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona y ya tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de productos agrícolas para la preparación el suelo en donde sea cultivar que es el que muestra la fotografía y asi poder mejorar su calidad de vida y a de su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 45 years old and lives in a privately-owned house with his two children. He makes a living growing rice. He has more than 20 years’ experience in the field. He sells his products in the area around his home and has many customers. He is able to cover some household costs with his profits.

Pedro is applying for a loan in order to buy farming supplies to prepare his land, which is shown in the photograph. With this loan, Pedro will be able to improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to prepare his land.
